original: dus gsum la mkhas pa bshad pa'i 'og tu theg pa kun la mkhas pa bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: dus gsum la mkhas pa bshad pa'i 'og tu theg pa kun la mkhas pa bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: After explaining expertise in the three times, in order to explain expertise in all vehicles as taught,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa thams cad la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa thams cad la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: it asks, “What is a bodhisattva’s expertise in all vehicles?”

original: theg pa thams cad la mkhas pa ni theg pa kun la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa thams cad la mkhas pa ni theg pa kun la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Expertise in all vehicles is expertise in all vehicles.

original: theg pa thams cad kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu phyin ca ma log par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa thams cad kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu phyin ca ma log par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the unmistaken realization of the causes, natures, and results of all vehicles.

original: de la theg pa thams cad ni bsdus na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la theg pa thams cad ni bsdus na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In this regard, all vehicles are, in brief, of two kinds:

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i theg pa dang / 'jig rten gyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i theg pa dang / 'jig rten gyi theg pa'o //
translated: the supramundane vehicle and the mundane vehicle.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i theg pa bstan pa bzhed nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i theg pa bstan pa bzhed nas /
translated: With the intention of teaching the supramundane vehicle,

original: gsum po 'di dag ni theg pa ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni theg pa ste /
translated: it says, “These three are vehicles

original: nges par 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: that definitely deliver.”

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa 'di gsum ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i theg pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa 'di gsum ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i theg pa zhes bya ste /
translated: These three vehicles, the Śrāvaka Vehicle, the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, and the Bodhisattva Vehicle, are called the supramundane vehicles.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'khor ba las 'byin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'khor ba las 'byin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because they cause one to leave cyclic existence.

original: 'jig rten gyi theg pa bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi theg pa bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: The mundane vehicles are taught.

original: gzhan yang theg pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang theg pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two other vehicles.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /🔽lha'i theg pa dang mi'i theg pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //🔽de la lha rnams kyi thag pa yin pas na lha'i theg pa dang / mi rnams kyi theg pa yin pas na mi'i theg pa 'am /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na / lha'i theg pa dang mi'i theg pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o // de la lha rnams kyi thag pa yin pas na lha'i theg pa dang / mi rnams kyi theg pa yin pas na mi'i theg pa 'am /
translated: What are the two?🔽The vehicle of the gods and the vehicle of humans.🔽The vehicle of the gods is so called because it is the vehicle of the gods, and the vehicle of humans is so called because it is the vehicle of humans.

original: lhar 'gyur ba'i theg pa dang / mir 'gyur ba'i theg pa ni lha'i theg pa dang mi'i theg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhar 'gyur ba'i theg pa dang / mir 'gyur ba'i theg pa ni lha'i theg pa dang mi'i theg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, the vehicle of the gods is the vehicle that leads to becoming a god, and the vehicle of humans is the vehicle that leads to becoming a human.

original: de la lha'i sgras ni rgyal chen bzhi la sogs pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha rnams bsdu'o //🔽theg pa'i sgras ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed srog gcod pa las phyir log pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zag @147b pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang /
analyzed: de la lha'i sgras ni rgyal chen bzhi la sogs pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha rnams bsdu'o // theg pa'i sgras ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed srog gcod pa las phyir log pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zag @147b pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang /
translated: The term “gods” includes the six gods of the desire realm such as the Catur­mahārājika gods, the gods of the form realm, and the gods of the formless realm such as Ākāśānantyāyatana.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi mi g-yo ba nye bar 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi mi g-yo ba nye bar 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rnams bsdus te /
translated: The term “vehicles” includes the meritorious formations that are the path of the ten virtues such as turning away from killing, the four concentrations of the realm of form such as “conjoined with investigation and analysis,” and the four formless absorptions such as “infinite space” that are characterized by being unmoving and approaching the highest.

original: 'du byed de gnyis kyis lha'i gnas de dag thob par byed cing der 'gro bas na lha'i theg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed de gnyis kyis lha'i gnas de dag thob par byed cing der 'gro bas na lha'i theg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since those two formations cause one to obtain and go to those divine abodes, it is called the vehicle of the gods.

original: mi'i sgras ni gling bzhin gnas pa'i skyes pa dang bud med ces bya ba la sogs pa bsdus te /
analyzed: mi'i sgras ni gling bzhin gnas pa'i skyes pa dang bud med ces bya ba la sogs pa bsdus te /
translated: The word human refers to men and women living on the four continents.

original: theg pa'i sgras ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi rang bzhin bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed la bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa'i sgras ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi rang bzhin bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed la bya'o //
translated: The word vehicle refers to the formations that lead to merit, which have the nature of the ten virtues.

original: kha cig na re bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po rnams kyis kyang ngan song gsum du 'gro zhing skye bar byed pas 'dis 'gro ba dang 'dir 'gro ba zhes bya ba la
analyzed: kha cig na re bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po rnams kyis kyang ngan song gsum du 'gro zhing skye bar byed pas 'dis 'gro ba dang 'dir 'gro ba zhes bya ba la
translated: Some say: Since the ten unvirtuous actions such as taking life lead to the three lower rebirths and cause birth there, they are called going and going there.

original: sogs pa theg par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yong na 'dir 'jig rten pa'i theg pa'i nang du ngan song gsum rnams ci'i phyir theg pa ma bsdus she na ;
analyzed: sogs pa theg par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yong na 'dir 'jig rten pa'i theg pa'i nang du ngan song gsum rnams ci'i phyir theg pa ma bsdus she na ;
translated: If they have the characteristics of being taught as vehicles, why are the three lower rebirths not included in the mundane vehicle?

original: theg pa zhes bya ba'i don ni rgyus bde ba skyed par byed pa dang / 'bras bu'i tshe 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i snod du rung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa zhes bya ba'i don ni rgyus bde ba skyed par byed pa dang / 'bras bu'i tshe 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i snod du rung ba la bya ste /
translated: The meaning of vehicle is that it generates happiness as a cause and is suitable as a vessel for realizing the noble truths at the time of the result.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la 'dis 'gro ba dang 'dir 'gro ba zhes bya ba bstan du rung yang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam gyi rgyu nyid sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa dang ; 'bras bu'i tshe na yang 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i snod du mi rung bas na theg pa zhes mi bya'o //🔽nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa bstan par bzhed nas de la byang chub sems dpa'i nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes dris pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la 'dis 'gro ba dang 'dir 'gro ba zhes bya ba bstan du rung yang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam gyi rgyu nyid sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa dang ; 'bras bu'i tshe na yang 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i snod du mi rung bas na theg pa zhes mi bya'o //🔽nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa bstan par bzhed nas de la byang chub sems dpa'i nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes dris pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Although it is suitable to teach that the ten nonvirtuous actions are a vehicle because one goes and goes by them, since the cause of the path of nonvirtuous actions generates suffering and at the time of the result it is not suitable as a vessel for realizing the noble truths, it is not called a vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mkhas par bya ba'i nyan thos kyi theg pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mkhas par bya ba'i nyan thos kyi theg pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The Bodhisattvas' expertise in the Sravakayana is their expertise in the Sravakayana.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the Sravakayana?

original: 'dis 'gro bas na theg pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis 'gro bas na theg pa ste /
translated: It is a vehicle because one goes by means of it.

original: gang gis 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis 'gro zhe na /
translated: By what means does one go?

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pas 'gro bas theg pa'i sgra ni bslab pa gsum la bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pas 'gro bas theg pa'i sgra ni bslab pa gsum la bya'o //
translated: One goes by means of the aggregate of morality, etc. Thus, the term vehicle refers to the three educations.

original: yang na 'dir 'gro bas na theg pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dir 'gro bas na theg pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is a vehicle because one goes by means of it.

original: des ni rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po la theg pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //🔽theg pa de'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs @148a * //
analyzed: des ni rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po la theg pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o // theg pa de'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs @148a * //
translated: Thus, the term vehicle refers to the aggregate of liberation and the aggregate of the insight into liberation.

original: pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Expertise in the Sravakayana is the unmistaken understanding of the characteristics, causes, etc. of that vehicle.

original: de'ang 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: de'ang 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: This will be explained below.

original: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa yang rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa yang rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The śrāvaka vehicle should be understood as having six aspects:

original: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rgyu dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bras bu dang / de rab tu rig pa'o //
analyzed: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rgyu dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bras bu dang / de rab tu rig pa'o //
translated: basis, object, cause, practice, result, and thorough knowledge.🔽The śrāvaka vehicle does not exist without the appearance of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas byung ba med par nyan thos kyi theg pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas byang chub sems dpa' 'chi 'pho ba bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas byung ba med par nyan thos kyi theg pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas byang chub sems dpa' 'chi 'pho ba bstan te /
translated: The appearance of a buddha is the demonstration of the bodhisattva’s death and transmigration from the palace in Tuṣita,

original: yum gyi lhums su bltams pa dang / btsas pa dang / gzhon nu la sogs pa'i rim pas sems can gyi don du thabs kyi spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs mdzad nas khab nas byung ste dka' bar spyad pa la sogs pas bstan nas mngon par sangs rgyas pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yum gyi lhums su bltams pa dang / btsas pa dang / gzhon nu la sogs pa'i rim pas sems can gyi don du thabs kyi spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs mdzad nas khab nas byung ste dka' bar spyad pa la sogs pas bstan nas mngon par sangs rgyas pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: his conception in the womb of his mother, his birth, his youth, and so forth, and then, in order to benefit sentient beings, the performance of various kinds of conduct, such as leaving home, practicing austerities, and attaining manifest enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba la brten pa med par nyan thos kyi theg pa 'byung ba yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba la brten pa med par nyan thos kyi theg pa 'byung ba yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement “The śrāvaka vehicle does not exist without the appearance of a buddha” is that the śrāvaka vehicle does not exist without the appearance of a buddha.

original: 'dis ni rten bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rten bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the basis.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dri ba ste /
translated: This asks the reason.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med par nyan thos kyi theg pa yang ci'i phyir med ce na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med par nyan thos kyi theg pa yang ci'i phyir med ce na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why is it that without the appearance of a Buddha, the Hearer Vehicle does not exist?

original: de'i lan du nyan thos rnams kyi yang dag par lta ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i lan du nyan thos rnams kyi yang dag par lta ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The answer to that is: The right view of the Hearers is the going after the sound of the perfections.

original: gang chos thams cad la gang zag gi dngos po med de /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad la gang zag gi dngos po med de /
translated: There is no personal entity in any dharma.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis khong du chud pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi yang dag par lta ba'o //🔽yang dag pa'i lta ba de yang sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis khong du chud pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi yang dag par lta ba'o // yang dag pa'i lta ba de yang sangs rgyas sam /
translated: The right knowledge that penetrates the selflessness of the person is the right view of the Hearers.

original: mkhan po 'am slob dpon gyis bshad pa'i sgra mnyan nas gang zag la bdag med par dmigs par byed pas na pha rol gyi sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mkhan po 'am slob dpon gyis bshad pa'i sgra mnyan nas gang zag la bdag med par dmigs par byed pas na pha rol gyi sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
translated: And that right view is the going after the sound of another, because it is the observation of the selflessness of the person after listening to the sound of the teaching of a Buddha, a preceptor, or a master.

original: 'dis ni dmigs par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dmigs par smra ba yin no //
translated: This is the position of the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: pha rol gyis bstan pa'i sgra mnyan nas zhes bshad na nyan pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol gyis bstan pa'i sgra mnyan nas zhes bshad na nyan pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: If one listens to the sound that is taught by another, what is listening?

original: de'i phyir de la nyan pa ni gang 'di'i tshul khrims sdom pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la nyan pa ni gang 'di'i tshul khrims sdom pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Listening to it is the restraint of morality.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba sel zhing sim par byed pas tshul khrims te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba sel zhing sim par byed pas tshul khrims te /
translated: Morality is that which cools, because it removes the burning of the afflictions.

original: des lus dang ngag gi nyes pa dang / kha na ma tho ba rnams mi 'byung bar sdom par byed pas na tshul khrims nyid sdom pa ste /
analyzed: des lus dang ngag gi nyes pa dang / kha na ma tho ba rnams mi 'byung bar sdom par byed pas na tshul khrims nyid sdom pa ste /
translated: Since it restrains the arising of the faults and misdeeds of body and speech, morality itself is restraint.

original: de la nyan pa ni de yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la nyan pa ni de yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Listening to it is that.

original: ji ltar bslab pa bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab pa bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Following the rules of training is the practice of the precepts.

original: de ltar tshul khrims kyi sdom pa mnyan nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims kyi sdom pa mnyan nas /
translated: Having listened to the restraint of morality in this way,

original: @148b ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis pham pa bzhi dang / dge 'dun lhag ma bcu gsum la sogs pa'i tshul khrims nyis brgya lnga bcu bcas pa bzhin du kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam yang med par slob cing byed pa ni ji ltar bslab pa bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: @148b ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis pham pa bzhi dang / dge 'dun lhag ma bcu gsum la sogs pa'i tshul khrims nyis brgya lnga bcu bcas pa bzhin du kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam yang med par slob cing byed pa ni ji ltar bslab pa bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Just as the Blessed One has taught the two hundred and fifty rules of moral training, such as the four defeats and the thirteen remainders of the order, one trains without even the slightest transgression.🔽This is called following the rules of training.

original: rgyu des tshul khrims kyi phung po rdzogs par 'gyur bas na 'dis ni rgyu smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des tshul khrims kyi phung po rdzogs par 'gyur bas na 'dis ni rgyu smras pa yin no //
translated: By that cause, the aggregate of moral discipline is perfected.

original: de la sgrub pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therein, practice is also threefold:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas rab tu sgrub pa dang / ye shes kyi rten rab tu sgrub pa dang / bya ba byas pa rab tu sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas rab tu sgrub pa dang / ye shes kyi rten rab tu sgrub pa dang / bya ba byas pa rab tu sgrub pa'o //
translated: the practice of the basis of concentration, the practice of the basis of wisdom, and the practice of the completion of action.🔽The aggregate of moral discipline is perfected.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po rab tu rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la tshul khrims kyi sgras yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims la bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po rab tu rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la tshul khrims kyi sgras yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims la bya ste /
translated: By the word moral discipline, moral discipline endowed with six branches is meant.

original: yan lag drug po gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag drug po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six branches?

original: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa zhes yan lag dang po dang / so sor thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes yan lag gnyis pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa zhes yan lag gsum pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes yan lag bzhi pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa zhes yan lag dang po dang / so sor thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes yan lag gnyis pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa zhes yan lag gsum pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes yan lag bzhi pa dang /
translated: The first branch is to abide by ethical discipline; the second is to be restrained by the vows of individual liberation; the third is to have perfect ritual; the fourth is to have perfect activity;

original: kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta zhes yan lag lnga pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs nas slob ces yan lag drug pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta zhes yan lag lnga pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs nas slob ces yan lag drug pa'o //
translated: the fifth is to regard even the slightest root of unvirtue as dangerous; and the sixth is to train in the precepts that one has taken.

original: ji ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin zhe na yang dag par blangs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la lus kyi las kyi mtha' ma log pa dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' ma log par gyur cing ma nyams par byed pa dang / skyon med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin zhe na yang dag par blangs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la lus kyi las kyi mtha' ma log pa dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' ma log par gyur cing ma nyams par byed pa dang / skyon med par byed pa'o //
translated: How does one have ethical discipline? One has not distorted physical or verbal activity with regard to the precepts that one has taken, and one does not violate or damage them, and one does not have faults.

original: ji ltar so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one restrained by the vows of individual liberation?

original: dge slong pha dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen pha dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul pha dang / dge tshul ma'i tshul khrims rnams la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong pha dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen pha dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul pha dang / dge tshul ma'i tshul khrims rnams la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The vows of individual liberation are the ethical precedents of the fully ordained monk, the fully ordained nun, the male and female novices, the male and female novices in the foundation of the training, the male and female lay practitioners, the male and female probationary nuns, and the male and female novices.

original: de dag kyang sde tha dad par dbye bas sdom pa mang du 'gyur med kyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang sde tha dad par dbye bas sdom pa mang du 'gyur med kyi /
translated: These are many different types of vows, but they are not multiple types of vows.

original: 'di'i skabs su dge slong gi sdom pa la dgongs nas so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su dge slong gi sdom pa la dgongs nas so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: In this context, the vows of individual liberation are the vows of the fully ordained monk.🔽How is the rite complete?

original: ji ltar cho ga phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar cho ga phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: One who practices in this way🔽is not censured by the world

original: de ltar spyod la ma mam /
analyzed: de ltar spyod la ma mam /
translated: with regard to any action,

original: 'phral gyi bya ba 'am /
analyzed: 'phral gyi bya ba 'am /
translated: whether it is an immediate action or

original: dge ba'i phyogs la rab tu sbyor ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la rab tu sbyor ba yang rung ste /
translated: an action related to the virtuous side.

original: bya ba thams cad la 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug cing /
analyzed: bya ba thams cad la 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug cing /
translated: In all actions, one follows worldly custom

original: 'jig rten gyis dpyas @149a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis dpyas @149a * //
translated: and is not censured by the world.

original: par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'dul ba'i rjes su 'jug cing 'dul ba dang 'gal bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'dul ba'i rjes su 'jug cing 'dul ba dang 'gal bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: One follows the Vinaya and does not contradict the Vinaya.

original: ji ltar spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the domain of activity excellent?

original: dge slong dag lnga po 'di dag ni spyod yul ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag lnga po 'di dag ni spyod yul ma yin pa ste /
translated: Monks, these five are not the domain of activity.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: smad 'tshong ma dang / chang 'tshong dang ; sha 'tshong gi gnas dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / gdol ba'i khyim mo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: smad 'tshong ma dang / chang 'tshong dang ; sha 'tshong gi gnas dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / gdol ba'i khyim mo zhes gsungs te /
translated: The house of a prostitute, a tavern, a butcher’s place, the king’s palace, and the house of an outcaste.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pas ma gnang ba'i spyod yul de dag spangs nas /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pas ma gnang ba'i spyod yul de dag spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned those domains of activity not permitted by the Tathāgata,

original: spyod yul gzhan du 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: spyod yul gzhan du 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: he enters other domains of activity.

original: ji ltar kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he view with dread even the slightest misdeed?

original: kha na ma tho ba phra rab ces bya ba ni gang bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs su gyur pa rnams te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba phra rab ces bya ba ni gang bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs su gyur pa rnams te /
translated: The slightest misdeed is a minor point of training.

original: de dag nyams par gyur na 'bad pa chung dus slong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyams par gyur na 'bad pa chung dus slong bar byed pa'o //
translated: If it is violated, it is restored by a small effort.

original: de la 'jigs par lta ba ni gal te bdag la de byung bar gyur na ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum bya ba'i skal ba med cing ngan song du lhung bar 'gyur ro snyam nas srog gi phyir yang de dag las nyams par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jigs par lta ba ni gal te bdag la de byung bar gyur na ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum bya ba'i skal ba med cing ngan song du lhung bar 'gyur ro snyam nas srog gi phyir yang de dag las nyams par mi byed pa'o //
translated: The view of fear is thinking, If that occurs to me, I will not have the fortune to obtain what I have not obtained, to realize what I have not realized, and to actualize what I have not actualized, and I will fall into lower rebirths, and not transgressing those precepts even for the sake of one's life.

original: ji ltar bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs nas slob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs nas slob pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one train after taking the basis of training?

original: dang po so sor thar pa'i sdom pa len pa'i dus na /
analyzed: dang po so sor thar pa'i sdom pa len pa'i dus na /
translated: At first, when one takes the pratimoksa vows,

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe bslab pa'i gzhi kha cig mkhan po dang slob dpon las thos nas /
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe bslab pa'i gzhi kha cig mkhan po dang slob dpon las thos nas /
translated: when one is fully ordained by the rite of proposal and four requests, one hears some of the bases of training from the preceptor and master.

original: gzhan dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe na gang yin pa shes par gyis shig ces bstan nas /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe na gang yin pa shes par gyis shig ces bstan nas /
translated: Others are taught by saying, You should know what they are by reading the Pratimoksa Sutra every half month.

original: de ltar so sor thar pa'i sdom pa thob ste /
analyzed: de ltar so sor thar pa'i sdom pa thob ste /
translated: Thus, one obtains the pratimoksha vows.

original: de phyin cad ni ji ltar blangs pa dang / blang bar dam bcas pa rnams kyang blangs nas /
analyzed: de phyin cad ni ji ltar blangs pa dang / blang bar dam bcas pa rnams kyang blangs nas /
translated: From then on, one should train in the precepts as they were taken and as they were promised to be taken.

original: lhag chad med par bslab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lhag chad med par bslab par byed pa'o //
translated: One should not let them be incomplete or deficient.

original: yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims kyi tshogs sam /🔽tshul khrims mang po bsdus pa ni tshul khrims kyi phung po zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims kyi tshogs sam / tshul khrims mang po bsdus pa ni tshul khrims kyi phung po zhes bya ste ;
translated: The aggregate of morality is the collection of the six-limbed morality,🔽or it is the collection of many moralities.

original: dang po tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: dang po tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: It is called the aggregate of morality because, beginning with the initial correct assumption of the moral precepts,

original: tha mar rnam par grol ba'i ye shes la thug gi bar du rdul tsam yang nyams pa dang god pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tha mar rnam par grol ba'i ye shes la thug gi bar du rdul tsam yang nyams pa dang god pa med pa'o //
translated: one does not let them be damaged or lost even to the extent of a particle, until one finally reaches the wisdom of liberation.

original: de ltar nyams pa dang god pa med pas tshul khrims kyi mthar phyin te /
analyzed: de ltar nyams pa dang god pa med pas tshul khrims kyi mthar phyin te /
translated: Thus, by not letting them be damaged or lost, one perfects morality.

original: zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims kyi @149b mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims kyi @149b mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni /
translated: The characteristic of uncontaminated morality is

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: called the perfection of the aggregate of morality.

original: de ltar tshul khrims kyi phung po rgyas par bshad nas de yang mdor bsdus na tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims kyi phung po rgyas par bshad nas de yang mdor bsdus na tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Having thus explained the aggregate of morality in detail, it should be understood in brief that it has three aspects:

original: chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyi yon tan gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyi yon tan gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of non-wastage, the characteristic of nature, and the characteristic of natural virtue.

original: de la thang cig tshul khrims dang ldan zhes bya bas tshul khrims kyi sdom pa chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la thang cig tshul khrims dang ldan zhes bya bas tshul khrims kyi sdom pa chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The characteristic of non-wastage is indicated by the phrase even for a moment, endowed with morality.

original: gang so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid smras so //
analyzed: gang so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid smras so //
translated: The characteristic of nature is indicated by the phrase restrained by the vow of individual liberation.

original: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya bas ni pha rol la brten nas de ltar yang dag par blangs pa'i so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i yon tan bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya bas ni pha rol la brten nas de ltar yang dag par blangs pa'i so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i yon tan bstan pa yin te /
translated: The characteristic of natural virtue is indicated by the phrase perfect in conduct and way of life.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag gi cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs par mthong na ma dad pa rnams ni dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag gi cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs par mthong na ma dad pa rnams ni dad par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, when others see that one's ritual and sphere of activity are perfect, the faithless become faithful,

original: dad pa rnams ni dad pa phyir zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: dad pa rnams ni dad pa phyir zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: and the faithful increase their faith.

original: / gang yang kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs nas slob pa gnyis kyis rang gi dbang du byas nas tshul khrims kyi yon tan smras pa yin te /
analyzed: / gang yang kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs nas slob pa gnyis kyis rang gi dbang du byas nas tshul khrims kyi yon tan smras pa yin te /
translated: The two who see fear in the slightest wrongdoing and who, having taken up the precepts, train in them, speak of the virtues of morality in terms of their own experience.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yang dag par blangs pa la rdul tsam yang nyams pa med pa dang ; / bslab pa'i gzhi chen po dag blangs shing slob pa'i rgyus ngan song du skye ba'i skal ba med cing ma thob pa la sogs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa la rdul tsam yang nyams pa med pa dang ; / bslab pa'i gzhi chen po dag blangs shing slob pa'i rgyus ngan song du skye ba'i skal ba med cing ma thob pa la sogs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because they do not violate even the slightest of the precepts they have taken up, and because they have taken up the great precepts and trained in them, they are not reborn in the lower realms, and they attain what they have not previously attained.

original: 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas rab tu bsgrub pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas rab tu bsgrub pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the perfect basis for samadhi.

original: 'di ltar tshul khrims la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa la rab tu reg par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul khrims la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa la rab tu reg par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in this way, on the basis of morality, one touches one-pointedness of mind.

original: de bas na gzhung nyid las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na gzhung nyid las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in the text itself, it is said:

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs nas /
translated: “Having completed the aggregate of morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: he makes effort to complete the aggregate of meditative stabilization.”

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is meditative stabilization?

original: 'di la dge slong 'dod pa las dben pa /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong 'dod pa las dben pa /
translated: Here, a monk, secluded from sense desires,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la dben pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: secluded from non-virtuous qualities,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with applied and sustained thought,🔽with joy and happiness born of seclusion,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas so //
translated: dwells having attained the first meditative stabilization.

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing /🔽nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing / nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: He, free from applied and sustained thought,🔽with inner clarity and one-pointedness of mind,

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa @150a * //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa @150a * //
translated: with joy and happiness born of concentration,🔽dwells having attained the second meditative stabilization.

original: med pa ; dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas so //
analyzed: med pa ; dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas so //
translated: He then achieves and remains in the second meditative concentration, which is free of conceptual thought and is born of the one-pointed concentration of the mind that is free of conceptual thought, and is filled with the joy and bliss of samādhi.

original: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin no //
translated: “Free of attachment to joy, he remains in equanimity, mindful and aware,

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la /🔽'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong la / 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa /
translated: experiencing physical bliss.

original: bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The noble ones for whom this is the state of mindfulness and equanimity are said to be ‘abiding in joy.’

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas so //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas so //
translated: He then achieves and remains in the third meditative concentration, which is without joy.

original: de bde ba yang spangs te /
analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs te /
translated: “He gives up the experience of bliss,

original: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing /
analyzed: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing /
translated: and also gives up the experience of suffering.🔽He previously gave up mental pleasure and mental displeasure.

original: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pas /
translated: Thus, he achieves and remains in the fourth meditative concentration, which is without suffering or bliss, and is purified in terms of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bang bsgrubs nas gnas so zhes gsungs pa ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bang bsgrubs nas gnas so zhes gsungs pa ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: He dwells having achieved the fourth meditation, which is complete with equanimity and mindfulness, and purified. This is called concentration.

original: de la bsam gtan rnams ni rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan rnams ni rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The meditations are established by four aspects:

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams par byed pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i phan yon dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams par byed pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i phan yon dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas so //
translated: the elimination of the adverse, the cultivation of the antidote, the benefit of cultivation, and the basis of both.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po la 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams ba bstan te /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po la 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams ba bstan te /
translated: The first meditation is taught to have the elimination of the adverse by the statement: “It is the seclusion of the sense-desires, the seclusion of evil and unwholesome states.”

original: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa dag las dben pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa dag las dben pa ste /
translated: The seclusion of the sense-desires is the seclusion from the sense-desires of affliction and the sense-desires of objects.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa las dben pa dang / dmigs pa las dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa las dben pa dang / dmigs pa las dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the seclusion from the associated and the seclusion from the objective.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod par gtogs pa chad pas gcod pa dang / mtshon 'debs pa dang / 'thab pa dang /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod par gtogs pa chad pas gcod pa dang / mtshon 'debs pa dang / 'thab pa dang /
translated: The phrase “isolated from negative, nonvirtuous phenomena” refers to the negative actions of body, speech, and mind that are motivated by the afflictions and that are the causes for the desires of the world.🔽

original: rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / g-yo'i tshig dang / gnod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa de dag las dben pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / g-yo'i tshig dang / gnod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa de dag las dben pa'o //
translated: The phrase isolated from evil, unwholesome dharmas refers to the avoidance of the evil conduct of body, speech, and mind that arises from the cause of the afflictive desires, such as killing, beating, fighting, quarreling, arguing, deceitful speech, harming, lying, and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dag skyon du ma mthong bas 'dod pa'i gnyen po de gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya bas gnyen po bsgom pa bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dag skyon du ma mthong bas 'dod pa'i gnyen po de gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya bas gnyen po bsgom pa bstan te /
translated: Since he sees conceptualization and analysis as faults, the phrase possessing conceptualization and analysis indicates the cultivation of the antidote, because it is concomitant with those two antidotes to desire.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis kyis 'dod pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos 'joms par byed pas so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis kyis 'dod pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos 'joms par byed pas so //
translated: Since both conceptualization and analysis destroy desire and evil, unwholesome dharmas, the phrase possessing conceptualization and analysis indicates the cultivation of the antidote.

original: dben pa las @150b skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can zhes bya bas bsgoms pa'i phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: dben pa las @150b skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can zhes bya bas bsgoms pa'i phan yon bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the joy and bliss born of seclusion” indicates the benefits of meditation.

original: 'dod pa las dben pa 'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa las dben pa 'am /
translated: Seclusion is either from sense objects or from the obscurations.

original: sgrib pa las dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba ni dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa las dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba ni dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The joy and bliss born of seclusion are called “the joy and bliss born of seclusion”

original: 'dod pa'i don rnyed nas gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs te las su rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don rnyed nas gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs te las su rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having attained the desired goal, one is free from all the negative tendencies and one’s body and mind are fit and serviceable because of being pliable.

original: bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas zhes bya bas de gnyis ka'i gnas bstan te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas zhes bya bas de gnyis ka'i gnas bstan te /
translated: The phrase “having achieved the first meditative concentration, he remains in it” indicates the abode of those two.

analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i rnam par rtog pa dang bcas /

original: bar chad dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs las 'das nas sgom pa goms pas glags med cing bar chad med pa'i gnas skabs thob par 'gyur bas sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: 'di ni bya ba byas pa rab tu bsgrub pa bstan te /

analyzed: 'di ltar ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pas ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: de yang tshul @152a * //
analyzed: de yang tshul @152a * //
translated: That is the method.

original: khrims rnam par dag pa ni 'gyod pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khrims rnam par dag pa ni 'gyod pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has pure morality has no regrets.

original: 'gyod pa med na dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dang shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa dang bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med na dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dang shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa dang bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has no regrets is joyful, greatly joyful, and very well purified.🔽One who is joyful and greatly joyful and very well purified has a happy mind.

original: bde bar gyur pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: bde bar gyur pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: One who has a happy mind becomes concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes /🔽yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is concentrated sees and knows things as they really are.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong bas skyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong bas skyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who sees and knows things as they really are becomes disenchanted.

original: skyo bar gyur na 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol ba dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol te /

translated: One who becomes disenchanted becomes liberated from the mind’s defilements of desire, the defilements of existence, and the defilements of ignorance.

original: rgyud la dri ma med pa 'thob par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: rgyud la dri ma med pa 'thob par 'gyur bas na /
translated: One who is liberated attains the stainless state.

analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the completion of the aggregate of liberation.

original: 'dis ni 'bras bu bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bras bu bstan te /
translated: This shows the result.

analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po ni bslab pa gsum la zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregate of liberation is the result of engaging in the three trainings.

translated: Thus, after the mind is liberated from the afflictions of the three realms, the gnosis that knows and perceives that liberation arises.

analyzed: de bas na mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, a sutra states:

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed ces gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed ces gsungs so //
translated: Having perfected the aggregate of liberation, one perfects the aggregate of seeing the gnosis of liberation.

original: 'dis ni de rab tu rig pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni de rab tu rig pa bstan te /
translated: This shows that one fully understands liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i 'og tu bdag gi sdug bsngal ni shes par byas /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i 'og tu bdag gi sdug bsngal ni shes par byas /
translated: After liberation, one thinks, I have understood suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba ni spangs /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni spangs /
translated: I have abandoned origin,

original: 'gog pa ni mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mngon sum du byas /
translated: I have manifested cessation,🔽I have meditated on the path.

original: lam ni bsgoms pas da sdug bsngal shes par bya mi dgos /🔽kun 'byung ba spang mi dgos /
analyzed: lam ni bsgoms pas da sdug bsngal shes par bya mi dgos / kun 'byung ba spang mi dgos /
translated: Now I do not need to understand suffering,🔽I do not need to abandon origin,

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du bya mi dgos /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du bya mi dgos /
translated: I do not need to manifest cessation,

original: lam bsgom mi dgos te /
analyzed: lam bsgom mi dgos te /
translated: I do not need to meditate on the path.

original: skye ba zad do //
analyzed: skye ba zad do //
translated: Birth is exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyad pa bsten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyad pa bsten to //
translated: The holy life has been lived.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: What was to be done has been done.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: I will know no other existence than this.

original: gzhan yang nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa ni zhes bya bas nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa rnam grangs gzhan du ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa ni zhes bya bas nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa rnam grangs gzhan du ston te /
translated: Moreover, the skill in the Śrāvaka Vehicle is taught in another enumeration, beginning with “skill in the Śrāvaka Vehicle”.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bshad pa'i sgra la brten nas gang zag la bdag med par dmigs pa ni nyan thos te /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bshad pa'i sgra la brten nas gang zag la bdag med par dmigs pa ni nyan thos te /
translated: The Śrāvaka is one who, on the basis of the words of the preceptor and the master, observes the selflessness of the person.

original: nyan thos de dag gi theg pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos de dag gi theg pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
translated: The vehicle of those Śrāvakas is the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: That should be known as twofold:

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la @152b sun 'byin pa dang / gnyen po'i sa la yon tan du lta ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la @152b sun 'byin pa dang / gnyen po'i sa la yon tan du lta ba'o //
translated: the rejection of the counteragent and the view of the virtues of the counteragent.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: The rejection of the counteragent is as follows:

original: gang bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning with “merit and demerit”,

original: skye ba'i gnas thams cad la mi smon zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas thams cad la mi smon zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan to //
translated: The phrase does not wish for any place of rebirth indicates the second.

original: gnyen po'i sa la yon tan du lta ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas dang skyabs su 'du shes pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: gnyen po'i sa la yon tan du lta ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas dang skyabs su 'du shes pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The phrase perceives nirvana as a refuge and a resting place indicates the third.

original: de bas na gang gis 'gro ba dang / gang du 'gro ba'i phyir de gnyis ni nyan thos kyi theg pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na gang gis 'gro ba dang / gang du 'gro ba'i phyir de gnyis ni nyan thos kyi theg pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the vehicle of the disciples is so called because of the one who travels by it and the place to which it goes.

original: gang gis 'gro ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs sun 'byin pa'i 'du shes kyis 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'gro ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs sun 'byin pa'i 'du shes kyis 'gro ba'o //
translated: The phrase who travels by it refers to the one who travels by means of the perception that eliminates the resistances.

original: gong du 'gro ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i sar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gong du 'gro ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i sar 'gro ba'o //
translated: The phrase the place to which it goes refers to the place of nirvana.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs sun 'byin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs sun 'byin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The elimination of the resistances is also twofold:

original: rgyu spong ba dang / 'bras bu spong ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu spong ba dang / 'bras bu spong ba'o //
translated: the elimination of the cause and the elimination of the result.

original: rgyu spong ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu spong ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The elimination of the cause is also twofold:

original: las spong ba dang / nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: las spong ba dang / nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
translated: the elimination of action and the elimination of the afflictions.

original: las spong ba'i dbang du byas nas gang bsod nams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: las spong ba'i dbang du byas nas gang bsod nams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With reference to the elimination of action, the root text states, the merit ... and so on.

original: 'du byed gsum ni khams gsum du skye ba'i rgyu byed par mthong nas de rnams la rnam par smod par byed de /
analyzed: 'du byed gsum ni khams gsum du skye ba'i rgyu byed par mthong nas de rnams la rnam par smod par byed de /
translated: The three formative forces are seen as the cause of birth in the three realms and one deprecates them.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs su smod pa ni rnam par smod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs su smod pa ni rnam par smod pa ste /
translated: Deprecation is the various kinds of deprecation.

original: sun 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the act of disparaging.

original: de 'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de 'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, it is twofold:

original: sngon byas pa spong ba dang / phyis mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngon byas pa spong ba dang / phyis mi byed pa'o //
translated: the abandonment of what was previously done and the non-performance of what is to be done later.

original: de la sngon byas pa spong ba ni 'du byed rnam pa gsum sngon spyad pa'i bag chags yod pa la 'phags pa'i lam gyis sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: de la sngon byas pa spong ba ni 'du byed rnam pa gsum sngon spyad pa'i bag chags yod pa la 'phags pa'i lam gyis sbyong ba'o //
translated: In this respect, the abandonment of what was previously done is the purification of the latent impressions of the three kinds of formative forces that were previously performed by means of the noble path.

original: phyis mi byed pa ni phyin chad 'du byed rnam pa gsum gyi las la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: phyis mi byed pa ni phyin chad 'du byed rnam pa gsum gyi las la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The non-performance of what is to be done later is the non-engagement in the activity of the three kinds of formative forces from now on.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid du mthong ba so /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba yang rnam pa gnyis te / de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid du mthong ba so /
translated: The abandonment of moral defilement is also twofold:🔽the abandonment of the cause and the abandonment of the result.

original: de la mi dga' ba dang de'i rgyus sdug bsngal bskyed par mthong bas spong bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi dga' ba dang de'i rgyus sdug bsngal bskyed par mthong bas spong bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: In this respect, the abandonment of the cause is the desire to abandon moral defilement through the perception that it is the cause of suffering and through the perception that it is the cause of the three kinds of formative forces.🔽The abandonment of the result is the desire to abandon the result of moral defilement through the perception that it is the result of the three kinds of formative forces and through the perception that it is the result of karma.

original: khams gsum thams cad la yid byung zhing zhes bya bas de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid du mthong bas de la mi dga' ba bstan te /
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad la yid byung zhing zhes bya bas de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid du mthong bas de la mi dga' ba bstan te /
translated: The phrase disillusioned with the entire triple world indicates that he is displeased with it, because he has seen it to be the nature of suffering, which is its result.

original: khams gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag go //
analyzed: khams gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag go //
translated: The triple world is the world of desire, the world of form, and the world of the formless.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams ni gling bzhi dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags rnams so //🔽gzugs kyi khams @153a * //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams ni gling bzhi dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags rnams so // gzugs kyi khams @153a * //
translated: The world of desire consists of the four continents, the six classes of gods of the world of desire, and the beings in the hells, as animals, and as hungry ghosts.

original: ni tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas bcu drug dag go //
analyzed: ni tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas bcu drug dag go //
translated: The world of form consists of the sixteen levels, beginning with the Brahmakayika, Brahmapurohita, and Mahabrahma heavens.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The world of the formless consists of the four levels beginning with the sphere of infinite space.

original: yid byung ba ni khams gsum la skyo ba'o ;
analyzed: yid byung ba ni khams gsum la skyo ba'o ;
translated: Disillusioned means that he is disgusted with the triple world.

original: /'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya bas de'i rgyus sdug bsngal ba skyed par mthong bas spong bar 'dod pa bstan te /
analyzed: /'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya bas de'i rgyus sdug bsngal ba skyed par mthong bas spong bar 'dod pa bstan te /
translated: “Free from desire” shows the desire to abandon, since one sees that suffering is produced by its cause.

original: khams gsum ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: The three realms are free from desire, since the afflictions are abandoned.

original: 'bras bu spong ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu spong ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the result of abandonment,

original: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽thams cad kyi sgra rtog pa'i sgra gnyi ga dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so // thams cad kyi sgra rtog pa'i sgra gnyi ga dang sbyar te /
translated: he says, “All formations are impermanent,” and so on.🔽The word “all” is connected with both the word “conceptualization” and “all formations are impermanent” and “all formations are suffering.”

original: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag bar rtog pa dang / 'du byed thams cad la sdug bsngal bar rtog pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag bar rtog pa dang / 'du byed thams cad la sdug bsngal bar rtog pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Conceptualization of all formations as impermanent and conceptualization of all formations as suffering.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phung po dang khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni 'du byed thams cad de /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phung po dang khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni 'du byed thams cad de /
translated: All formations are the phenomena of aggregates, elements, and sense bases, and so on, which are produced by causes and conditions.

original: de dag mi rtag pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jig par byed pa ni 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag mi rtag pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jig par byed pa ni 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The destruction of those by two kinds of impermanence is called “conceptualization of all formations as impermanent.”

original: de la mi rtag pa rnam pa gnyis ni 'jig pas mi rtag pa dang / skad cig mas 'joms pas mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa rnam pa gnyis ni 'jig pas mi rtag pa dang / skad cig mas 'joms pas mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Impermanence is twofold: impermanence through destruction and impermanence through momentariness.

original: de la 'jig pas mi rtag pa ni mthar 'chi bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig pas mi rtag pa ni mthar 'chi bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Impermanence through destruction is the impermanence of what will finally perish,

original: mnar med pa nas brtsams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du de na gnas pa'i sems can rnams rang gi gnas nas 'phos pas so //
analyzed: mnar med pa nas brtsams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du de na gnas pa'i sems can rnams rang gi gnas nas 'phos pas so //
translated: because the sentient beings who dwell there will pass away from their abodes, beginning with the Avici hell and ending with the summit of existence.

original: skad cig mas 'joms pas mi rtag pa ni skad cig ma re re la yang 'jig cing skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig mas 'joms pas mi rtag pa ni skad cig ma re re la yang 'jig cing skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Impermanence through momentariness is the impermanence of what is destroyed from moment to moment, because it is destroyed and arises again in each moment.

original: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad dang ldan par shes pa ni sdug bsngal bar rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad dang ldan par shes pa ni sdug bsngal bar rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The understanding that all conditioned things are suffering through the possession of the eight kinds of suffering is called the conception of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / shi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug pa dang bral bar sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / shi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug pa dang bral bar sdug bsngal dang /
translated: The eight kinds of suffering are: the suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, the suffering of association with what is unpleasant, the suffering of separation from what is pleasant,

original: gang 'dod pa de btsal te mi rnyed pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lta sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa de btsal te mi rnyed pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lta sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: the suffering of seeking and not finding what one desires, and in brief, the suffering of the five aggregates of the clinging-stream.

original: de la skye ba ni mi dang lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba de dang de dag tu phung po dang khams dang skye mched mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba ni mi dang lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba de dang de dag tu phung po dang khams dang skye mched mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: Birth is the manifestation of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields in this or that class of beings, such as gods or men.

original: ci'i phyir skye ba @153b sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skye ba @153b sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is birth called suffering?

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: Because of two kinds of suffering:

original: rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gzhan gyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gzhan gyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of suffering by nature and because of being the basis of other suffering.

original: de la rgas pa ni phung po gzhan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la rgas pa ni phung po gzhan du gyur pa ste /
translated: Old age is the transformation of the aggregates.

original: lang cho bcom pa dang / na tshod nyams pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: lang cho bcom pa dang / na tshod nyams pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: old age, the destruction of vigor, the deterioration of the faculties, etc.🔽Why is old age suffering?

original: ci'i phyir rga ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rga ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Because it is the destroyer of beauty,🔽the destroyer of health, the destroyer of strength, the destroyer of memory and discernment.🔽The beauty of the body is destroyed, for the skin is wrinkled, the face is lined, the eyes are sunken deep in their sockets, the teeth are notched, the hair is lost, the body trembles, the limbs are bent over, the flesh is withered, the body is covered with spots, the voice is weak, the nose is flat, the body is uneven, the flesh is dried up, the belly is pendulous, the buttocks are sunken, the gait faltering.🔽The beauty of complexion and figure is destroyed, for the body is like a crushed fig, like a chewed fruit, like a broken yoke, like a twisted bamboo, like a broken pot, like a crushed pumpkin.🔽The beauty of the mind is destroyed, for the mind is no longer capable of grasping things as it did before.

original: nye du 'khor rnams kyis shin tu byams shing yid du 'ong bar bya ba dang / 'gro ba bzang mo'i mig dang / yid kyis rjes su mthun par byed pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs shin tu mdzes pa de rga ba'i ser bas phog nas mi mdzes pa dang /
analyzed: nye du 'khor rnams kyis shin tu byams shing yid du 'ong bar bya ba dang / 'gro ba bzang mo'i mig dang / yid kyis rjes su mthun par byed pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs shin tu mdzes pa de rga ba'i ser bas phog nas mi mdzes pa dang /
translated: The beauty of the retinue is destroyed, for friends, sons, servants, slaves, etc.,🔽no longer respect one as before.

original: 'khums pa dang / zhigs par snang bas nye du'i phyogs rnams kyang shin tu mi dga' bar byed kyi /
analyzed: 'khums pa dang / zhigs par snang bas nye du'i phyogs rnams kyang shin tu mi dga' bar byed kyi /
translated: The beauty of power is destroyed, for one is no longer capable of walking, sitting, lying down, eating, drinking, or expectorating without the help of others.

original: 'gro ba bzang mos kyang spong bar byed pas rga ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba bzang mos kyang spong bar byed pas rga ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The beauty of life is destroyed, for death is certain.

original: de la khams mi mthun pa 'phel bar gyur pa ni na ba ste sa la sogs pa'i khams shas che chung du gyur pa'o //🔽ci'i phyir na sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la khams mi mthun pa 'phel bar gyur pa ni na ba ste sa la sogs pa'i khams shas che chung du gyur pa'o //🔽ci'i phyir na sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: The beauty of enjoyment is destroyed, for one is no longer capable of enjoying sounds, etc.

original: rab tu mi bzad pa'i nad kyi khyad par gyis thebs nas nags chen po mes tshig pa'i nang du chud pa rab tu tsha ba'i me lces reg pa skad chen po 'byin pa bzhin sdug bsngal ba'i mes reg pa na mi bzad pa'i skad cher 'byin pas na
analyzed: rab tu mi bzad pa'i nad kyi khyad par gyis thebs nas nags chen po mes tshig pa'i nang du chud pa rab tu tsha ba'i me lces reg pa skad chen po 'byin pa bzhin sdug bsngal ba'i mes reg pa na mi bzad pa'i skad cher 'byin pas na
translated: Since it is afflicted by the most terrible of diseases, like being caught in a great forest fire, and since it is touched by the flames of the most terrible suffering, like being touched by the flames of a great fire that emits great cries of pain,

original: sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called suffering.

original: de la 'chi ba ni dbang po rnams nyams pa las de'i rgyus sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'chi ba ni dbang po rnams nyams pa las de'i rgyus sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi rgyu ba'o //
translated: Death is the degeneration of the faculties and, due to that cause, the non-functioning of mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi rgyu bar gyur pa na gang zag de shi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi rgyu bar gyur pa na gang zag de shi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When mind and mental factors cease functioning, that person is said to have died.

original: ci'i phyir shi ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shi ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is death called suffering?

original: 'di ltar shi bar gyur na yid du 'ong zhing sems la gcags pa'i pha ma dang nye du dang grogs la sogs pa dang bral zhing nor dang 'bru dang / bran dang bu tsha la sogs bag tang bar dka' ba rnams dang bral te mi 'dod bzhin du bsad sar bkri ba'i btson dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa skyed par byed pas na 'di las sdug bsngal gzhan med pa'i phyir 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba'o
analyzed: 'di ltar shi bar gyur na yid du 'ong zhing sems la gcags pa'i pha ma dang nye du dang grogs la sogs pa dang bral zhing nor dang 'bru dang / bran dang bu tsha la sogs bag tang bar dka' ba rnams dang bral te mi 'dod bzhin du bsad sar bkri ba'i btson dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa skyed par byed pas na 'di las sdug bsngal gzhan med pa'i phyir 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba'o
translated: Thus, when death occurs, one is separated from one's dear and beloved parents, relatives, friends, etc., and one is separated from one's wealth, grain, servants, children, etc., which are difficult to abandon. One is led, unwilling, to the place of death, like a prisoner being led to the place of execution, and one generates immeasurable suffering. Therefore, because there is no suffering other than this, death is suffering.

original: // mi sdug pa dang phrad pa ni mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba ba la sogs pa 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba dang phrad pa'o //
analyzed: // mi sdug pa dang phrad pa ni mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba ba la sogs pa 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba dang phrad pa'o //
translated: Meeting with what is unpleasant is meeting with an unpleasant result, such as being a hell-being, etc., due to the cause of having done nonvirtuous actions.

original: ci'i phyir mi sdug pa dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi sdug pa dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is meeting with what is unpleasant called suffering?

original: khyim mtshes mi bgrungs pa dang 'dra bar gnod pa @154a * //
analyzed: khyim mtshes mi bgrungs pa dang 'dra bar gnod pa @154a * //
translated: It is like having an unrighteous neighbor.

original: byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / dug gi shing bzhin du sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa dang / zug rngus zug bzhin du lus dang sems la gnod pa byed pa dang / skye bo mi bgrungs pa dang dgra dang phrad na zhe sdang skye bar byed pa bzhin du zhe sdang skyed pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //🔽sdug pa dang bral ba ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa 'am /
analyzed: byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / dug gi shing bzhin du sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa dang / zug rngus zug bzhin du lus dang sems la gnod pa byed pa dang / skye bo mi bgrungs pa dang dgra dang phrad na zhe sdang skye bar byed pa bzhin du zhe sdang skyed pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o // sdug pa dang bral ba ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa 'am /
translated: It is suffering because it is the nature of an action, like the action of a poisonous tree in producing suffering, like the action of a thorn in piercing the body and mind, and like the action of an unrighteous person or an enemy in producing hatred.

original: sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa yang rung /
analyzed: sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa yang rung /
translated: Separation from what is dear is the separation from a being who is counted as one’s own or from a being who is not so counted.🔽What is separation from what is dear?

original: yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po dang bral ba'o //🔽ci'i phyir sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po dang bral ba'o // ci'i phyir sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: It is the separation from a pleasant thing.🔽Why is separation from what is dear suffering?

original: sdug pa dang bral bar dogs pa 'am /🔽mthong ba 'am /
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral bar dogs pa 'am /🔽mthong ba 'am /
translated: Because it is the cause of the suffering of separation.🔽Separation from what is dear is suffering because it is the cause of the suffering of separation.

original: rjes su dran pas kyang mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar byed pas na sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran pas kyang mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar byed pas na sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The suffering of separation is the suffering that arises from the recollection of a past separation from what is dear, and the suffering of lamentation, despair, and agitation that arises from a present separation from what is dear.

original: 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang bral ba la yang mi phrad par 'dod pa dang / bde ba dang phrad pa dang yang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa de btsal na ma grub pa'o //🔽yang na sdug pa dang phrad par 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang bral bar 'dod pa las sdug pa dang ma phrad la /
analyzed: 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang bral ba la yang mi phrad par 'dod pa dang / bde ba dang phrad pa dang yang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa de btsal na ma grub pa'o // yang na sdug pa dang phrad par 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang bral bar 'dod pa las sdug pa dang ma phrad la /
translated: The suffering of not obtaining what one longs for is the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for, of not meeting with what one longs to meet, of not finding what one longs to find, of not realizing what one longs to realize.🔽Or, the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for is the suffering of not meeting with what is dear, of not being united with what is dear, of not finding what is dear, of not realizing what is dear.

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad par gyur pa ni gnag 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad par gyur pa ni gnag 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for is the suffering of meeting with what is not dear, of being separated from what is dear, of not finding what is dear, of not realizing what is dear.

original: ci'i phyir gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa sdug bsngal ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for called the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for?

original: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyur gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyur gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of suffering.

original: dus gsum du'ang bdag gis gang btsal ba de ma rnyed ngo zhes sdug bsngal skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum du'ang bdag gis gang btsal ba de ma rnyed ngo zhes sdug bsngal skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because suffering arises when one thinks, “I have not found what I have sought in the past, present, or future.”

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lngar sdug bsngal thams cad 'dus te /
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lngar sdug bsngal thams cad 'dus te /
translated: In brief, the five appropriative aggregates are suffering means that all suffering is included in the five appropriative aggregates.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rten yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rten yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: They are called that because they are the basis of suffering.

original: chos thams cad la bdag med par rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad la bdag med par rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The realization that all phenomena are devoid of self means
