original: chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: all phenomena are conditioned and unconditioned, with and without impurity.

original: gang na gang med par shes pa chos thams cad la bdag med par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang na gang med par shes pa chos thams cad la bdag med par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The realization that all phenomena are devoid of self is the knowledge that whatever does not exist in something is absent from it.

original: chos de dag la mu stegs can gyis brtag pa'i bdag rtag pa med par khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag la mu stegs can gyis brtag pa'i bdag rtag pa med par khong du chud pa'o //
translated: It is the understanding that those phenomena lack the self imagined by the tīrthikas.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The delight in the peace of nirvana means

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni sdug bsngal spangs pa dang / @154b 'dod chags la sogs pa spangs pa'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni sdug bsngal spangs pa dang / @154b 'dod chags la sogs pa spangs pa'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: Nirvana is peace because it is the abandonment of suffering and the abandonment of attachment and so on.

original: yang na mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or, nirvana is twofold:

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: the nirvana with a remainder of the aggregates and the nirvana without a remainder of the aggregates.

original: de la zhi ba zhes bya bas phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la zhi ba zhes bya bas phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan te /
translated: The word “peace” indicates the nirvana with a remainder of the aggregates,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas phung pho tsam yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas phung pho tsam yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because although all the afflictions have been abandoned, the mere aggregates exist.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan te /
translated: The word “nirvana” indicates the nirvana without a remainder of the aggregates,

original: nyon mongs pa dang phung po gnyi ga yang spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang phung po gnyi ga yang spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both the afflictions and the aggregates have been abandoned.

original: mngon par dga' ba ni de thob par mos pa dang / de 'thob par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba ni de thob par mos pa dang / de 'thob par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “Delight” is the aspiration to attain that and the desire to attain that.

original: skad cig kyang srid par skye bar mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skad cig kyang srid par skye bar mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One does not desire to be born in the three realms even for an instant.

original: cung zad kyang khams gsum du skye bar ma mos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: cung zad kyang khams gsum du skye bar ma mos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: One does not desire to be born in the three realms even for an instant means one does not delight in being born in the three realms even for a moment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: khams gsum mtha' dag rtag tu 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang rjes su 'brel zhing das khyab par mthong bas so //
analyzed: khams gsum mtha' dag rtag tu 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang rjes su 'brel zhing das khyab par mthong bas so //
translated: Because one sees that the entire three realms is always connected with the suffering of conditioned existence and pervaded by it.🔽One always views it as fearful.

original: rtag tu 'jigs par lta zhes bya ba 'dir yang srid pa la zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang ldan pa 'am /
analyzed: rtag tu 'jigs par lta zhes bya ba 'dir yang srid pa la zhes bya bar sbyar te / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang ldan pa 'am /
translated: Here also, in existence is supplied.

original: nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i gnas yin par mthong bas na rtag tu 'jigs par lta'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i gnas yin par mthong bas na rtag tu 'jigs par lta'o //
translated: One always views it as fearful because one sees that it is associated with the suffering of suffering and is the basis for the arising of the mental afflictions.🔽 One never trusts it.

original: rtag tu yid mi rton ces bya ba 'dir yang srid pa la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rtag tu yid mi rton ces bya ba 'dir yang srid pa la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Here also, in existence is supplied.

original: thang cig bde ba rnams kyang phyis sdug bsngal ba'i rgyur gyur pa 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir rtag tu yid mi rton pa'o //
analyzed: thang cig bde ba rnams kyang phyis sdug bsngal ba'i rgyur gyur pa 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir rtag tu yid mi rton pa'o //
translated: One never trusts it because one sees that even the pleasures of the moment are associated with the suffering of change, which becomes the cause of future suffering.

original: phung po rnams la gsod par 'du shes dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phung po rnams la gsod par 'du shes dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The idea of the aggregates as murderers.

original: dper na gshed pos gsod cing sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa de bzhin du phung po la bdag tu dmigs na yang skye rga na 'chi'i sdug bsngal skye bar mthong bas de dag phung po rnams la gsod par 'du shes so //
analyzed: dper na gshed pos gsod cing sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa de bzhin du phung po la bdag tu dmigs na yang skye rga na 'chi'i sdug bsngal skye bar mthong bas de dag phung po rnams la gsod par 'du shes so //
translated: Just as an executioner kills and causes suffering, so too, when one observes the aggregates as a self, one sees that the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, and death arises. Therefore, one has the idea of the aggregates as murderers.

original: khams rnams la sprul gdug pa lta bur rtog pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khams rnams la sprul gdug pa lta bur rtog pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba la /
translated: The idea of the elements as poisonous snakes.

original: ji ltar sprul gdug pas sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa bskyed pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i khams la brten nas gzugs la sogs pa'i khams la dmigs nas 'dod chags dan zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'byung bar khong du chud pas na khams
analyzed: ji ltar sprul gdug pas sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa bskyed pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i khams la brten nas gzugs la sogs pa'i khams la dmigs nas 'dod chags dan zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'byung bar khong du chud pas na khams
translated: Just as a poisonous snake causes suffering and affliction, so too, one understands that, based on the eye and so on, the elements of form and so on are observed and the afflictions of attachment, aversion, and so on arise. Therefore, one has the idea of the elements as poisonous snakes.

original: rnams la sprul gdug pa lta bur rtog pa'i 'du shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽skye mched rnams @155a * //
analyzed: rnams la sprul gdug pa lta bur rtog pa'i 'du shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽skye mched rnams @155a * //
translated: The idea of the sense bases as an empty village.

original: la grong stong pa lta bur 'du shes pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: la grong stong pa lta bur 'du shes pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The idea of the sense-spheres as an empty village.

original: ji ltar grong stong pa na skye bo dag rgyu ba mi gnas pas stong pa de bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis kyang ming dang gzugs tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar grong stong pa na skye bo dag rgyu ba mi gnas pas stong pa de bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis kyang ming dang gzugs tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Just as an empty village is devoid of people, so the twelve sense-spheres are just name-and-form.

original: bdag dang bdag gir med par rtog bas na skye mched rnams la grong stong lta bur 'du shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir med par rtog bas na skye mched rnams la grong stong lta bur 'du shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one understands that there is no self or belonging to a self, one has the idea of the sense-spheres as an empty village.

original: skye ba'i gnas thams cad la mi smon pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba la skye ba'i gnas ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas thams cad la mi smon pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba la skye ba'i gnas ni bzhi ste /
translated: The idea of not wishing for any place of birth. A place of birth is of four kinds:

original: mngal nas skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba dang / sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba'o //
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba dang / sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba'o //
translated: birth from a womb, birth from an egg, birth from moisture and heat, and spontaneous birth.

original: skyes na de'i rgyus skye ba dang / rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar mthong bas skye gnas de dag tu skye bar mi 'dod cing skye ba mi tshol bas na mi smon pa'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes na de'i rgyus skye ba dang / rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar mthong bas skye gnas de dag tu skye bar mi 'dod cing skye ba mi tshol bas na mi smon pa'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: If one is born, one sees that the suffering of birth, old age, sickness, death, and so on, arises from its cause. Therefore, one does not desire to be born in those places of birth, and one does not seek birth. Therefore, it is called the perception of non-aspiration.

original: gnyen po'i sa la yon tan du lta ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnyen po'i sa la yon tan du lta ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The view of the qualities of the antidote also has two aspects:

original: rnam par grol ba'i bde pa'i rten du gyur pa dang / 'khor ba las brgal zhing sdug bsngal kun spangs par blta ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i bde pa'i rten du gyur pa dang / 'khor ba las brgal zhing sdug bsngal kun spangs par blta ba'o //
translated: the support of the bliss of liberation, and the transcendence of saṃsāra and the abandonment of all suffering.

original: 'di lta ste mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'khor ba'i gnyen po yin te /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa la rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thams cad kyi rten du lta bas mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas su 'du shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'khor ba'i gnyen po yin te / mya ngan las 'das pa la rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thams cad kyi rten du lta bas mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas su 'du shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, nirvāṇa is the antidote to saṃsāra.🔽Since nirvāṇa is seen as the support of all the bliss of liberation, it is called the perception of nirvāṇa as a place to stay.

original: de nyid la 'khor ba las brgal zhing sdug bsngal thams cad spangs par lta bas na skyabs su 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la 'khor ba las brgal zhing sdug bsngal thams cad spangs par lta bas na skyabs su 'du shes pa'o //
translated: Since it is seen as the transcendence of saṃsāra and the abandonment of all suffering, it is the perception of refuge.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa bstan nas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught expertise in the śrāvaka vehicle,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach expertise in the pratyekabuddha vehicle,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “What is a bodhisattva’s expertise in the pratyekabuddha vehicle?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes par bya ba'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes par bya ba'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The pratyekabuddha vehicle that is to be known by bodhisattvas is called the bodhisattva’s pratyekabuddha vehicle.

original: gang dag bskal ba gcig gis ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su bskangs te /
analyzed: gang dag bskal ba gcig gis ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su bskangs te /
translated: Those who, in a single eon, complete the accumulation of wisdom,

original: gzhan gyi man ngag med par 'phags pa'i lam thob nas khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar zhugs pa de dag ni snying rje chen po med pas gzhan la lung dbog pa'i bya ba med pa dang / bdag gcig pu sangs rgyas par byed pas rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi man ngag med par 'phags pa'i lam thob nas khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar zhugs pa de dag ni snying rje chen po med pas gzhan la lung dbog pa'i bya ba med pa dang / bdag gcig pu sangs rgyas par byed pas rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: and, without the instructions of others, having attained the ārya path, enter into freedom from attachment to the three realms, are called pratyekabuddhas because, lacking great compassion, they lack the activity of instructing others and because they attain buddhahood alone.

original: rang sangs rgyas de dag rnam par grol ba'i @155b sar phyin par byed pa'i theg pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas de dag rnam par grol ba'i @155b sar phyin par byed pa'i theg pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ste /
translated: The vehicle that causes those pratyekabuddhas to reach the stage of liberation is the pratyekabuddha vehicle.🔽What is that?

original: gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa dris pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa dris pa'o //
translated: This is a question about being skilled in the pratyekabuddha vehicle.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum du rig bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum du rig bar bya ste /
translated: That is also to be understood as threefold:

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: cause, condition, and result.🔽What are its aspects?

original: de rnam pa gang zhes bya bas rgyu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnam pa gang zhes bya bas rgyu bstan pa yin te /
translated: This teaches the cause.

original: rgyu gang dag gis bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu gang dag gis bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means the cause by which it is done.🔽What are its conditions?

original: rkyen gang zhes bya bas rkyen bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rkyen gang zhes bya bas rkyen bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the conditions.🔽What is the arising of the pratyekabuddhas?

original: rang sangs rgyas 'byung zhes 'bras bu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas 'byung zhes 'bras bu bstan pa yin te /
translated: This teaches the result.

original: khams gsum las byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: khams gsum las byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te /
translated: Having arisen from the three realms, having abandoned all afflictions,

original: mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya'o ;
translated: having become nirvāṇa is called the arising of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen dang 'bras bu rnams phyin ci ma log par khong du chud ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen dang 'bras bu rnams phyin ci ma log par khong du chud ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: As it is in reality means: as it is in reality, without error, in terms of causes, conditions, and effects.

original: de ltar khong du chud pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar khong du chud pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is: one should understand them. One who understands in this way is skilled in the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang 'bras bu de dag gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang 'bras bu de dag gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: What are those causes, conditions, and effects?

original: don gsum bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste zhes gsungs so //🔽de la 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: don gsum bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste zhes gsungs so // de la 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The meaning is: in order to teach those three topics, it is said: Thus.

original: rab tu dben par gnas mal 'cha' ba zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dben par gnas mal 'cha' ba zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Among them, aspiration and effort up to dwelling in solitude teach the cause.

original: bsnyen par dka' zhes bya ba nas brtsams te rang 'byung gi ye shes kyis rab tu rgal zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rkyen bstan to //
analyzed: bsnyen par dka' zhes bya ba nas brtsams te rang 'byung gi ye shes kyis rab tu rgal zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rkyen bstan to //
translated: From difficult to approach up to crossing over by self-arisen wisdom teach the conditions.

original: dmigs pa la gnas pa thob ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dmigs pa la gnas pa thob ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From one attains stability in meditative object up to one attains the summit of the mundane.🔽🔽

original: dmigs pa gang yang rung ba la rkyen gyis ye shes rtogs pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: dmigs pa gang yang rung ba la rkyen gyis ye shes rtogs pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: The result is indicated by the passage beginning with “having attained stability of concentration” and ending with “the realization of intuitive wisdom with regard to any object.”

original: de la rgyu rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The cause is threefold:

original: bstsags pa'i rgyu dang / sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa'i rgyu dang / rigs so //
analyzed: bstsags pa'i rgyu dang / sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa'i rgyu dang / rigs so //
translated: the cause of accumulation, the cause of pleasing a buddha, and the cause of spiritual lineage.

original: de la bsags pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bsags pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause of accumulation is twofold:

original: gang gis bsags pa dang / gang bsags pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis bsags pa dang / gang bsags pa'o //
translated: that by which one accumulates and that which is accumulated.

original: de la gang gis bsags pa ni 'dun pa dang bag yod pa dang brtson 'grus chen po gsum gyis bstsags so //
analyzed: de la gang gis bsags pa ni 'dun pa dang bag yod pa dang brtson 'grus chen po gsum gyis bstsags so //
translated: That by which one accumulates is the three: will, heedfulness, and great effort.

original: gang bstsags pa ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa gsum bstsags so //
analyzed: gang bstsags pa ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa gsum bstsags so //
translated: That which is accumulated is the three: generosity, morality, and learning.

original: gang gis bstsags pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gang gis bstsags pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: That by which one accumulates is threefold:

original: rgyu dang rkyen rkyen dang / sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rkyen dang / sgrub pa'o //
translated: cause, condition, and practice.

original: de la chen po'i sgra ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum po so so dang yang @156a * //
analyzed: de la chen po'i sgra ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum po so so dang yang @156a * //
translated: The word “great” in “great will” and so on is to be supplied with each of the three terms.

original: sbyar te / 'dun pa chen po dang / brtson 'grus chen po dang / bag yod pa chen po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽de la 'dun pa ni dkon mchog dang bden pa dang las la yid ches nas 'di kho na bden gyi gzhan dum yin no zhes 'dzin pa'o //🔽'dis ni rgyu smras pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyar te / 'dun pa chen po dang / brtson 'grus chen po dang / bag yod pa chen po zhes bya bar sbyar ro // de la 'dun pa ni dkon mchog dang bden pa dang las la yid ches nas 'di kho na bden gyi gzhan dum yin no zhes 'dzin pa'o // 'dis ni rgyu smras pa yin te /
translated: Aspiration is the desire to attain the supreme enlightenment.

original: yid ches par gyur na brtson 'grus rtsom pas so //🔽brtson 'grus zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid ches par gyur na brtson 'grus rtsom pas so // brtson 'grus zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the cause, because one who has faith in the Three Jewels, the Truths, and the possibility of attaining the fruits of the religious life, is convinced that this is the truth and not otherwise.

original: spang bar bya ba ma lus par spong ba dang / thob par bya ba thob par byed pa la sems spro ba ni brtson 'grus te /🔽'dis ni rkyen bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma lus par spong ba dang / thob par bya ba thob par byed pa la sems spro ba ni brtson 'grus te / 'dis ni rkyen bstan pa yin te /
translated: Effort is the exertion of the mind in order to eliminate what is to be eliminated and to obtain what is to be obtained.

original: dge ba sgrub pa rnams brtson 'grus la brten pa'i phyir ro //🔽bag yod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba sgrub pa rnams brtson 'grus la brten pa'i phyir ro // bag yod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the condition, because the practice of the wholesome is based on effort.

original: gcig bu dgon pa na gnas shing 'du 'dzi dang mi 'dre ba ni bag yod pa ste /
analyzed: gcig bu dgon pa na gnas shing 'du 'dzi dang mi 'dre ba ni bag yod pa ste /
translated: Heedfulness is the avoidance of the mental afflictions in solitude.

original: 'dis ni sgrub par byed pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgrub par byed pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the practice, because one who is heedful does not become defiled by the mental afflictions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: spang bar bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba gnyis ni bag yod par bsgrubs so //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba gnyis ni bag yod par bsgrubs so //
translated: Because the two, that which is to be abandoned and that which is to be accomplished, are accomplished by means of heedfulness.

original: gang bstsags pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gang bstsags pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The accumulation is also threefold:

original: longs spyod kyi rgyu bstsags pa dang / bde 'gro'i rgyu bstsags pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i rgyu bstsags pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi rgyu bstsags pa dang / bde 'gro'i rgyu bstsags pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i rgyu bstsags pa'o //
translated: the accumulation of the cause of enjoyment, the accumulation of the cause of good rebirth, and the accumulation of the cause of liberation.

original: yang na ser sna'i gnyen po bstsags pa dang / 'dod pa la chags pa'i gnyen po bstsags pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bstsags pa'o ;
analyzed: yang na ser sna'i gnyen po bstsags pa dang / 'dod pa la chags pa'i gnyen po bstsags pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bstsags pa'o ;
translated: Or else, the accumulation of the antidote to stinginess, the accumulation of the antidote to attachment to pleasure, and the accumulation of the antidote to the afflictions.

original: / de la chen po zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus la sogs pa nyan thos dag pas lhag pas na chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de la chen po zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus la sogs pa nyan thos dag pas lhag pas na chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The great refers to the intention, effort, etc. of the pratyekabuddha, which are greater than those of the śrāvaka, and hence are called great.

original: nyan thos lta bu ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi bas shas che zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyan thos lta bu ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi bas shas che zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not like the śrāvaka means greater than the śrāvaka.

original: sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs pa zhes bya bas ser sna'i gnyen po spangs pa bstan te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs pa zhes bya bas ser sna'i gnyen po spangs pa bstan te /
translated: The line the accumulation of merit through generosity teaches the relinquishment that is the antidote to stinginess.

original: sbyin bas rnam par grol ba thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams ni tshogs bsags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin bas rnam par grol ba thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams ni tshogs bsags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are liberated through generosity are said to have accumulated the accumulations.

original: tshul khrims kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs bstsags pa zhes bya bas 'dod pa la chags pa'i gnyen po bstsags pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs bstsags pa zhes bya bas 'dod pa la chags pa'i gnyen po bstsags pa bstan to //
translated: The line the accumulation of merit through morality teaches the accumulation that is the antidote to attachment to pleasure.

original: gang gis / gang ;
analyzed: gang gis / gang ;
translated: What is it?🔽What is it for?

original: gang gi phyir tshul bsrungs ba ni tshul khrims te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshul bsrungs ba ni tshul khrims te /
translated: Morality is what is guarded.

original: gang gis bsrung ba ni mi dge ba bcu las ldog cing rnam bar grol ba 'dod pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis bsrung ba ni mi dge ba bcu las ldog cing rnam bar grol ba 'dod pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: What guards it is the mind that desires liberation, turning away from the ten nonvirtues.

original: gang bsrung ba ni yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: gang bsrung ba ni yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims bsrung ba'o //
translated: What is guarded is the morality of the six-branched discipline.

original: gang gi phyir bsrung ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par @156b bya ba'i phyir bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsrung ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par @156b bya ba'i phyir bsrung ba'o //
translated: What it is for is to guard it for the sake of attaining nirvana.

original: thos pa nyung ba la chos kyi nan tan byed ces bya bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bstsags pa bstan te //
analyzed: thos pa nyung ba la chos kyi nan tan byed ces bya bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bstsags pa bstan te //
translated: The phrase one who has little learning but practices the Dharma indicates the accumulation of the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: thos pa la mi dga' bas cung zad thos pa ni thos pa nyung ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa la mi dga' bas cung zad thos pa ni thos pa nyung ba'o //
translated: One who has little learning is one who, because of his dislike of learning, has heard only a little.

original: chos kyi nan tan byed ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgoms shing sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi nan tan byed ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgoms shing sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase practices the Dharma means that one cultivates and practices the factors of enlightenment.

original: de ni 'di skad du nyan thos ltar thos pa mi mang bar thos pa cung zad cig gis chos kyi nan tan byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du nyan thos ltar thos pa mi mang bar thos pa cung zad cig gis chos kyi nan tan byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is what is being taught: One should practice the Dharma with a little learning, not with a great deal of learning as do the śrāvakas.

original: sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two ways of pleasing the Buddha:

original: chos nyid kyis mnyes par byed pa dang / zang zing gis mnyes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis mnyes par byed pa dang / zang zing gis mnyes par byed pa'o //
translated: pleasing him with the Dharma and pleasing him with material things.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la yang rim gro dang zhes bya bas chos nyid kyis mnyes par byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la yang rim gro dang zhes bya bas chos nyid kyis mnyes par byed pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase one who serves the Lord Buddha indicates pleasing him with the Dharma.

original: ma rig pa'i gnyid las sad cing shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gnyid las sad cing shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is a Buddha because he has awakened from the sleep of ignorance and has realized all objects of knowledge.

original: bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: He is a Bhagavat because he has conquered the four demons.

original: des ji skad du bstan pa'i bka' lung dang bslab pa'i tshig las 'da' bar mi byed pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rim gror byed pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa zhes bya bas zang zing gis mnyes par byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: des ji skad du bstan pa'i bka' lung dang bslab pa'i tshig las 'da' bar mi byed pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rim gror byed pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa zhes bya bas zang zing gis mnyes par byed pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “one who serves and attends upon the Buddha Bhagavats” indicates that one pleases them through material things, because one does not transgress the words of the scriptures and the words of the precepts that they have taught.

original: bskal pa brgya'i bar du phyag 'tshal ba dang / bskor ba dang chos gos la sogs pa bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa brgya'i bar du phyag 'tshal ba dang / bskor ba dang chos gos la sogs pa bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does this by prostrating, circumambulating, and serving them with Dharma robes and so on for up to a hundred eons.

original: zhum pa med ces bya ba ni mnyes pa rnam pa gnyis byed pa la sems spro zhing /
analyzed: zhum pa med ces bya ba ni mnyes pa rnam pa gnyis byed pa la sems spro zhing /
translated: The phrase “without discouragement” means that one is enthusiastic about pleasing them in these two ways and does not become disheartened.

original: spa gong ba med ces bya ba'i don to //🔽des ni mdor na gang la /
analyzed: spa gong ba med ces bya ba'i don to // des ni mdor na gang la /
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “without discouragement.”🔽In brief, this verse teaches what is to be done,

original: gang / gang gis mnyes par byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: gang / gang gis mnyes par byed pa bstan te /
translated: how it is to be done, and by whom it is to be done.

original: gang la mnyes par byed pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la'o //
analyzed: gang la mnyes par byed pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la'o //
translated: One should please the Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: gang ni rim gro byed pa dang bkur stis so //
analyzed: gang ni rim gro byed pa dang bkur stis so //
translated: One should serve them and honor them.

original: gang gis na zhum pa med pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis na zhum pa med pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: One should do so with a fearless mind.🔽In other sūtras, it is said that pratyekabuddhas realize the Dharma by themselves without listening to others, and that pratyekabuddhas appear when buddhas do not appear in the world.

original: mdo gzhan dag las rang sangs rgyas gzhan la ma mnyan par rang gi blos chos rtogs pa dang / sangs rgyas 'jig rten du mi 'byung ba'i tshe rang sangs rgyas 'byung ngo zhes bshad pa yang rang sangs rgyas zag pa med pa'i chos mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe gzhan gyi lung la mi brten pa dang /
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las rang sangs rgyas gzhan la ma mnyan par rang gi blos chos rtogs pa dang / sangs rgyas 'jig rten du mi 'byung ba'i tshe rang sangs rgyas 'byung ngo zhes bshad pa yang rang sangs rgyas zag pa med pa'i chos mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe gzhan gyi lung la mi brten pa dang /
translated: This refers to the time when pratyekabuddhas directly realize the uncontaminated Dharma without relying on the teachings of others.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu thob nas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu thob nas /
translated: And it refers to the time when pratyekabuddhas attain the result of pratyekabuddhahood

original: gdod sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa na 'byung ba la bya'i /
analyzed: gdod sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa na 'byung ba la bya'i /
translated: and appear when there are no buddhas.

original: 'dir ni dang po slob cing tshogs ba sog pa la bya bas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir ni dang po slob cing tshogs ba sog pa la bya bas nyes pa med do //
translated: But here, it refers to the time when they are first training and gathering the accumulations, so there is no fault.

original: rigs kyang rnam pa @157a * //
analyzed: rigs kyang rnam pa @157a * //
translated: Lineage is also of two kinds:

original: gsum ste / nga rgyal spyod pa'i rigs dang / snying rje chung ba'i rigs dang / nyon mongs pa chung ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: gsum ste / nga rgyal spyod pa'i rigs dang / snying rje chung ba'i rigs dang / nyon mongs pa chung ba'i rigs so //
translated: There are three types: the type that practices pride, the type that has little compassion, and the type that has little affliction.

original: nga rgyal spyod pa'i rigs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nga rgyal spyod pa'i rigs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The type that practices pride is also of two types:

original: dbang po 'bring dang / sbyor ba dam pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po 'bring dang / sbyor ba dam pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: those of middling faculties and those who are intent on the pure state.

original: dbang po bar ma zhes bya bas dbang po 'bring bstan te /
analyzed: dbang po bar ma zhes bya bas dbang po 'bring bstan te /
translated: Those of middling faculties are taught by the phrase “those of middling faculties.”

original: dbang po rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Faculties are of three types:

original: rab dang bar ma dang tha ma'o //
analyzed: rab dang bar ma dang tha ma'o //
translated: superior, middling, and inferior.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni dbang po bar ma ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni dbang po bar ma ste /
translated: The pratyekabuddhas have middling faculties.

original: dbang po 'bring gi rigs can no //
analyzed: dbang po 'bring gi rigs can no //
translated: They are of the type with middling faculties.

original: rtag tu rab tu 'byung ba la gzhol zhes bya bas sbyor ba dam pa la gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: rtag tu rab tu 'byung ba la gzhol zhes bya bas sbyor ba dam pa la gnas pa bstan te /
translated: Those who are intent on always going forth are taught by the phrase “those who are intent on the pure state.”

original: rtag tu ni dus thams cad do//
analyzed: rtag tu ni dus thams cad do//
translated: Always means at all times.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa /
translated: As the Bhagavān said:

original: skra dang kha spu bregs gos dur smrig bgos te /
analyzed: skra dang kha spu bregs gos dur smrig bgos te /
translated: Shaving the head and beard, wearing saffron robes,🔽and going forth from home to homelessness.

original: yang dag par dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung zhes gsungs pas ni rab tu byung ba la gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung zhes gsungs pas ni rab tu byung ba la gzhol ba'o //
translated: He went forth from the home into homelessness with true faith shows that he was devoted to going forth.

original: 'dis dge slong gi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis dge slong gi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: This shows the four perfections of a monk:

original: cha lugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: cha lugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: perfection of appearance, perfection of action, perfection of aspiration, and perfection of support.

original: de la skra dang kha spu bregs te gos dur smrig bgos zhes bya bas cha lugs phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la skra dang kha spu bregs te gos dur smrig bgos zhes bya bas cha lugs phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The perfection of appearance is shown by having shaved his head and face and put on the orange robes.

original: cha lugs 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / mi mthun pa yin pas khyim na gnas pa'i cha lugs las phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: cha lugs 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / mi mthun pa yin pas khyim na gnas pa'i cha lugs las phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This appearance is perfect because it is incompatible with the afflictions and secondary afflictions, and it is superior to the appearance of a householder.

original: yang dag par zhes bya bas las phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: yang dag par zhes bya bas las phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The perfection of action is shown by with true faith.

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he went forth by means of the four-part rite of request.

original: dad pas zhes bya bas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: dad pas zhes bya bas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase with faith indicates the excellence of his intention.

original: rgyal po dang rkun po'i 'jigs pas rab tu byung ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyal po dang rkun po'i 'jigs pas rab tu byung ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: He did not go forth out of fear of kings or thieves.

original: dad pas rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pas rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He went forth out of faith.

original: khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung zhes bya bas gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung zhes bya bas gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase he went forth from home into homelessness indicates the excellence of his abode.

original: khyim na gnas pa rnams kyi gnas rab tu mi bzad pa de btang nas khyim med pa'i shing drung la sogs pa la gnas pas so //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa rnams kyi gnas rab tu mi bzad pa de btang nas khyim med pa'i shing drung la sogs pa la gnas pas so //
translated: He gave up the abode of householders, which is very difficult to abandon, and he lived at the foot of a tree, etc., in homelessness.

original: snying rje chung ba'i rigs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: snying rje chung ba'i rigs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The second kind of inferior compassion is also of two types:

original: bdag 'ba' zhig gi don la 'jug pa dang / gzhan gyi don mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig gi don la 'jug pa dang / gzhan gyi don mi byed pa'o //
translated: that which is directed to one's own aim and that which does not benefit others.

original: de la don nyung zhes bya bas bdag 'ba' zhig gi don la 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la don nyung zhes bya bas bdag 'ba' zhig gi don la 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase with few duties indicates that it is directed to one's own aim.

original: bdag zhi @157b bar bya ba dang / grol bar bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par bya ba tsam las bya ba gzhan mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag zhi @157b bar bya ba dang / grol bar bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par bya ba tsam las bya ba gzhan mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He did not undertake any other duties except for the sake of his own peace, liberation, and attainment of nirvana.

original: byed pa nyung zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don mi byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: byed pa nyung zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don mi byed pa bstan te /
translated: The line “with few activities” indicates that they do not work for the welfare of others.

original: gzhan zhi bar bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par bya ba la mi 'bad par bya bas so //
analyzed: gzhan zhi bar bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par bya ba la mi 'bad par bya bas so //
translated: They do not strive to bring others to peace and to nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa chung ba'i rigs kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung ba'i rigs kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The type with few afflictions is also of three kinds:

original: lus dben pa la dga' ba dang / sems dben pa la dga' ba dang / gnas dben pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: lus dben pa la dga' ba dang / sems dben pa la dga' ba dang / gnas dben pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: those who delight in physical solitude, those who delight in mental solitude, and those who delight in the solitude of abiding.

original: 'du 'dzi la mi dga' zhing zhes bya bas lus dben pa la dga' ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi la mi dga' zhing zhes bya bas lus dben pa la dga' ba bstan te /
translated: The line “they do not delight in crowds” indicates that they delight in physical solitude.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'gro ba mang po dang 'dre bar ma mos shing bse ru bzhin dug cig pur gnas par mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'gro ba mang po dang 'dre bar ma mos shing bse ru bzhin dug cig pur gnas par mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not naturally enjoy mixing with many people and they enjoy being alone like a rhinoceros.

original: dben pa la dga' ba zhes bya bas sems dben pa la dga' ba bstan te /
analyzed: dben pa la dga' ba zhes bya bas sems dben pa la dga' ba bstan te /
translated: The line “they delight in solitude” indicates that they delight in mental solitude.

original: de dag 'dod pa dang khong kho ba'i rnam par rtog pa ring du spong bar mos pas so //
analyzed: de dag 'dod pa dang khong kho ba'i rnam par rtog pa ring du spong bar mos pas so //
translated: They enjoy avoiding thoughts of desire and anger.

original: rab tu dpen par gnas mal 'cha' ba zhes bya bas gnas dben pa la dga' ba bstan te /
analyzed: rab tu dpen par gnas mal 'cha' ba zhes bya bas gnas dben pa la dga' ba bstan te /
translated: The line they make their bed in a very secluded place shows that they delight in solitude.

original: shing drung dang ri sul na gnas 'cha' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing drung dang ri sul na gnas 'cha' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they make their bed at the foot of trees and in mountain caves.

original: rkyen kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rkyen kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The conditions are also of four kinds:

original: yon tan dang / gnas pa dang / rtogs pa dang / 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang / gnas pa dang / rtogs pa dang / 'byung ba'o //
translated: those of virtue, of abiding, of realization, and of emergence.

original: yon tan yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yon tan yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The virtues are of three kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa chung zhing dge ba che ba dang / rdzu 'phrul che ba dang / 'bras bu'i sa la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung zhing dge ba che ba dang / rdzu 'phrul che ba dang / 'bras bu'i sa la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: those of little defilement and great virtue, of great miracles, and of delight in the stage of fruition.

original: bsnyen par dka' zhes bya bas nyon mongs pa chung zhing dge ba che bar bstan te /
analyzed: bsnyen par dka' zhes bya bas nyon mongs pa chung zhing dge ba che bar bstan te /
translated: The line they are hard to get close to shows that they have little defilement and great virtue.

original: mthu dang gzi brjid dang byin rnams la gzhan gyis zil gyis mi non zhing des gzhan zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu dang gzi brjid dang byin rnams la gzhan gyis zil gyis mi non zhing des gzhan zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their power, majesty, and grace cannot be overwhelmed by others, and they overwhelm others.

original: mthu che ba zhes bya bas rdzu 'phrul che ba bstan te /
analyzed: mthu che ba zhes bya bas rdzu 'phrul che ba bstan te /
translated: The line they have great power shows that they have great miracles.

original: stod nas me 'bar ba dang / smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bab pa dang / gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stod nas me 'bar ba dang / smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bab pa dang / gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has the power to make fire blaze from above and cold water flow from below, to become one and become many, and so on.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas kyis la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya bas 'bras bu'i sa la dga' ba bstan te ;
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas kyis la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya bas 'bras bu'i sa la dga' ba bstan te ;
translated: The phrase he delights in being the object of generosity indicates the stage of joy, which is the result.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas kyis ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi zhing du gyur pa'i dus dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas kyis ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi zhing du gyur pa'i dus dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ste /
translated: The object of generosity is the field of merit for all beings, and the time is when he has attained the result of arhatship.

original: mngon par dga' ba ni 'bras bu de thob par bya bar sems mos pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba ni 'bras bu de thob par bya bar sems mos pa'o //
translated: Delight is the interest in attaining that result.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bal lta ba zhes bya bas gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bal lta ba zhes bya bas gnas pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase he views dependent origination uninterruptedly indicates the stage of abiding.

original: @158a * // rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya bas ni rtag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @158a * // rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya bas ni rtag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word uninterruptedly means always.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas dus mnyam du 'bras bu 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas dus mnyam du 'bras bu 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste /
translated: Dependent origination is the arising of an effect at the same time as its cause and conditions.

original: de yang phyi dang nang gi rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang phyi dang nang gi rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: It is twofold: external and internal.

original: de la phyi'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni sa bon gyi rkyen gyis myu gu la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: de la phyi'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni sa bon gyi rkyen gyis myu gu la sogs pa'o ;
translated: External dependent origination is the sprout, etc., conditioned by the seed.

original: / nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: / nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs ba'o //
translated: Internal dependent origination is the statement, “Conditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic predispositions,” and so on.

original: lta ba ni phyi nang gi chos 'di rgyu rkyen las 'byung ba tsam du zad kyi bdag dang byed pa po med par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni phyi nang gi chos 'di rgyu rkyen las 'byung ba tsam du zad kyi bdag dang byed pa po med par rtog pa'o //
translated: View is the conception that these outer and inner phenomena are merely arisen from causes and conditions, and that there is no self or agent.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings gcig la rtog pa zhes bya bas rtog pa bstan te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings gcig la rtog pa zhes bya bas rtog pa bstan te /
translated: The statement, “It is the conception of the single sphere of emancipation,” teaches conception.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
translated: The sphere of emancipation is the sphere of nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig tu gnas pa dang 'gro bar sems pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings gcig la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig tu gnas pa dang 'gro bar sems pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings gcig la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To think that one abides only in nirvana and goes to nirvana is called “thinking of the one realm of liberation.”

original: rang 'byung gi ye shes kyis rab tu rgal ba zhes bya bas 'byung ba bstan te /
analyzed: rang 'byung gi ye shes kyis rab tu rgal ba zhes bya bas 'byung ba bstan te /
translated: “One who has crossed over by means of self-originated intuition” shows the emergence.

original: bdag nyid kyi shes rab dang ye shes kyis gang zag la bdag med par rtogs nas nyon mongs pa spangs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi shes rab dang ye shes kyis gang zag la bdag med par rtogs nas nyon mongs pa spangs te /
translated: Having realized the selflessness of the person by means of one’s own wisdom and intuition, one abandons the afflictions and

original: khams gsum las rgal bar gyur pa ni rang byung gi ye shes kyis rab tu rgal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum las rgal bar gyur pa ni rang byung gi ye shes kyis rab tu rgal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: crosses over the three realms. This is called “one who has crossed over by means of self-originated intuition.”

original: 'bras bu thob pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The attainment of the result is also twofold:

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa thob ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa thob ba'o //
translated: the attainment of meditative concentration and the attainment of manifest enlightenment.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The attainment of meditative concentration is also twofold:

original: mi g-yo ba thob pa dang / rgyun du yid la byed pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba thob pa dang / rgyun du yid la byed pa thob pa'o //
translated: the attainment of immovability and the attainment of constant mental attention.

original: dmigs pa la 'jug pa thob pa dang zhes bya bas mi g-yo ba thob pa bstan te /
analyzed: dmigs pa la 'jug pa thob pa dang zhes bya bas mi g-yo ba thob pa bstan te /
translated: “The attainment of engagement with the objective” shows the attainment of immovability.

original: dmigs pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi yul rnams so //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi yul rnams so //
translated: The object is the objects of concentration, such as dependent origination.

original: 'dug pa thob pa ni yul la dmigs pa'i tshe sems rtse gcig pa la gnas pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: 'dug pa thob pa ni yul la dmigs pa'i tshe sems rtse gcig pa la gnas pa thob pa ste /
translated: The attainment of stability is the attainment of the stability of onepointedness of mind when one focuses on an object.

original: phyi rol du mi g-yeng bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du mi g-yeng bar nus pa'o //
translated: It is the ability not to be distracted outwardly.

original: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa rgyun mi chad ces bya bas rgyun du yid la byed pa thob pa bstan te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa rgyun mi chad ces bya bas rgyun du yid la byed pa thob pa bstan te /
translated: The uninterrupted meditative development of the concentrations, the liberations, the meditative attainments and the meditative concentrations is the attainment of constant attention.

original: rgyun mi chad pa ni de dag la rgyun du yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi chad pa ni de dag la rgyun du yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The uninterrupted meditative development of these is constant attention to them.

original: mngon par byang chub pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Enlightenment is also twofold:

original: ston pa dang rjes su ston bar byed par mngon par byang chub pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang rjes su ston bar byed par mngon par byang chub pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: the enlightenment of teaching and instructing and the enlightenment of dependent origination.

original: gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i ye shes bskyed pa dang zhes bya bas ston pa dang @158b rjes su ston pa med par mngon par byang chub pa bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i ye shes bskyed pa dang zhes bya bas ston pa dang @158b rjes su ston pa med par mngon par byang chub pa bstan te /
translated: The generation of the intuition that does not depend on another shows the manifest enlightenment without teacher and without instruction.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi man dag la mi rten par zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes skyed par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi man dag la mi rten par zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes skyed par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that one generates the intuition of non-production without relying on the instructions of a preceptor or master.

original: dmigs pa gang yang rung bal rkyen gyi ye shes rtogs pa ste zhes bya bas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon par byang chub par bstan te /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang yang rung bal rkyen gyi ye shes rtogs pa ste zhes bya bas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon par byang chub par bstan te /
translated: The realization of the intuition of conditions in any objective support shows the manifest enlightenment of dependent origination.

original: dmigs pa'i yul gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul gang yang rung ste /
translated: Any objective domain whatsoever

original: chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes shing khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes shing khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that one understands and comprehends all things as having the nature of dependent origination.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar ro //
translated: Thus means in the manner explained above.

original: 'chad pa ni don to //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni don to //
translated: Expounding means the meaning.

original: ston pa ni tshig go //
analyzed: ston pa ni tshig go //
translated: Teaching means the words.

original: rab tu ston pa ni don dang tshig go ;
analyzed: rab tu ston pa ni don dang tshig go ;
translated: Thoroughly teaching means the meaning and the words.

original: / yang na rgyu ston pa ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: / yang na rgyu ston pa ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: Or else, the teaching of the cause is the explanation,

original: rkyen 'chad pa ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen 'chad pa ni ston pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the condition is the demonstration,

original: 'bras bu 'chad pa ni rab tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'chad pa ni rab tu ston pa'o //
translated: and the teaching of the result is the full demonstration.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the bodhisattva's skill in the vehicle,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, What is the bodhisattva's skill in the universal vehicle? and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi khong du chud par bya ba'i theg pa 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi khong du chud par bya ba'i theg pa 'am /
translated: The vehicle that is to be understood by the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bar phyin par byed pa'i theg pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ste /🔽'dis 'gro bas theg pa 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bar phyin par byed pa'i theg pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ste / 'dis 'gro bas theg pa 'am /
translated: or the vehicle by which the bodhisattvas reach the nirvana that is not a static state, is the bodhisattva's vehicle.🔽It is a vehicle because one goes by it,

original: 'dir 'gro bas theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'gro bas theg pa'o //
translated: or it is a vehicle because one goes in it.

original: de la 'dis 'gro ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa rnams kyis 'gro bas na de dag la theg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dis 'gro ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa rnams kyis 'gro bas na de dag la theg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, it is called a vehicle because one goes by it, since one goes by means of the perfections and the spiritual levels.

original: 'dir 'gro ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gro ba ste /
translated: It is called a vehicle because one goes in it, since one goes in it to the Buddha-stage.

original: de la theg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la theg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called a vehicle.

original: theg pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: theg pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas theg pa chen po ste /
translated: It is a vehicle and it is great, thus it is the Great Vehicle,

original: chen po rnam pa bdun pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po rnam pa bdun pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses seven kinds of greatness.

original: chen po rnam pa bdun ni chos che ba dang / sems bskyed pa che ba dang / bsam pa che ba dang / mos pa che ba dang / tshogs che ba dang / dus che ba dang / thob pa che ba'o //
analyzed: chen po rnam pa bdun ni chos che ba dang / sems bskyed pa che ba dang / bsam pa che ba dang / mos pa che ba dang / tshogs che ba dang / dus che ba dang / thob pa che ba'o //
translated: The seven kinds of greatness are: greatness of Dharma, greatness of generating the mind, greatness of intention, greatness of aspiration, greatness of equipment, greatness of time, and greatness of attainment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa mdo sde tshad med pa'i phyir chos che ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa mdo sde tshad med pa'i phyir chos che ba'o //
translated: It has greatness of Dharma because of the immensity of the scriptures, such as the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pas sems bskyed pa che ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pas sems bskyed pa che ba'o //
translated: It has greatness of generating the mind because it generates the mind for unexcelled perfect enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde la mos pa'i phyir mos pa che ba'o //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde la mos pa'i phyir mos pa che ba'o //
translated: It has greatness of aspiration because it aspires to the scriptures of the profound and the magnificent.

original: bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyi bsam pa thob pas na bsam pa che ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyi bsam pa thob pas na bsam pa che ba'o //
translated: It has greatness of intention because it attains the intention of the sameness of self and others.

original: skad cig ma re re la yang @159a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la yang @159a * //
translated: In each instant,🔽

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa sogs pas na tshogs che ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa sogs pas na tshogs che ba'o //
translated: It is of great accumulation, since it accumulates immeasurable collections of merit in each moment.

original: bskal ba chen po grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du rgyun du sbyar bas na dus che ba'o //
analyzed: bskal ba chen po grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du rgyun du sbyar bas na dus che ba'o //
translated: It is of great time, since it is applied continuously for three measureless kalpas.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pas na thob pa che ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pas na thob pa che ba'o //
translated: It is of great attainment, since it attains the result, the unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: theg pa de'i rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rtogs pa ni theg pa chen po la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de'i rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rtogs pa ni theg pa chen po la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in the Great Vehicle is the realization of its nature, cause, result, and so on.

original: gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la mkhas pa ni dpag tu med de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o // byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la mkhas pa ni dpag tu med de zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is that?🔽Skill in the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattvas is immeasurable.

original: theg pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu phyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu phyin par byed pa ste /
translated: The vehicle is that which conveys one to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: theg pa de las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus kyi sems can grangs med tshad med pa rnams 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir theg pa de tshad med do //
analyzed: theg pa de las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus kyi sems can grangs med tshad med pa rnams 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir theg pa de tshad med do //
translated: Because that vehicle is immeasurable, the wisdom of those skilled in the Great Vehicle is immeasurable.

original: theg pa tshad med pas de la mkhas pa'i shes rab kyang tshad med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po la mkhas pa ni dpag tu med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: theg pa tshad med pas de la mkhas pa'i shes rab kyang tshad med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po la mkhas pa ni dpag tu med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, because the Great Vehicle is immeasurable, those skilled in the Great Vehicle are immeasurable.

original: de ltar theg pa chen po chad med pas na thams cad bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po chad med pas na thams cad bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Thus, the Great Vehicle is not interrupted, and therefore it is not possible to teach it all.

original: de bas na de la phyogs tsam zhig bstan to zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na de la phyogs tsam zhig bstan to zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that only a portion of it is taught.

original: mdo tsam zhig bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdo tsam zhig bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that only a small part of it is taught.

original: tshad med pa de yang yon tan bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa de yang yon tan bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: That immeasurability should be understood as eleven qualities:

original: sems bskyed pa'i yon tan dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i yon tan dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs te /
translated: the quality of generating the mind, the quality of the path, the quality of the result, the quality of the support, the quality of the object, the quality of the aspect, the quality of the practice, the quality of the non-practice, the quality of the practice and non-practice, the quality of the complete practice, and the quality of the abandonment of the obscurations to omniscience.

original: shes pa khong du chud pa'i yon tan dang rgyu bstsags pa'i yon tan dang / spyod pa dag pa'i yon tan dang / mngon par byang chub pa'i yon tan dang / mnyam par phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan dang / nyan thos dang so so'i skye bo'i lam las rgal ba'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: shes pa khong du chud pa'i yon tan dang rgyu bstsags pa'i yon tan dang / spyod pa dag pa'i yon tan dang / mngon par byang chub pa'i yon tan dang / mnyam par phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan dang / nyan thos dang so so'i skye bo'i lam las rgal ba'i yon tan dang /
translated: The qualities of understanding consciousness, the qualities of accumulating the causes, the qualities of pure conduct, the qualities of manifest enlightenment, the qualities of equal benefit, the qualities of transcending the paths of sravakas and ordinary beings,

original: bgegs bcom pa'i yon tan dang / nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i yon tan dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: bgegs bcom pa'i yon tan dang / nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i yon tan dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: the qualities of overcoming obstacles, the qualities of abandoning afflictions and subsidiary afflictions, the qualities of perfect benefit for self and others, and the qualities of perfect fruition.

original: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pas na dpag tu med pa'o zhes bya bas sems bskyed pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pas na dpag tu med pa'o zhes bya bas sems bskyed pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: That vehicle is immeasurable because it opens the way for all sentient beings. This shows the qualities of generating the mind.

original: sems can tshad med pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu gdon zhing mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i skabs 'byed pas na go skabs 'byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu gdon zhing mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i skabs 'byed pas na go skabs 'byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the “opening of opportunity” because it opens the opportunity for the immeasurable sentient beings to be delivered to unsurpassed enlightenment and to manifest complete buddhahood.

original: theg pa de yang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa de yang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: And that vehicle is immeasurable because it is the cause of that.

original: sems can dpag tu med pas de yang dpag tu med @159b pa'o ;
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pas de yang dpag tu med @159b pa'o ;
translated: And that is immeasurable because the sentient beings are immeasurable.

original: / rnam pa gnyis kyis dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: / rnam pa gnyis kyis dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: It is immeasurable in two ways:

original: rgya che ba dang / tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba dang / tshad med pa'o //
translated: vast and limitless.

original: ci tsam du bsgrub par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad sgrub par byed pas rgya che bas so //
analyzed: ci tsam du bsgrub par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad sgrub par byed pas rgya che bas so //
translated: It is vast because it accomplishes all the mundane and supramundane roots of virtue that are to be accomplished.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad kyang sems can gyi don du sgrub par bya ba'i phyir tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad kyang sems can gyi don du sgrub par bya ba'i phyir tshad med pa'o //
translated: And those roots of virtue are limitless because they are accomplished for the sake of sentient beings.

original: yang na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshe sems can 'ga' yang ma bkol bar sems can tshad med pa thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsgral lo zhes sems bskyed pas na /
analyzed: yang na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshe sems can 'ga' yang ma bkol bar sems can tshad med pa thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsgral lo zhes sems bskyed pas na /
translated: Or else, when one generates the Thought of enlightenment, one generates the Thought, “Without employing any sentient beings, I shall liberate all sentient beings, immeasurably many, in the unsurpassed, right, perfect enlightenment.”

original: sems can thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called “the opening for all sentient beings.”

original: sems can dpag tu med pa'i phyir theg pa de yang dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa'i phyir theg pa de yang dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Because sentient beings are immeasurable, that vehicle is immeasurable.

original: theg pa de ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes la btang ba ste /
analyzed: theg pa de ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes la btang ba ste /
translated: That vehicle is directed to unattached intuition,

original: sgrib pa med pa'o zhes bya bas shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs te shes pa khong du chud pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'o zhes bya bas shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs te shes pa khong du chud pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: which is called “unobstructed.” This teaches the quality of understanding through abandoning the obstructions to omniscience.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs nas shes par bya ba'i dngos po rnams skyu ru ra lag mthil du bzhag pa bzhin du gsal bar mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs nas shes par bya ba'i dngos po rnams skyu ru ra lag mthil du bzhag pa bzhin du gsal bar mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Having abandoned all the obstructions to omniscience, the intuition that clearly understands the things to be understood, like a myrobalan fruit on the palm of the hand, is unattached intuition.

original: theg pa de'i ye shes rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de'i ye shes rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: That is the cause of the intuition of that vehicle.

original: theg pa des ye shes thob par byed pas na /
analyzed: theg pa des ye shes thob par byed pas na /
translated: Since that vehicle causes the attainment of pristine wisdom,

original: theg pa de ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes la btang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes la btang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: that vehicle is called “directed toward the pristine wisdom of nonattachment.”

original: da ltar sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur gyur pas theg pa de yang sgrib pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur gyur pas theg pa de yang sgrib pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of the pristine wisdom of nonobstruction in the present, that vehicle is also called “nonobstruction.”

original: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba ste /
translated: That vehicle is the support of all sentient beings,

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa'o zhes bya bas rgyu bstsags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa'o zhes bya bas rgyu bstsags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: since it accumulates the stores of merit and all the roots of virtue.

original: tshogs ji lta ba bstsags pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi gsos su 'gyur ba'i mthu dang ldan pas sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //🔽bsod nams kyi tshogs ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs ji lta ba bstsags pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi gsos su 'gyur ba'i mthu dang ldan pas sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba zhes bya'o // bsod nams kyi tshogs ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since it accumulates the stores in that way, it has the power to be the support of the minds of all sentient beings, and so it is called “the support of all sentient beings.”🔽The store of merit is generosity, morality, and so forth.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The roots of virtue are nonattachment, nonhatred, and so forth.

original: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa las su rung ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su sbyong bar byas pa'o zhes pas spyod pa dag pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa las su rung ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su sbyong bar byas pa'o zhes pas spyod pa dag pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: That vehicle is the purification of all the perfections because it is the fitness of the mental activity of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la gnas pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la @160a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la gnas pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la @160a * //
translated: The resistance to generosity and so on, such as stinginess and immorality, which are present in the mental continua of all sentient beings,

original: sogs pa theg pa des spangs pas na sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa la las su rung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa theg pa des spangs pas na sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa la las su rung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: are abandoned by that vehicle. Therefore, it is called the fitness of the mental activity of sentient beings.

original: de ltar ser sna la sogs pa spangs pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sbyang ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ser sna la sogs pa spangs pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sbyang ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, stinginess and so on are abandoned and the perfections such as generosity are purified.

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are fully completed.

original: theg pa de ni thogs pa med par byang chub kyi snying por 'gro bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs nyams su lon par byed pa'o zhes bya bas mngon par byang chub pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: theg pa de ni thogs pa med par byang chub kyi snying por 'gro bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs nyams su lon par byed pa'o zhes bya bas mngon par byang chub pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This shows the virtue of manifest enlightenment.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs nas sgrib pa gnyis spangs te /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs nas sgrib pa gnyis spangs te /
translated: Having completed the accumulations of merit and pristine wisdom, the two obscurations are abandoned.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras bur gyur pa ni byang chub kyi snying po ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras bur gyur pa ni byang chub kyi snying po ste /
translated: The result of nondual pristine wisdom is the site of enlightenment.

original: dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang byang chub ni sbyin pa'i snying po //
analyzed: dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang byang chub ni sbyin pa'i snying po //
translated: The Sutra of the Teaching of Vimalakirti also says, Enlightenment is the essence of generosity.

original: byang chub ni tshul khrims kyi snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub ni tshul khrims kyi snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Enlightenment is the essence of moral discipline.

original: theg pa de la zhugs pas bdud dang bgegs kyi bar chad med par byang chub kyi snying po thob par 'gyur bas na theg pa de ni thogs pa med par byang chub kyi snying por 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa de la zhugs pas bdud dang bgegs kyi bar chad med par byang chub kyi snying po thob par 'gyur bas na theg pa de ni thogs pa med par byang chub kyi snying por 'gro ba'o //
translated: Since one who has entered that vehicle attains the site of enlightenment without obstruction from demons and obstacles, that vehicle goes to the site of enlightenment without obstruction.

original: de bas na theg pa des thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs shing mthar 'byin par byed pas na tshogs gnyis nyams su lon par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa des thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs shing mthar 'byin par byed pas na tshogs gnyis nyams su lon par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since this vehicle brings to completion and consummation the accumulations of merit and wisdom, which are the causes for attaining the gnosis of omniscience, it is called the practice of the two accumulations.

original: sems can thams cad sbyin pa'i gnas kyi phyir sems can thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i 'od zer mnyam bar gtong ba zhes bya bas mnyam par phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sbyin pa'i gnas kyi phyir sems can thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i 'od zer mnyam bar gtong ba zhes bya bas mnyam par phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: The light rays of non-obstructed equality that are emitted to all sentient beings because they are the recipients of generosity demonstrates the quality of equal benefit.

original: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas bsod nams kyi zhing sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir mthon dman dang nye ring med par byams pa dang ye shes kyi snang ba'i 'od zer snyoms par gtong ngo zhes
analyzed: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas bsod nams kyi zhing sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir mthon dman dang nye ring med par byams pa dang ye shes kyi snang ba'i 'od zer snyoms par gtong ngo zhes
