translated: In order to make all sentient beings become the recipients of generosity, the fields of merit, after they have attained manifest enlightenment in unsurpassable awakening, the light rays of the illumination of love and wisdom are emitted equally, without any sense of high or low, near or far.

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: theg pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i phyir lam ngan pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad las 'das pa'o zhes bya bas nyan thos dang so so'i skye bo'i lam las rgal ba'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: theg pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i phyir lam ngan pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad las 'das pa'o zhes bya bas nyan thos dang so so'i skye bo'i lam las rgal ba'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This shows the quality of transcending the paths of the Sravakas and ordinary beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni spang bar bya ba dang / shes par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / rdzogs par bya ba dang / thob par bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni spang bar bya ba dang / shes par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / rdzogs par bya ba dang / thob par bya ba rnams te /
translated: All the qualities of a Buddha are those to be abandoned, those to be known, those to be accomplished, those to be perfected, and those to be attained.

original: de @160b dag thams cad khong du chud cing /
analyzed: de @160b dag thams cad khong du chud cing /
translated: They are all understood and

original: rtogs pas na mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pas na mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: realized, so they are manifested.

original: de la spang bar bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de la spang bar bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Among them, those to be abandoned are the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: shes par bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: Those to be known are the selflessness of the person and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don to //
translated: Those to be accomplished are the benefit of self and the benefit of others.

original: rdzogs par bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Those to be perfected are the grounds and the perfections.

original: thob par bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The goal is the nirvana that is not a location.

original: chos de dag mngon sum du gyur pas nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das par yang mi ltung /
analyzed: chos de dag mngon sum du gyur pas nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das par yang mi ltung /
translated: Since those phenomena are directly perceived, one does not fall into the nirvana of the śrāvakas,

original: 'khor bar yang mi ltung bas na lam ngan pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar yang mi ltung bas na lam ngan pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and one does not fall into saṃsāra. Therefore, it is called “beyond all dangers of bad paths.”

original: yang na theg pa de ni gang zag la bdag med par mngon sum du byas bas ngan song gsum du skye ba'i 'jigs pa med pas na 'jigs pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na theg pa de ni gang zag la bdag med par mngon sum du byas bas ngan song gsum du skye ba'i 'jigs pa med pas na 'jigs pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, since that vehicle directly perceives the selflessness of persons, it is called “beyond all dangers” because there is no danger of being born in the three lower realms.

original: theg pa de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bgegs 'joms pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: theg pa de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bgegs 'joms pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: That vehicle is endowed with all the factors of enlightenment and so on teaches the quality of destroying obstacles.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par sdong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par sdong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun rnams so //
translated: All the elements that contribute to enlightenment are the thirty-seven elements that lead to enlightenment, beginning with the four close mindfulnesses, the four realistic abandonings, and the four bases of magical powers.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni chos rnams kyi byed pa pos ma byas shing rtag pa dang chad pa las 'das pa rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pas na rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni chos rnams kyi byed pa pos ma byas shing rtag pa dang chad pa las 'das pa rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pas na rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Dependent origination is the natural non-production of all things, because it is beyond being made by a creator and beyond eternalism and nihilism, since it is produced from causes and conditions.

original: nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: It is like space.

original: chos de dag nyid thams cad las 'phags par gnas shing mu stegs dang bdud la sogs pa las rgyal bar byed pas rgyal mtshan dang ba dan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag nyid thams cad las 'phags par gnas shing mu stegs dang bdud la sogs pa las rgyal bar byed pas rgyal mtshan dang ba dan zhes bya'o //
translated: Those very things are called “banner” and “flag” because they stand out above all other things and conquer the extremists, the demons, etc.

original: chos de dag gi sgra gsang mthon por bsgrags pa ni rgyal mtshan dang ba dan bsgreng ba'o //
analyzed: chos de dag gi sgra gsang mthon por bsgrags pa ni rgyal mtshan dang ba dan bsgreng ba'o //
translated: The proclamation of the sound of those things in a loud voice is the raising of the banner and flag.

original: de ltar mu stegs can thams cad las rgyal ba'i rgyal mtshan dang ba dan bsgreng bas pha rol rgol ba mang po dang log pa'i tshogs mang po tshar gcod par byed pas na bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba dang / ngan pa'i tshogs can gyi tshogs rab tu 'joms pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar mu stegs can thams cad las rgyal ba'i rgyal mtshan dang ba dan bsgreng bas pha rol rgol ba mang po dang log pa'i tshogs mang po tshar gcod par byed pas na bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba dang / ngan pa'i tshogs can gyi tshogs rab tu 'joms pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, it is called the total destruction of the hosts of demons, opponents, and evil ones, because it raises the victory banner and flag of victory over all the tirthikas, and because it destroys the many opponents and many hosts of error.

original: bdud ni bdud nyid do /
analyzed: bdud ni bdud nyid do /
translated: The demons are the demons themselves.

original: phas kyi rgol ba ni mu stegs can rnams so //🔽ngan pa'i tshogs can gyi tshogs ni bdud kyi 'khor stobs dang bcas pa 'am /
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba ni mu stegs can rnams so // ngan pa'i tshogs can gyi tshogs ni bdud kyi 'khor stobs dang bcas pa 'am /
translated: Opponents are the tirthikas.🔽The hosts of evil ones are the hosts of demons with their power,

original: mu stegs can 'khor dang bcas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can 'khor dang bcas pa la bya'o //
translated: or the tirthikas with their retinues.

original: theg pa de ni @161a * //
analyzed: theg pa de ni @161a * //
translated: That vehicle is🔽the vehicle of the buddhas, which has become free of obscurations.

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa sgrib pa med par gyur pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa sgrib pa med par gyur pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This and the following passages teach the qualities of abandoning the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: sangs rgyas su 'gro ba'i theg pa ni sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gro ba'i theg pa ni sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ste /
translated: The vehicle that goes to buddhahood is the vehicle of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas su 'gro bar byed pa'i theg pa yang yin la theg pa des nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yang sel bar byed pas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gro bar byed pa'i theg pa yang yin la theg pa des nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yang sel bar byed pas na /
translated: It is also a vehicle for going to Buddhahood, and it also removes the obscurations of the afflictions and secondary afflictions by means of that vehicle.

original: theg pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi theg pa sgrib pa med par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi theg pa sgrib pa med par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that vehicle is called the unobstructed vehicle of the Buddha.

original: de ltar sgrib pa med par 'gyur bas mtha' dang mtha' med par lta ba la sogs pa lta ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams sel bar byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar sgrib pa med par 'gyur bas mtha' dang mtha' med par lta ba la sogs pa lta ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams sel bar byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, since it becomes unobstructed, it removes the afflicted views such as the view of the extremes and the view of the absence of the extremes, and so on.

original: lta ba zhes bya ba'i sgra mthar lta ba dang / mtha' med par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba zhes tshig re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: lta ba zhes bya ba'i sgra mthar lta ba dang / mtha' med par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba zhes tshig re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: The term “view” is applied to each of the following: the view of the extremes, the view of the absence of the extremes, the view of permanence, the view of annihilation, the view of origination, and the view of destruction.

original: de la mtha' dang mtha' med par lta ba ni 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan la brten nas 'jig rten gyi mtha' yod par 'du shes pa dang / mtha' med par 'du shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la mtha' dang mtha' med par lta ba ni 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan la brten nas 'jig rten gyi mtha' yod par 'du shes pa dang / mtha' med par 'du shes pa ste /
translated: In this world, some ascetics and brahmins, on the basis of mundane concentration, perceive the world to have an end or to have no end.

original: de yang ji ltar lta zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar lta zhe na /
translated: How do they view this?

original: 'jig rten gyi mtha' tha mar chad par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur snyam du yang dag par tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mtha' tha mar chad par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur snyam du yang dag par tshol bar byed de /
translated: They investigate whether the world has an end or not.

original: gang gi tshe 'jig pa'i bskal pa rjes su dran pa de'i tshe ni mtha' yod par 'du shes 'byung bas mtha' yod par lta ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jig pa'i bskal pa rjes su dran pa de'i tshe ni mtha' yod par 'du shes 'byung bas mtha' yod par lta ba'o //
translated: When they recall the eon of destruction, they perceive the world to have an end, and so they view it as having an end.

original: gang gi tshe chags pa'i bskal pa dran pa de'i tshe mtha' med pa'i 'du shes 'byung bas mtha' med par lta'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chags pa'i bskal pa dran pa de'i tshe mtha' med pa'i 'du shes 'byung bas mtha' med par lta'o //
translated: When they recall the eon of formation, they perceive the world to have no end, and so they view it as having no end.

original: rtag par lta ba ni dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa ste ;
analyzed: rtag par lta ba ni dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa ste ;
translated: The view of the world as eternal is as follows: Some ascetics and brahmins think that the self and the world are eternal.

original: byas pa ma yin pa dang / byas pas byas pa ma yin pa dang / sprul pa ma yin pa dang / sprul pas byas pa ma yin pa dang / gsad du med pa dang / ther zug tu gnas pa dang / srog shing ltar brtan par gnas pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa'o //🔽chad par lta ba ni dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byas pa ma yin pa dang / byas pas byas pa ma yin pa dang / sprul pa ma yin pa dang / sprul pas byas pa ma yin pa dang / gsad du med pa dang / ther zug tu gnas pa dang / srog shing ltar brtan par gnas pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa'o // chad par lta ba ni dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig 'di lta ste /

original: bdag gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba ji srid du 'dug cing sdod la 'tsho ba de srid du nad dang bcas pa /🔽'bras dang bcas pa /🔽zug rdu dang bcas pa /🔽rims dang bcas pa /🔽yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa yin te /🔽nam shi @161b ba'i 'og tu bdag chad de zhig cing med par gyur pa de na bdag gtan chad par 'gyur ro zhes smra ba'o //🔽'byung bar lta ba ni dngos po skye bar lta ba'o /
analyzed: bdag gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba ji srid du 'dug cing sdod la 'tsho ba de srid du nad dang bcas pa /🔽'bras dang bcas pa /🔽zug rdu dang bcas pa /🔽rims dang bcas pa /🔽yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa yin te /🔽nam shi @161b ba'i 'og tu bdag chad de zhig cing med par gyur pa de na bdag gtan chad par 'gyur ro zhes smra ba'o //🔽'byung bar lta ba ni dngos po skye bar lta ba'o /
translated: It is not created, not created by what is created, not an emanation, not created by an emanation, not to be killed, not to be destroyed, not to be bound, not to be liberated, not to be made to come, not to be made to go, not to be made to sit down, not to be made to get up, not to be made to lie down, not to be made to stand up, not to be made to enter, not to be made to come forth, not to be made to speak, not to be made to be silent, not to be made to give up, not to be made to take up, not to be made to abandon, not to be made to accept, not to be made to go forward, not to be made to turn back, not to be made to go, not to be made to stop, not to be made to slow down, not to be made to speed up, not to be made to come, not to be made to go, not to be made to stay, not to be made to leave, not to be made to stand still, not to be made to move, not to be made to be born, not to be made to age, not to be made to die, not to be made to fall ill, not to be made to be afflicted, not to be made to be happy, not to be made to be unhappy, not to be made to be neutral, not to be made to be non-neutral, not to be made to be virtuous, not to be made to be non-virtuous, not to be made to be defiled, not to be made to be undefiled, not to be made to be compounded, not to be made to be uncompounded, not to be made to be conditioned, not to be made to be unconditioned, not to be made to be mundane, not to be made to be supramundane, not to be made to be with outflows, not to be made to be without outflows, not to be made to be with attachments, not to be made to be without attachments, not to be made to be with grasping, not to be made to be without grasping, not to be made to be with views, not to be made to be without views, not to be made to be with afflictions, not to be made to be without afflictions, not to be made to be with defilements, not to be made to be

original: 'jig par lta ba ni dngos po 'gag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig par lta ba ni dngos po 'gag par lta ba'o //
translated: The view of annihilation is the view that entities cease.

original: lta bar gyur pa thams cad ces smos pa ni ming gis smos pa las ma gtogs pa bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa kun bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa thams cad ces smos pa ni ming gis smos pa las ma gtogs pa bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa kun bsdu ba'o //
translated: The phrase “all views” includes the views of self, etc., which are not mentioned by name.

original: kun nas ldang ba ni nyon mongs pa la mngon sum du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba ni nyon mongs pa la mngon sum du 'byung ba'o //
translated: “ Afflictions” are the manifest afflictions.

original: sgrib pa ni sgrib pa lnga rnams so //
analyzed: sgrib pa ni sgrib pa lnga rnams so //
translated: “ Obscurations” are the five obscurations.

original: chod pa ni dge ba'i bar du gcod pa'i chos dag go //
analyzed: chod pa ni dge ba'i bar du gcod pa'i chos dag go //
translated: “ Obstructions” are the phenomena that obstruct virtue.

original: the tshom ni bden pa dang dkon mchog la yid mi ches pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni bden pa dang dkon mchog la yid mi ches pa'o //
translated: “ Doubt” is a lack of conviction regarding the truths and the Three Jewels.

original: 'gyod pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung phyis sems la gdung ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung phyis sems la gdung ba skye ba'o //
translated: “ Regret” is the mental anguish that arises later, whether one has done what is virtuous or nonvirtuous, or not done what is virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: sel ba ni de dag theg pa 'dis spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sel ba ni de dag theg pa 'dis spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: “ Eliminates” means that this vehicle eliminates them.

original: theg pa de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dang snying rje chen pos phye bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: theg pa de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dang snying rje chen pos phye bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: The vehicle is distinguished by superior intention and great compassion. This teaches the qualities of the perfection of one’s own and others’ goals.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / snying rje chen pos phye bas zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / snying rje chen pos phye bas zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase distinguished by superior attitude and great compassion means that it arises from the cause of great superior attitude and great compassion.

original: de la sems can rnams bde ba la gzhag par sems pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de la sems can rnams bde ba la gzhag par sems pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa chen po'o //
translated: Superior attitude is the intention to establish all sentient beings in happiness.

original: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal med par byed par sems pa ni snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal med par byed par sems pa ni snying rje chen po'o //
translated: Great compassion is the intention to eliminate the suffering of all sentient beings.

original: rgyu de gnyis las byung bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu de gnyis las byung bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
translated: From these two causes, the perfection of one's own and others' goals is achieved.

original: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'ang rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'ang rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The perfection of one's own goal is also fourfold.

original: gang zhe na chos phun sum tshogs pa dang / theg pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhe na chos phun sum tshogs pa dang / theg pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: What are the four? The perfection of Dharma, the perfection of vehicle, the perfection of mundane and supramundane wealth, and the perfection of the path to non-abiding nirvana.

original: de la chos thams cad phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya bas chos phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya bas chos phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase endowed with all good qualities indicates the perfection of Dharma.

original: chos kyang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: chos kyang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Dharma is also of three kinds.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: shes par bya ba'i chos dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / thob par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i chos dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / thob par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma to be understood, the Dharma to be practiced, and the Dharma to be realized.

original: de la shes par bya ba'i chos ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de la shes par bya ba'i chos ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The Dharma to be understood is the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun @162a * //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun @162a * //
translated: The Dharma to be practiced is the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: no ; / thob par bya ba'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: no ; / thob par bya ba'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The Dharma to be realized is nirvāṇa.

original: de dag dang ldan pas na chos thams cad phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pas na chos thams cad phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is endowed with these, it is called endowed with all good qualities.

original: rin po che thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya bas theg pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: rin po che thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya bas theg pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase endowed with all jewels indicates the perfection of vehicle.

original: theg pa der sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog gsum dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa thams cad 'dus pas na rin po che thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa der sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog gsum dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa thams cad 'dus pas na rin po che thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the Three Jewels, the Buddha and so on, and all the vehicles, such as the Śrāvaka Vehicle, are included in that vehicle, it is called “endowed with all jewels.”

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rnyed pa zhes bya bas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rnyed pa zhes bya bas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: “The attainment of all perfections” indicates the perfection of the mundane and supramundane excellences.

original: theg pa de la brten nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: theg pa de la brten nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur bas /
translated: Since all mundane and supramundane perfections are attained by relying on that vehicle,

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “the attainment of all perfections.”

original: mi slu ba'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya bas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya bas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: “The path that leads to the undeceiving” indicates the perfection of the path to nonabiding nirvāṇa.

original: mi slu ba'i lam ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i lam ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam mo //
translated: The undeceiving path is the path to nonabiding nirvāṇa.

original: theg pa 'dis kyang lam der 'gro ba 'am /
analyzed: theg pa 'dis kyang lam der 'gro ba 'am /
translated: This vehicle leads to that path.

original: lam de dang mthun pa'i phyir mi slu ba'i lam du 'gro ba'o //🔽sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: lam de dang mthun pa'i phyir mi slu ba'i lam du 'gro ba'o // sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: It is the path that leads to the non-deceptive, because it is in accordance with that path.🔽It is the support of all beings, because it is the support of all beings.

original: theg pa de la zhugs na sems can thams cad phan pa dang bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa de la zhugs na sems can thams cad phan pa dang bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the support of all beings, because when one has entered that vehicle, all beings obtain benefit and happiness.

original: theg pa de ni thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan bstan te /🔽rnam pa thams cad du dus thams cad du /
analyzed: theg pa de ni thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan bstan te / rnam pa thams cad du dus thams cad du /
translated: That vehicle is without fault in every way, etc.

original: gnas thams cad du /🔽phyogs thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pas na theg pa de ni thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas thams cad du / phyogs thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pas na theg pa de ni thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is without fault in every way, because it is without fault in all ways, at all times, in all places, and in all directions.🔽It is without fault in every way, because it is without fault in all ways, at all times, in all places, and in all directions.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without fault in every way, because it is without fault in all ways, at all times, in all places, and in all directions.🔽It is without fault in every way, because it is without fault in all ways, at all times, in all places, and in all directions.

original: dus thams cad du ni dus gsum du yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi byed pas so //
analyzed: dus thams cad du ni dus gsum du yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi byed pas so //
translated: At all times means in the three times as well, because one does not engage in sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: gnas thams cad ni lha dang mi'i gnas gang du phyin kyang sdig pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas thams cad ni lha dang mi'i gnas gang du phyin kyang sdig pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In all places means that one does not engage in sin wherever one goes, in the places of gods and humans.

original: phyogs thams cad ni phyogs bcu kun du sdig pa mi byed pas so //
analyzed: phyogs thams cad ni phyogs bcu kun du sdig pa mi byed pas so //
translated: In all directions means that one does not engage in sin in any of the ten directions.

original: chos 'og nas smos pa rnams kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos 'og nas smos pa rnams kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The ornaments of the dharmas that are mentioned below are called ornaments.

original: de dag ni gong du bshad par zad do//
analyzed: de dag ni gong du bshad par zad do//
translated: They have already been explained above.

original: @162b gong du bshad pa rnams mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: @162b gong du bshad pa rnams mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the above,

original: gang 'di la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang 'di la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “One who is skilled in this…” and so on.

original: gang 'di la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: gang 'di la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa rnams la'o //
translated: “One who is skilled in this” refers to the above explanations.

original: chos thams cad la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach skill in all dharmas,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes dris so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes dris so //
translated: it is asked, “What is the bodhisattva’s skill in all dharmas?”

original: dris pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir chos thams cad ces bya ba ni mdor na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dris pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir chos thams cad ces bya ba ni mdor na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to answer the question, he says that all phenomena in brief are called conditioned and unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su chos thams cad 'dus pas 'dus pa'i don gyis de gnyis la chos thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su chos thams cad 'dus pas 'dus pa'i don gyis de gnyis la chos thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are included in the conditioned and the unconditioned, they are called all phenomena because they have the meaning of being included.

original: de la gang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / zag pa med pa'i chos ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: de la gang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / zag pa med pa'i chos ni 'dus byas so //
translated: Among them, conditioned phenomena are those phenomena with and without defilements that are generated by causes and conditions.

original: gang rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang stong pa nyid dang chos kyi dbyings ni 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: gang rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang stong pa nyid dang chos kyi dbyings ni 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The unconditioned is suchness, the perfect limit, emptiness, and the dharmadhatu that are not generated by causes and conditions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la mkhas par bya ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud par bya ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la mkhas par bya ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud par bya ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the phrase the bodhisattva should be skilled regarding the conditioned and the unconditioned means that bodhisattvas should understand the characteristics of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: gang de dag lus kyi 'du byed dge ba dang / ngag gi 'du byed dge ba dang / yid kyi 'du byed dge ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang de dag lus kyi 'du byed dge ba dang / ngag gi 'du byed dge ba dang / yid kyi 'du byed dge ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Regarding the statement those who have virtuous bodily volitions, virtuous verbal volitions, and virtuous mental volitions,

original: srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / 'dod pas log par mi g-yem pa ni lus kyi 'du byed dge ba'o //
analyzed: srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / 'dod pas log par mi g-yem pa ni lus kyi 'du byed dge ba'o //
translated: the virtuous bodily volitions are refraining from killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct.

original: brdzun dang phra ma dang ngag rtsub po dang tshig kyal pa'i tshig mi smra ba ni ngag gi 'du byed dge ba'o //
analyzed: brdzun dang phra ma dang ngag rtsub po dang tshig kyal pa'i tshig mi smra ba ni ngag gi 'du byed dge ba'o //
translated: The virtuous verbal volitions are refraining from lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle chatter.

original: brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba spangs pa ni yid kyi 'du byed dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba spangs pa ni yid kyi 'du byed dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The virtuous mental volitions are abandoning covetousness, ill will, and wrong views.

original: de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: All of these are dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni gong du smos ma thag pa'i 'du byed rnam gsum mngon par 'dus byas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni gong du smos ma thag pa'i 'du byed rnam gsum mngon par 'dus byas pa'o //
translated: Here, these refers to the three types of compositional activity that were just mentioned.

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub de spong ba dang ; ye shes dang sgrub pa dang dus dang thob pa dang ldan pa dang spyod pa la sogs pas nyan thos kyi byang chub las khyad zhugs pa'i phyir bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub de spong ba dang ; ye shes dang sgrub pa dang dus dang thob pa dang ldan pa dang spyod pa la sogs pas nyan thos kyi byang chub las khyad zhugs pa'i phyir bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Unsurpassed means that enlightenment is called unsurpassed because it is superior to the enlightenment of the śrāvakas in terms of abandonment, wisdom, practice, time, attainment, endowment, conduct, and so on.

original: de la spong pa khyad zhugs pa ni nyan thos kyi byang chub kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam spong bar zad kyi /🔽'dis ni nyon mongs @163a * //
analyzed: de la spong pa khyad zhugs pa ni nyan thos kyi byang chub kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam spong bar zad kyi / 'dis ni nyon mongs @163a * //
translated: Here, the superiority of abandonment is that the enlightenment of the śrāvakas only abandons the afflictive obstructions.

original: pa dang ; shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis spangs pas spong ba khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: pa dang ; shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis spangs pas spong ba khyad zhugs so //
translated: This [enlightenment] abandons both the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, so abandonment is superior.

original: ye shes ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam khong du chud par zad kyi /
analyzed: ye shes ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam khong du chud par zad kyi /
translated: Wisdom is the mere understanding of the selflessness of persons.

original: 'dis ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes khong du chud pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes khong du chud pas so //
translated: This is because they have realized the transcendent wisdom of the no self of the individual and of phenomena.

original: sgrub pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas bdag gi don bsgrub pa tsam du zad kyis 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pas na sgrub pa khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas bdag gi don bsgrub pa tsam du zad kyis 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pas na sgrub pa khyad zhugs so //
translated: Accomplishment is superior because while the sravakas and so on merely accomplish their own goal, this accomplishes the goals of both self and other.

original: dus ni nyan thos la sogs pa tshe gsum mam bdun gyi bar du sbyor ba tsam du zad kyi 'di ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du sbyor bas na dus khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: dus ni nyan thos la sogs pa tshe gsum mam bdun gyi bar du sbyor ba tsam du zad kyi 'di ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du sbyor bas na dus khyad zhugs so //
translated: Time is superior because while the sravakas and so on merely apply themselves for three or seven lifetimes, this applies itself for three measureless kalpas.

original: thob pa ni nyan thos kyis dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par zad kyi /
analyzed: thob pa ni nyan thos kyis dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par zad kyi /
translated: Attainment is superior because while the sravakas attain the result of arhatship,

original: 'dis ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pas na thob pa la khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pas na thob pa la khyad zhugs so //
translated: this attains the result of unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: ldan pa ni nyan thos dag zad par gyi skye mched dang zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par zad kyi /
analyzed: ldan pa ni nyan thos dag zad par gyi skye mched dang zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par zad kyi /
translated: Possession is superior because while the sravakas possess qualities such as the bases of subjugation and the bases of totality,

original: 'di ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan dang ldan pas na ldan pa khyad zhugs so //🔽spyod pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas dang pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan dang ldan pas na ldan pa khyad zhugs so // spyod pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas dang pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod kyi /
translated: It is endowed with special qualities such as the powers and the fearlessnesses.🔽The practice is special because the bodhisattva does not practice the perfections as the sravakas and so on do.

original: 'dis ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas na spyod pa khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas na spyod pa khyad zhugs so //
translated: He practices the perfections and the levels.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Perfect enlightenment means the perfect realization of all dharmas without error.

original: byang chub ni spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: Enlightenment is distinguished by the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of wisdom.

original: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: It is as explained above.

original: byang chub de lta bu thob par bya ba'i phyir dge ba mngon par 'dus byas pa rnams bsngo ba de ni byang chub tu bsngo ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub de lta bu thob par bya ba'i phyir dge ba mngon par 'dus byas pa rnams bsngo ba de ni byang chub tu bsngo ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The dedication of the virtuous activities to the attainment of such enlightenment is called the dedication to enlightenment.

original: de ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa'o //
translated: This is the skill in the conditioned.

original: gang yang dge ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'du byed mngon par 'dus byas pa de dag thams cad byang chub la rtog pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngo ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang dge ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'du byed mngon par 'dus byas pa de dag thams cad byang chub la rtog pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngo ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: All the virtuous compositional activities of body, speech, and mind that one has engaged in are dedicated to omniscience by being conceived as enlightenment.

original: gong du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba bshad pa la byang chub la rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ma smos pas 'dus byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba bshad pa la byang chub la rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ma smos pas 'dus byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: In the previous explanation of the dedication to unsurpassed enlightenment, the term “conceived as enlightenment” was not mentioned, so it should be understood as conditioned.

original: 'dir ni byang chub la rtog pa zhes smos pas /
analyzed: 'dir ni byang chub la rtog pa zhes smos pas /
translated: Here, since the term “conceived as enlightenment” is mentioned,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dge ba ji spyad pa thams cad kyang byang chub kyi mtshan nyid dang dbyer med par stong pa nyid du brtags nas thams cad mkhyen pa thob par bya ba'i phyir @163b bsngo ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dge ba ji spyad pa thams cad kyang byang chub kyi mtshan nyid dang dbyer med par stong pa nyid du brtags nas thams cad mkhyen pa thob par bya ba'i phyir @163b bsngo ste /
translated: all the virtuous activities of body, speech, and mind that one has engaged in are also dedicated to attaining omniscience by investigating them as emptiness, inseparable from the characteristic of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyang 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyang 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since enlightenment also has the characteristic of being unconditioned, it is called “expertise in the unconditioned.”

original: gzhan yang 'dus ma byas pa la mkhas pa ni zhes bya bas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs gzhan ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dus ma byas pa la mkhas pa ni zhes bya bas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs gzhan ston te /
translated: Moreover, the line “skill in the unconditioned” presents another enumeration of skill in the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga sgrub pa ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga sgrub pa ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The practice of the five perfections is called “skill in the conditioned.”

original: gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dus ma byas pa la mkhas par bstan to //
analyzed: gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dus ma byas pa la mkhas par bstan to //
translated: The line “the perfection of wisdom” and so on teaches the perfection of wisdom as skill in the unconditioned.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the perfection of wisdom like?

original: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag la mi smod cing ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag la mi smod cing ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “without disparaging the five unconditioned perfections.”

original: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni 'dus ma byas kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni 'dus ma byas kyi ye shes te /
translated: The wisdom that observes emptiness is the wisdom of the unconditioned.

original: dngos su na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
translated: In actuality, it should be understood as nonconceptual wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu yin pas smad pa yin yang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu yin pas smad pa yin yang /
translated: The five perfections are censured because they are the cause of birth in cyclic existence.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de la sun 'byin par mi byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la mi smod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de la sun 'byin par mi byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la mi smod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But the perfection of wisdom does not censure them. This is called “not censuring the five perfections.”

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi tshogs so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi tshogs so //
translated: The collection of all the perfections is the collection of the six perfections such as generosity.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The roots of virtue are non-attachment and so forth.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bstsags par bya ba'i don du 'am ched du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bstsags par bya ba'i don du 'am ched du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “For the sake of” means for the purpose of, or for the sake of, accumulating the collection of the perfections and the collection of roots of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva’s liberation is non-abiding nirvana, which is the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad mkhyen pa ni dngos po thams cad thugs su chud pa me long lta bu'i ye shes la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad mkhyen pa ni dngos po thams cad thugs su chud pa me long lta bu'i ye shes la bya'o //
translated: The omniscience of the bodhisattva is the mirror-like intuition which is the intuition of all things.

original: bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang ye shes de thob par bya ba'i don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang ye shes de thob par bya ba'i don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa bsngo ba'o //
translated: The dedication is the accomplishment of the six perfections for the sake of attaining nirvana and that intuition.

original: de dag gis ni 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: By these, this is taught:

original: gong du sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lnga rnams ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos rtog pa'i rang rang bzhin ma yin pas 'dus byas la mkhas par bshad /
analyzed: gong du sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lnga rnams ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos rtog pa'i rang rang bzhin ma yin pas 'dus byas la mkhas par bshad /
translated: The five perfections beginning with giving, since they are not the uncompounded nature of the realization of dharmas, are explained as skill in the compounded.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dus ma byas rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas 'dus ma byas la mkhas par bshad do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dus ma byas rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas 'dus ma byas la mkhas par bshad do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, since it is the uncompounded nature of the realization of dharmas, is explained as skill in the uncompounded.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs ston te /
translated: Moreover, etc. shows the synonyms of skill in the compounded and skill in the uncompounded.

original: @164a * // ye shes dang snying rjes sems can thams cad la bltas nas ci rigs par phan 'dogs par byed pa ni sems can thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @164a * // ye shes dang snying rjes sems can thams cad la bltas nas ci rigs par phan 'dogs par byed pa ni sems can thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Looking at all sentient beings with wisdom and compassion and benefiting them as much as possible is called “emitting the light of unobstructed equality to all sentient beings.”

original: de ltar phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang ; don spyod pa dang / don mthun par spyod pa bzhis sems can sdud par byed pa ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang ; don spyod pa dang / don mthun par spyod pa bzhis sems can sdud par byed pa ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, in order to benefit them, gathering sentient beings with the four means of gathering—generosity, kind talk, meaningful actions, and practicing what one preaches—is called “being skilled in the conditioned.”

original: mi 'dzin mi len mchog tu 'dzin par mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa la de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: mi 'dzin mi len mchog tu 'dzin par mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa la de lta mod kyi /
translated: “ Not grasping, not taking up, not holding as paramount” and so on.

original: don dam par stong pa yin pas phyi'i yul la dngos por mi 'dzin /
analyzed: don dam par stong pa yin pas phyi'i yul la dngos por mi 'dzin /
translated: Even though that is so, since they are ultimately empty, one does not grasp external objects as real things.

original: nang gi dngos po la bdag tu mi len la /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po la bdag tu mi len la /
translated: One does not take up internal things as a self.

original: de ltar dngos po dang bdag tu ma grub pas phan btags so zhes mchog tu 'dzin par yang mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po dang bdag tu ma grub pas phan btags so zhes mchog tu 'dzin par yang mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since things and a self are not established in that way, one does not hold benefiting them as paramount. This is what it means.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa de yang 'dus ma byas la mos pa zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa de yang 'dus ma byas la mos pa zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That skill in the means of gathering disciples is also called “interest in the uncompounded.” The meaning is that one is interested in the means of gathering disciples as having the nature of emptiness.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar stong pa nyid du mos pas bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa de de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo ba ni byang chub
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar stong pa nyid du mos pas bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa de de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo ba ni byang chub
translated: “Dedication to omniscience” means that, by such interest in emptiness, one dedicates that skill in the means of gathering disciples to the attainment of the gnosis of omniscience, which is the realization of suchness.

original: sems dpa'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems dpa'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s skill in the uncompounded.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Wishing to teach other synonyms of skill in the compounded and the uncompounded,

original: gzhan yang 'dus byas la mkhas pa ni gang 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyon mongs pa rnams gcod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dus byas la mkhas pa ni gang 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyon mongs pa rnams gcod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Moreover, skill in the compounded is the cutting off of the afflictions that are the continuity of cyclic existence,” and so on.

original: de la 'dus byas la mkhas pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas la mkhas pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of skill in the conditioned:

original: 'jig rten pa'i rgyu la mkhas pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rgyu la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rgyu la mkhas pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rgyu la mkhas pa'o //
translated: skill in worldly causes and skill in supraworldly causes.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rgyu la mkhas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rgyu la mkhas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Skill in worldly causes is also twofold:

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu spong ba la mkhas pa dang / bde ba'i rgyu bskyed pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu spong ba la mkhas pa dang / bde ba'i rgyu bskyed pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: skill in abandoning the cause of suffering and skill in producing the cause of happiness.

original: gang 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyon mongs pa rnams gcod pa dang zhes bya bas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yongs su spong ba la mkhas pa bstan te /
analyzed: gang 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyon mongs pa rnams gcod pa dang zhes bya bas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yongs su spong ba la mkhas pa bstan te /
translated: The line “and the cutting off of the afflictions that perpetuate cyclic existence” teaches skill in abandoning the cause of suffering.

original: 'khor bar rgyun du skye bar byed pa'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du sbyor ba'i tshogs ni 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar rgyun du skye bar byed pa'i rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du sbyor ba'i tshogs ni 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The collection of fetters such as attachment that cause birth in cyclic existence are called “the afflictions that perpetuate cyclic existence.”

original: de rnams spong bar byed pa ni nyon @164b mongs pa rnams gcod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams spong bar byed pa ni nyon @164b mongs pa rnams gcod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The abandonment of those is called “the cutting off of the afflictions.”

original: 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mi gcod pa dang zhes bya bas bde ba'i rgyu bskyed pa la mkhas pa bstan te ;
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mi gcod pa dang zhes bya bas bde ba'i rgyu bskyed pa la mkhas pa bstan te ;
translated: The line “without severing the roots of virtue that perpetuate cyclic existence” teaches skill in producing the causes of happiness.

original: gang 'khor ba la rgyun du lha dang mir skye bar byed pa'i rgyu dge ba bcu dang / 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa gcig nas gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad par byed pas na /
analyzed: gang 'khor ba la rgyun du lha dang mir skye bar byed pa'i rgyu dge ba bcu dang / 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa gcig nas gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad par byed pas na /
translated: The roots of virtue that cause one to be born continuously in cyclic existence as a god or human are the ten virtues and the roots of virtue such as nonattachment and nonaversion.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyun mi dge ba'i rtsa ba mi gcod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyun mi dge ba'i rtsa ba mi gcod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one causes these roots of virtue to be uninterrupted, one is said to “not sever the roots of virtue that perpetuate cyclic existence.”

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rgyu la mkhas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rgyu la mkhas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Skill in the causes that transcend the world is also twofold.

original: byang chub chen po'i rgyu rgyun mi gcod pa dang / zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i rgyu sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i rgyu rgyun mi gcod pa dang / zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i rgyu sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is the avoidance of severing the cause of great enlightenment and the avoidance of accomplishing the cause of a one-sided peace.

original: byang chub sgrub pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyi rgyun 'brel ba zhes bya bas byang chub chen po'i rgyu rgyun mi gcod pa bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sgrub pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyi rgyun 'brel ba zhes bya bas byang chub chen po'i rgyu rgyun mi gcod pa bstan te /
translated: The line “the continuity of the fetters that accomplish enlightenment” teaches the avoidance of severing the cause of great enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi don ni gong du smras par zad do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi don ni gong du smras par zad do //
translated: The meaning of enlightenment has already been explained above.

original: kun du sbyor ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Bondage is the practice of serenity and insight.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa gang gis byang chub thob par byed pa de ni byang chub sgrub pa'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa gang gis byang chub thob par byed pa de ni byang chub sgrub pa'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The practice of serenity and insight by which one attains enlightenment is called the bondage of achieving enlightenment.

original: de ltar bsgom pa rgyun mi gcod pa ni kun du sbyor ba rnams kyi rgyun 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa rgyun mi gcod pa ni kun du sbyor ba rnams kyi rgyun 'brel pa'o //
translated: The continuity of the practice is the continuity of the bondage.

original: nyi tshe ba'i kun du sbyor ba rnams mi spyad pa zhes bya bas zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i rgyu sgrub par mi byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i kun du sbyor ba rnams mi spyad pa zhes bya bas zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i rgyu sgrub par mi byed pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “not practicing the limited bondage” shows the non-achievement of the cause of one-sided peace.

original: nyi tshe'i kun du sbyor ba ni zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyi tshe'i kun du sbyor ba ni zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: Limited bondage is the practice of serenity and insight which is the cause for attaining the nirvana of one-sided peace.

original: mi spyad pa ni de lta bu'i rgyu la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mi spyad pa ni de lta bu'i rgyu la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Not practicing is not engaging in such a cause.

original: yang na 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyon mongs pa rnams gcod kyang byang chub chen po thob par byed pa'i rgyu rgyun mi gcod pas na byang chub sgrub pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyi rgyun 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyon mongs pa rnams gcod kyang byang chub chen po thob par byed pa'i rgyu rgyun mi gcod pas na byang chub sgrub pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams kyi rgyun 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, although he severs the afflictions of the continuum of cyclic existence, he does not sever the continuum of the cause that attains great enlightenment. Thus, it is called “the connection of the fetters that accomplish enlightenment.”

original: 'khor bar skye ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rgyun mi gcod pas zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das par ma lhung ba'i phyir nyi tshe ba'i kun du sbyor ba rnams mi spyad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar skye ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rgyun mi gcod pas zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das par ma lhung ba'i phyir nyi tshe ba'i kun du sbyor ba rnams mi spyad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He does not practice the limited fetters because he does not fall into the one-sided nirvāṇa by severing the continuum of the roots of virtue that are born in cyclic existence.

original: gang yang stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa bstan te /
analyzed: gang yang stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa bstan te /
translated: Moreover, beginning from “skill in the unconditioned,” skill in the unconditioned is taught.

original: de yang ting nge 'dzin gsum la dbang thob pa dang / gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la mi brten par de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin nyid khong du chud kyang de'i phyogs la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ting nge 'dzin gsum la dbang thob pa dang / gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la mi brten par de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin nyid khong du chud kyang de'i phyogs la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the attainment of mastery over the three meditative stabilizations, the comprehension of suchness without relying on instruction and teaching, and even though one comprehends suchness, one does not abide in its side.

original: gang stong pa @165a * //
analyzed: gang stong pa @165a * //
translated: What is emptiness?

original: nyid dang mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin gsum la dbang thob pa bstan te /
analyzed: nyid dang mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin gsum la dbang thob pa bstan te /
translated: The three concentrations are taught by the three verses beginning with “signless, wishless, and so on.”

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni gong du bshad par zad do //🔽ye shes gang gis ting nge 'dzin de gsum la dbang byed par 'gyur ba de la ni 'dris par byed pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni gong du bshad par zad do // ye shes gang gis ting nge 'dzin de gsum la dbang byed par 'gyur ba de la ni 'dris par byed pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
translated: The three concentrations are emptiness, wishlessness, and signlessness.🔽The wisdom by which one gains mastery of those three concentrations is called the wisdom of familiarity.

original: ye shes de mngon sum du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: ye shes de mngon sum du gyur pa'am /
translated: The wisdom of familiarity is the direct realization of those three concentrations.

original: ye shes de rtogs pa ni rtogs pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes de rtogs pa ni rtogs pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of realization is the skill in realization.

original: byang chub tu gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog cing zhes bya bas gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la mi brten bar de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub tu gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog cing zhes bya bas gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la mi brten bar de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa bstan te /
translated: The verse beginning “not dependent on others for enlightenment” teaches the realization of suchness without relying on instruction and teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bstan pa'i man ngag la mi brten par stong pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa ni byang chub gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bstan pa'i man ngag la mi brten par stong pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa ni byang chub gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not relying on the instructions of the Tathagata, the preceptor, and the teacher, the understanding of the characteristic of the non-duality of emptiness is called “enlightenment that does not depend on another.”

original: 'dus ma byas mngon sum du mi byed ces bya bas de bzhin nyid khong du chud kyang de'i phyogs la mi gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas mngon sum du mi byed ces bya bas de bzhin nyid khong du chud kyang de'i phyogs la mi gnas pa bstan te /
translated: “Not actualizing the unconditioned” indicates the understanding of suchness without abiding in its extreme.

original: 'dus ma byas ni mya ngan las 'das pa'am stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni mya ngan las 'das pa'am stong pa nyid do //
translated: The unconditioned is nirvana or emptiness.

original: mngon sum du mi byed pa ni de dag khong du chud cing thob kyang de'i phyogs la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du mi byed pa ni de dag khong du chud cing thob kyang de'i phyogs la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Not actualizing it means that, although one understands and attains it, one does not abide in its extreme.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach another aspect of skill in the conditioned and unconditioned, he says, “Moreover, skill in the conditioned,” and so on.

original: khams gsum na yang spyod la mkhas gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pas kyang mi gos zhes bya bas ni sems can thams cad kyi don du khams gsum na yang gnas la /
analyzed: khams gsum na yang spyod la mkhas gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pas kyang mi gos zhes bya bas ni sems can thams cad kyi don du khams gsum na yang gnas la /
translated: This means that, for the sake of all beings, they live in the three realms,

original: padmo 'dam las skyes kyang 'dam gyi nyes pas mi gos pa bzhin du khams gsum na yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pas mi gos pa 'di ni /
analyzed: padmo 'dam las skyes kyang 'dam gyi nyes pas mi gos pa bzhin du khams gsum na yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pas mi gos pa 'di ni /
translated: but, like a lotus growing in the mud yet unsullied by the defects of the mud, they are not tainted by the attachments, etc. of the three realms.

original: 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called skill in the conditioned.

original: gang yang khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba'i ye shes rab tu shes kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba'i ye shes rab tu shes kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: And, though they know the intuition that is released from the three realms,

original: khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba'i ye shes ni nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dang / spongs pa mngon du gyur pa zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes la bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba'i ye shes ni nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dang / spongs pa mngon du gyur pa zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes la bya'o //
translated: the intuition that is released from the three realms is the intuition of the abandonment of the addictions and of the realization of their abandonment, the intuition of exhaustion and of non-arising.

original: rab tu shes kyang zhes bya ba ni de mngon sum du gyur kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab tu shes kyang zhes bya ba ni de mngon sum du gyur kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Though they know it, means though they realize it.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings su mi lhung zhes bya ba la nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings su mi lhung zhes bya ba la nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya /
translated: “He does not fall into the realm of definite emergence” means that nirvana is the realm of definite emergence.

original: mi ltung ba ni de 'ba' zhig gi phyogs la mi @165b gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi ltung ba ni de 'ba' zhig gi phyogs la mi @165b gnas pa'o //
translated: “He does not fall” means that he does not remain in that alone.

original: mkhas pa brgyad po rnams rgya cher bshad pa'i nges pa'i tshig dang rgyu dang 'bras bu bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mkhas pa brgyad po rnams rgya cher bshad pa'i nges pa'i tshig dang rgyu dang 'bras bu bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary of the causes and results of the etymologies of the eight knowledges that were explained above,

original: gang chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes smras pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung ste /🔽chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes smras pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung ste / chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: he says, “The one who is called ‘skilled in all phenomena’ is a synonym for ‘omniscient one.’ ”

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes kyang bya bas chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes smras pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig bla dags te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes kyang bya bas chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes smras pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig bla dags te /
translated: He is called “skilled in all phenomena” and he is called “omniscient.” Therefore, the one who is called “skilled in all phenomena” is a synonym for “omniscient one.”

original: 'dis ni nges pa'i tshig bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nges pa'i tshig bstan to //
translated: This teaches the etymology.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dri ba ste /
translated: “Why?” is an inquiry into the cause.

original: chos thams cad la mkhas pa de ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mkhas pa de ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why is one who is skilled in all phenomena called omniscient?

original: rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the cause,

original: rtag tu dran pa dang blo gros dang shes rab la mkhas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag tu dran pa dang blo gros dang shes rab la mkhas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said that one is always skilled in mindfulness, intelligence, and wisdom.

original: chos thams cad la mkhas pa de ni rtag tu dran pa la mkhas pa dang / rtag tu blo gros la mkhas pa dang / rtag tu shes rab la mkhas pas de la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mkhas pa de ni rtag tu dran pa la mkhas pa dang / rtag tu blo gros la mkhas pa dang / rtag tu shes rab la mkhas pas de la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That one who is skilled in all phenomena is always skilled in mindfulness, always skilled in intelligence, and always skilled in wisdom is called omniscient.

original: de gsum gyis chos thams cad la rtogs pas na mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de gsum gyis chos thams cad la rtogs pas na mkhas pa ste /
translated: By means of those three, one is skilled in all phenomena.

original: dran pa la mkhas pa ni chos rnams kyi don dang tshig mi brjed par byed do //
analyzed: dran pa la mkhas pa ni chos rnams kyi don dang tshig mi brjed par byed do //
translated: Skill in mindfulness causes one not to forget the meaning and words of the teachings.

original: blo gros la mkhas pa ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid rtog par byed do //
analyzed: blo gros la mkhas pa ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid rtog par byed do //
translated: Skill in intelligence causes one to realize the suchness of the teachings.

original: shes rab la mkhas pa ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtog par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab la mkhas pa ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtog par byed do //
translated: Skill in wisdom causes one to realize the specific and general characteristics of the teachings.

original: 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the result, he says:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes tshad med cing mi chags pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes tshad med cing mi chags pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it causes the limitless, non-attached, and fully developed pristine wisdom of omniscience.

original: shes bya thams cad la dmigs pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes tshad med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la dmigs pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes tshad med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called “limitless pristine wisdom of omniscience” because it focuses on all objects of knowledge.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la bya bar 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that the pristine wisdom of omniscience is the mirror-like pristine wisdom.

original: ye shes de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pas na mi chags pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pas na mi chags pa'o //
translated: That pristine wisdom is “non-attached” because it completely abandons the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba ni dran pa la sogs pa gsum gyis ye shes de 'thob cing mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba ni dran pa la sogs pa gsum gyis ye shes de 'thob cing mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Causes the fully developed” means that through the three of mindfulness and so forth, one attains that pristine wisdom and brings it to completion.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gong du bshad pa ltar na chos thams cad rtogs shing khong du chud pa de'i phyir chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gong du bshad pa ltar na chos thams cad rtogs shing khong du chud pa de'i phyir chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, “skilled in all phenomena” means that because one realizes and comprehends all phenomena as explained above, one is called “skilled in all phenomena.”

original: mkhas pa brgyad po @166a * //
analyzed: mkhas pa brgyad po @166a * //
translated: Those who possess these eight skills

original: de dag gis zin pa zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa brgyad po 'di dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gis zin pa zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa brgyad po 'di dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: are said to be “embodied by these eight skills,” which means they possess these eight skills.

original: shes rab kyi las bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi las bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the activity of wisdom, it is said, “Moreover, in terms of virtue and non-virtue…” and so on.

original: zhar la shes rab kyi sgra'i don kyang 'chad do //
analyzed: zhar la shes rab kyi sgra'i don kyang 'chad do //
translated: Here, the meaning of the term “wisdom” is also explained.

original: shes rab kyi tshig las mdo kha cig las ni rab dang shes pa gnyis ka 'byung /
analyzed: shes rab kyi tshig las mdo kha cig las ni rab dang shes pa gnyis ka 'byung /
translated: In some sūtras, both “sharp” and “knowledge” are used,

original: kha cig las gcig 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig las gcig 'byung ste /
translated: while in some only one is used.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: Because one possesses that, it is called “wisdom.”

original: yang na gzhan gyis bstan pa shes pa dang / so so rang nyid shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / rab tu zhi ba shes pa dang / yon tan gyi mchog shes pas shes rab bo //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis bstan pa shes pa dang / so so rang nyid shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / rab tu zhi ba shes pa dang / yon tan gyi mchog shes pas shes rab bo //
translated: Moreover, wisdom is the knowledge of what is taught by others, the knowledge of what is known by oneself, the knowledge of discernment, the knowledge of complete peace, and the knowledge of the highest virtues.

original: de la gzhan gyis bstan pa shes pa ni gzhan gyis bstan pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las yang dag par lta ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyis bstan pa shes pa ni gzhan gyis bstan pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las yang dag par lta ba skyes pa'o //
translated: Among these, the knowledge of what is taught by others is the arising of right view from the pursuit of the sound of teachings by others and from proper mental attention.

original: so so rang shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of what is known by oneself is the direct realization of supramundane, nonconceptual intuition.

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of discernment is the realization of the characteristics of things by the intuition attained subsequent to the supramundane.

original: rab tu zhi ba shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam na nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam na nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge of complete peace is the intuition that becomes the antidote to the addictions on the path of meditation.

original: yon tan gyi mchog shes pa ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: yon tan gyi mchog shes pa ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The highest knowledge of the qualities is the wisdom that accomplishes the special qualities such as the superknowledges.🔽The knowledge of virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas is wisdom.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu shes pa ni shes rab bo zhes bya ba la dge ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu shes pa ni shes rab bo zhes bya ba la dge ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of virtuous dharmas:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
translated: those that are contaminated and those that are uncontaminated.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed do //
translated: Among them, contaminated ones are the formations that lead to merit and the formations that lead to imperturbability.

original: zag pa med pa ni 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa'o //
translated: Uncontaminated ones are the noble path and so on.
