original: mi dge ba ni bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed de /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed de /
translated: Nonvirtuous ones are the formations that lead to demerit,

original: srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as killing, stealing, and so on.

original: chos de rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa ni shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos de rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa ni shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the general and specific characteristics of those dharmas is called wisdom.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la rtog pa zhes bya ba la nges par 'byed pa ni drod dang spyi bo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la rtog pa zhes bya ba la nges par 'byed pa ni drod dang spyi bo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ste /
translated: Penetration refers to heat, summit, receptivity, and the supreme mundane state.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
translated: They are the meditative stabilizations of the stage of action in faith.

original: de'i cha @166b dang mthun pa'i chos ni ting nge 'dzin de thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de'i cha @166b dang mthun pa'i chos ni ting nge 'dzin de thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos te /
translated: The Dharma that is conducive to that is the Dharma that serves as the cause for attaining that meditative stabilization.

original: dang po dge ba'i bshes gnyen las dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / de nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi sgom pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po dge ba'i bshes gnyen las dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / de nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi sgom pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: First, it is listening to the holy Dharma from a spiritual master, reflecting on it, and then cultivating the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, and so on.

original: chos de rnams khong du chud pa rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos de rnams khong du chud pa rtogs pa ste /
translated: The realization of those Dharmas is penetration.

original: de yang shes rab kyis khong du chud pas na shes rab ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos la rtog ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyis khong du chud pas na shes rab ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos la rtog ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since one realizes them through wisdom, wisdom is called “realization of the Dharma that is conducive to penetration.”

original: 'phags pa'i chos mngon du gyur pa shes rab ni tshad mar gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos mngon du gyur pa shes rab ni tshad mar gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The wisdom of one who has realized the noble Dharma is valid cognition.

original: 'phags pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
translated: The noble ones are the Tathagatas, Bodhisattvas, Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: de dag gi chos ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i chos te de yang shes rab kyis mngon sum du gyur pas shes rab ni tshad mar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi chos ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i chos te de yang shes rab kyis mngon sum du gyur pas shes rab ni tshad mar gyur pa ste /
translated: Their Dharma is the Dharma of selflessness in persons and selflessness in phenomena. Since that is realized by wisdom, wisdom is valid cognition.

original: brtsan par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtsan par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called “trustworthy” because it is not deceptive.

original: shes rab ni lta bar gyur pa dang kun nas ldang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lta bar gyur pa la sogs pa ni gong du bshad par zad do //
analyzed: shes rab ni lta bar gyur pa dang kun nas ldang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lta bar gyur pa la sogs pa ni gong du bshad par zad do //
translated: Wisdom is the view, the entanglements, and so on. The view and so on have already been explained above.

original: yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni ming gis smos pa'i chos de dag gi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du phyin ci ma log par khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni ming gis smos pa'i chos de dag gi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du phyin ci ma log par khong du chud pa ste /
translated: The phrase one fully comprehends the way things really are just as it is means that one comprehends, without error, the emptiness that is the nature of those entities that are mentioned by name.

original: de yang shes rab kyis khong du chud pas na shes rab ni lta ba la sogs pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyis khong du chud pas na shes rab ni lta ba la sogs pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since one comprehends that by means of wisdom, wisdom is described as the full comprehension of all entities just as they are, in terms of their suchness and variety.

original: shes rab ni 'dod pa dang re ba dang smon pa thams cad kyi smon lam dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar mos pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'dod pa dang re ba dang smon pa thams cad kyi smon lam dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar mos pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is free of the aspiration that is associated with all wishes, hopes, and desires. Wishes are the desires to be reborn in the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skye bar mos pa ni re ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skye bar mos pa ni re ba'o //
translated: Hopes are the desires to be reborn in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar mos pa ni smon pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar mos pa ni smon pa'o //
translated: Desires are the desires to be reborn in the formless realm.

original: yang na dngos po yid du 'ong ba 'das pa rnams dang phrad par 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dngos po yid du 'ong ba 'das pa rnams dang phrad par 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, wishes are the desires to encounter desirable things that have occurred in the past.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po ma 'ongs pa rnams dang phrad par 'dod pa ni re ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po ma 'ongs pa rnams dang phrad par 'dod pa ni re ba'o //
translated: Hope is the desire to encounter future things that are similar to those.

original: da ltar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams dang bral bar mi 'dod pa ni smon pa ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams dang bral bar mi 'dod pa ni smon pa ste /
translated: Wish is the desire not to be separated from the present appropriated aggregates.

original: smon lam ni dus gsum gyi dngos po de dag la chags pa la bya'o //
analyzed: smon lam ni dus gsum gyi dngos po de dag la chags pa la bya'o //
translated: Vow is attachment to those things of the three times.

original: shes rab kyis dus gsum gyi dngos po de dag la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal bar mthong ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dus gsum gyi dngos po de dag la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal bar mthong ste /
translated: Wisdom is the insight that those things of the three times are impermanent and dissatisfactory.

original: de la chags pa med pa'i phyir shes rab ni smon lam dang bral ba zhes bya'o /
analyzed: de la chags pa med pa'i phyir shes rab ni smon lam dang bral ba zhes bya'o /
translated: Since there is no attachment to them, wisdom is said to be free of vows.

original: @167a * // shes rab ni nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad yongs su zhi bas na sim par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @167a * // shes rab ni nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad yongs su zhi bas na sim par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is refreshing because it completely allays the torment of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: The afflictions are desire and so on.

original: de dag nyid lus dang sems la gnod pa yin pas na yongs su gdung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid lus dang sems la gnod pa yin pas na yongs su gdung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they harm the body and mind, they are called torment.

original: shes rab la nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i gnod pa med pa 'am /
analyzed: shes rab la nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i gnod pa med pa 'am /
translated: Wisdom is the absence of harm arising from the cause of the afflictions.

original: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i gnod pa de sel bar byed pas na shes rab de ni sim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i gnod pa de sel bar byed pas na shes rab de ni sim par byed pa'o //
translated: Or, wisdom is the removal of the harm arising from the cause of the afflictions.

original: shes rab ni chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'i rgyun ma bcad pas na mchog tu dga' bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'i rgyun ma bcad pas na mchog tu dga' bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the cause of supreme joy, since it is the uninterrupted delight in the joy of Dharma.

original: de kho na stong ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs nas dga' ba rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba ni chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba rgyun mi bcad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na stong ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs nas dga' ba rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba ni chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba rgyun mi bcad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Having realized the nature of reality, the emptiness, the joy that arises uninterruptedly is called the uninterrupted delight in the joy of Dharma.

original: de'ang shes rab las 'byung bas shes rab ni mchog tu dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'ang shes rab las 'byung bas shes rab ni mchog tu dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: And since that arises from wisdom, wisdom is the cause of supreme joy.

original: shes rab ni don shes pa mngon sum du gyur pas na rab tu ston pa'o zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: shes rab ni don shes pa mngon sum du gyur pas na rab tu ston pa'o zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Wisdom is the revealer, since it is the direct realization of the knowledge of the meaning.

original: don ni yang dag ba'i mtha' chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: don ni yang dag ba'i mtha' chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the perfect end, the completely pure expanse of reality.

original: don de khong du chud pa'i don shes pa mngon sum du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: don de khong du chud pa'i don shes pa mngon sum du gyur pa ste /
translated: The direct realization of the understanding of that meaning is the direct realization of the understanding of the meaning.

original: de'ang shes rab kyi mngon sum du gyur pas na shes rab de don la rton pa'i phyir rab tu ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang shes rab kyi mngon sum du gyur pas na shes rab de don la rton pa'i phyir rab tu ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And since that understanding is the direct realization of wisdom, it is called “teaching” because that wisdom relies on the meaning.

original: yang na shes rab la don ston te /
analyzed: yang na shes rab la don ston te /
translated: Or else, the meaning is taught by wisdom,

original: shes rab med na don mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab med na don mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without wisdom, the meaning is not realized.

original: shes rab ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag gi rten to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag gi rten to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the basis of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: byang chub ni spangs pa dang ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub ni spangs pa dang ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Enlightenment has the nature of abandonment and intuition.

original: de la spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of abandonment is the abandonment of the addictive and objective obscurations.

original: ye shes ni me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor kun tu rtog pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa'o //🔽byang chub de thob par bya ba'i rgyu 'am /
analyzed: ye shes ni me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor kun tu rtog pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa'o // byang chub de thob par bya ba'i rgyu 'am /
translated: Intuition is the mirror-like intuition, the equalizing intuition, the distinguishing intuition, and the allaccomplishing intuition.

original: gzhi la byang chub kyi phyogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi la byang chub kyi phyogs zhes bya ste /
translated: The aids to enlightenment are so called because they are the cause or basis for attaining that enlightenment.

original: de'ang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong bzhi la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: de'ang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong bzhi la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The thirty-seven are the four foundations of mindfulness, the four right efforts, and so on.

original: shes rab la brten nas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun so so'i sems kyi rgyun la skye bas na /
analyzed: shes rab la brten nas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun so so'i sems kyi rgyun la skye bas na /
translated: Since the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment arise in the stream of consciousness of each individual,

original: shes rab ni chos de rnams kyi rten ces bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos de rnams kyi rten ces bya'o //
translated: wisdom is called the support of those factors.

original: shes rab ni theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu thob par 'gyur bas na thob pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu thob par 'gyur bas na thob pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the characteristic of attainment, since one attains the result in accordance with the vehicle.

original: theg pa gang dang gang gis 'bras bu @167b gang dang gang yin pa'i 'bras bu de dag 'thob par byed pa ni theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa gang dang gang gis 'bras bu @167b gang dang gang yin pa'i 'bras bu de dag 'thob par byed pa ni theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of those results which are the results of whatever vehicle is called the attainment of the result in accordance with the vehicle.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pas nyan thos kyi rnam par grol ba thob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba thob pa dang / theg pa chen pos rang gi rnam par grol ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pas nyan thos kyi rnam par grol ba thob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba thob pa dang / theg pa chen pos rang gi rnam par grol ba thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the liberation of the sravakas through the sravaka vehicle, the attainment of the liberation of the pratyekabuddhas through the pratyekabuddha vehicle, and the attainment of one's own liberation through the Mahayana.

original: theg pa de dang de dag gis rang rang gi 'bras bu thob pas yang shes rab la brten nas thob pas shes rab ni thob pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: theg pa de dang de dag gis rang rang gi 'bras bu thob pas yang shes rab la brten nas thob pas shes rab ni thob pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Since one attains one's own result through this or that vehicle, and since one attains it by relying on wisdom, wisdom has the characteristic of attainment.

original: 'bras bu thob par byed pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par byed pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it has the nature of causing the attainment of the result.

original: shes rab ni rang bzhin gyis ye shes snang bas na rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gsal bar phyin ci ma log par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis ye shes snang ba'o
analyzed: shes rab ni rang bzhin gyis ye shes snang bas na rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gsal bar phyin ci ma log par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis ye shes snang ba'o
translated: Wisdom has the characteristic of full cognition, because it is the natural light of intuition. The full cognition of the specific and general characteristics of things by nature, without error, is the natural light of intuition.

original: // shes rab ni rang bzhin gyis chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: // shes rab ni rang bzhin gyis chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Wisdom is the nature of full knowing, since it is characterized by unmistaken knowledge of the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: rab tu shes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu shes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the nature of full knowing, that is, the meaning of full knowing.

original: shes rab ni chu bo thams cad las sgrol bas na yang dag par sgrol ba'o zhes bya ba la chu bo ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni chu bo thams cad las sgrol bas na yang dag par sgrol ba'o zhes bya ba la chu bo ni bzhi ste /
translated: Wisdom is the true liberator, since it liberates from all the floods.

original: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: The floods are four: the flood of sensuality, the flood of views, the flood of becoming, and the flood of ignorance.

original: de dag gi mthar phyung ste spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i skam sa la bzhag pa'i chu bo thams cad las sgrol ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mthar phyung ste spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i skam sa la bzhag pa'i chu bo thams cad las sgrol ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is the true liberator, since it liberates from all the floods, since it brings one to the other shore, i.e., to the dry land of Nirvana, by abandoning the floods.

original: de yang shes rab kyis sgrol bar byed pas na shes rab ni yang dag par rab tu sgrol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyis sgrol bar byed pas na shes rab ni yang dag par rab tu sgrol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it liberates by means of wisdom, wisdom is the true liberator.

original: shes rab ni yang dag pa skyon med par 'dren pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni yang dag pa skyon med par 'dren pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the true guide to the unerring state.

original: yang dag pa skyon med pa ni mthong ba'i lam rab tu skyes nas sa dang po thob ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa skyon med pa ni mthong ba'i lam rab tu skyes nas sa dang po thob ste /
translated: The correct, faultless path is the path of seeing, which is attained when one reaches the first stage.

original: chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i don rtogs nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i don rtogs nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'o //
translated: Having realized the meaning of the universal realm of phenomena, one abandons the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de thob par byed pa ni 'dren pa ste /🔽mthong ba'i lam de'ang shes rab kyis thob par byed pas /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa ni 'dren pa ste / mthong ba'i lam de'ang shes rab kyis thob par byed pas /
translated: The one who causes that attainment is the guide.🔽That path of seeing is attained by wisdom.

original: shes rab ni yang dag pa skyon med par 'dren pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni yang dag pa skyon med par 'dren pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, wisdom is called the guide to the correct, faultless path.

original: shes rab ni dge ba'i chos thams cad rab tu sdud pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni dge ba'i chos thams cad rab tu sdud pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the collector of all virtuous qualities.

original: dge ba'i chos ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / mos pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / mos pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Virtuous qualities are faith, effort, aspiration, and so forth.

original: chos de dag kyang shes rab las byung bas na /🔽shes @168a * //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang shes rab las byung bas na / shes @168a * //
translated: Since those qualities arise from wisdom,

original: rab ni dge ba'i chos thams cad rab tu sdud pa'o //
analyzed: rab ni dge ba'i chos thams cad rab tu sdud pa'o //
translated: wisdom is the collector of all virtuous qualities.

original: shes rab ni sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang bag la nyal thams cad dang bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang bag la nyal thams cad dang bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the purifier of all past afflictions and latent tendencies.

original: 'das pa'i 'dus kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa de dag gi bag chags ni sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang bag la nyal thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'dus kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa de dag gi bag chags ni sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang bag la nyal thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: The afflictions such as attachment, etc. of the past and present, and the latent impressions of those afflictions are called “all former afflictions and latent tendencies.”

original: dang bar byed pa ni de dag rtsa nas spong ba ste /
analyzed: dang bar byed pa ni de dag rtsa nas spong ba ste /
translated: “Purifying” means eliminating them from the root.

original: de yang shes rab kyis spong bas na shes rab ni sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang / bag la nyal ba thams cad dang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyis spong bas na shes rab ni sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang / bag la nyal ba thams cad dang bar byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since wisdom eliminates them, wisdom is the purifier of all former afflictions and latent tendencies.

original: shes rab ni rtse mor gyur pa'i chos rnams kyi mchog go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni rtse mor gyur pa'i chos rnams kyi mchog go zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the supreme of all the highest dharmas.

original: sbyin pa mthar phyin pa dang / tshul khrims mthar phyin pa dang / bzod pa mthar phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus mthar phyin pa dang / bsam gtan mthar phyin pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan stobs dang / ma 'dres pa dang ;
analyzed: sbyin pa mthar phyin pa dang / tshul khrims mthar phyin pa dang / bzod pa mthar phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus mthar phyin pa dang / bsam gtan mthar phyin pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan stobs dang / ma 'dres pa dang ;
translated: The perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of effort, the perfection of concentration, and also the Tathāgata’s qualities such as the powers, the unique qualities,

original: mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ni rtse mor gyur ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ni rtse mor gyur ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: and the fearlessnesses are the highest dharmas.

original: de dag gi nang na yang shes rab dam pa yin pas shes rab ni chos rnams kyi mchog go //
analyzed: de dag gi nang na yang shes rab dam pa yin pas shes rab ni chos rnams kyi mchog go //
translated: And since it is the best of those, wisdom is the best of all dharmas.

original: shes rab ni rang byung gi ye shes rtogs pa'i phyir gya nom pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni rang byung gi ye shes rtogs pa'i phyir gya nom pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is called sublime because it realizes self-arisen gnosis.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bstan pa la rten la brten pa med par rang nyid kyi nyon mongs pa spangs nas de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa ni rang 'byung gi ye shes te /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bstan pa la rten la brten pa med par rang nyid kyi nyon mongs pa spangs nas de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa ni rang 'byung gi ye shes te /
translated: The self-arisen gnosis is the realization of suchness by the preceptor and master, who, without relying on others, abandon their own defilements.

original: ye shes 'bras bu dam par gyur pa de yang shes rab las 'byung bas na shes rab ni gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes 'bras bu dam par gyur pa de yang shes rab las 'byung bas na shes rab ni gya nom pa'o //
translated: Since that sublime result of gnosis also arises from wisdom, wisdom is sublime.

original: shes rab ni khams gsum thams cad dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir rgyu ba dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni khams gsum thams cad dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir rgyu ba dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is free from movement because it is unmixed with the entire three realms.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su yang nas yang du skye zhing 'byung ba ni khams gsum thams cad dang 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su yang nas yang du skye zhing 'byung ba ni khams gsum thams cad dang 'dres pa ste /
translated: Being born and arising again and again in the desire, form, and formless realms is being mixed with the entire three realms.

original: shes rab de khams gsum du skye ba med pas na ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab de khams gsum du skye ba med pas na ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: It is unadulterated because that wisdom is not born in the three realms.

original: de ltar ma 'dres pa'i phyir rgyu ba dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma 'dres pa'i phyir rgyu ba dang bral ba ste /
translated: Thus, because it is unadulterated, it is free from movement.

original: khams gsum du skye ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽shes rab ni thabs kun gyis zin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar khams gsum du skye ba dang bral yang /
analyzed: khams gsum du skye ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to // shes rab ni thabs kun gyis zin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar khams gsum du skye ba dang bral yang /
translated: The meaning is that it is free from birth in the three realms.🔽Wisdom is embraced by all the means.🔽Even though it is thus free from birth in the three realms, by the power of wisdom it does not remain in mere nirvana.

original: shes rab kyi dbang gis gcig tu mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i thabs snying rje chen po @168b la sogs pa sngar smos pa'i thabs rnams kyis zin pas na shes rab ni thabs kun gyis zin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang gis gcig tu mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i thabs snying rje chen po @168b la sogs pa sngar smos pa'i thabs rnams kyis zin pas na shes rab ni thabs kun gyis zin pa'o //
translated: It is embraced by the means mentioned earlier, such as great compassion.

original: shes rab ni 'phags pa thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba'o zhes bya ba la /🔽'phags pa rnams shes rab de dang ldan /
analyzed: shes rab ni 'phags pa thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba'o zhes bya ba la / 'phags pa rnams shes rab de dang ldan /
translated: Wisdom is held by all the āryas.🔽The āryas possess that wisdom.

original: 'phags pa rnams la shes rab de mnga' zhing 'phags pa rnams kyis bdag gir byas pas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la shes rab de mnga' zhing 'phags pa rnams kyis bdag gir byas pas na /
translated: The āryas possess that wisdom and the āryas hold it as their own.

original: shes rab ni 'phags pa thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'phags pa thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is held by all the noble ones.

original: shes rab mtshan ma dang yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir tshad gzung du med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab mtshan ma dang yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir tshad gzung du med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is immeasurable because it is free from all signs and discursive thought.

original: 'di tsam mo zhes gcod pa ni tshad gzung du yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam mo zhes gcod pa ni tshad gzung du yod pa'o //
translated: To be able to measure something is to be able to say, “It is just this much.”

original: mtshan ma ni gzugs dang / sgra dang dkar po dang dmar po la sogs pa gzung bar 'gyur ba'i yul rnams so //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni gzugs dang / sgra dang dkar po dang dmar po la sogs pa gzung bar 'gyur ba'i yul rnams so //
translated: Signs are the objects that are apprehended, such as form, sound, blue, yellow, and so on.

original: rtog pa ni 'di ni dkar po 'di ni dmar po zhes 'dzin par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: rtog pa ni 'di ni dkar po 'di ni dmar po zhes 'dzin par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: Discursive thought is the mind and mental factors that apprehend, such as “This is blue,” “This is yellow.”

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis shes rab des spangs bas ni mtshan ma dang rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis shes rab des spangs bas ni mtshan ma dang rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the duality of apprehended and apprehender is abandoned by that wisdom, it is said to be free from all signs and discursive thought.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bas /🔽de la 'di 'dra zhe 'am /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bas / de la 'di 'dra zhe 'am /
translated: Thus, because it is free from apprehended and apprehender,🔽it cannot be measured or said, “It is like this”

original: 'di tsam zhes tshad gzung zhing gcod par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di tsam zhes tshad gzung zhing gcod par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: or “It is just this much.”

original: shes rab ni tshad gzung du med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni tshad gzung du med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Wisdom is said to be immeasurable.

original: shes rab ni ma rig pa dang gti mug gi mun pa thams cad dang bral bas na dpag tu med pa'i gnyen po'o zhes bya la /
analyzed: shes rab ni ma rig pa dang gti mug gi mun pa thams cad dang bral bas na dpag tu med pa'i gnyen po'o zhes bya la /
translated: Wisdom is the antidote to the immeasurable, since it is free from all the darkness of ignorance and delusion.

original: mi shes pa las /
analyzed: mi shes pa las /
translated: From ignorance

original: nyon mongs pa lhag ma dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa lhag ma dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: all the remaining afflictions and all sinful, non-virtuous dharmas arise.

original: mi shes pa ni bag med pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni bag med pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Thus, ignorance is the cause of heedlessness.

original: shes rab la ni mi shes pa thams cad med la ;
analyzed: shes rab la ni mi shes pa thams cad med la ;
translated: But in wisdom there is no ignorance at all,

original: des mi shes pa thams cad sel bar byed pas na /
analyzed: des mi shes pa thams cad sel bar byed pas na /
translated: and it removes all ignorance.

original: shes rab ni bag med pa'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni bag med pa'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, wisdom is said to be the antidote to heedlessness.

original: de la kun 'byung ba dang lam mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun 'byung ba dang lam mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa'o //
translated: Here, ignorance of the origin and the path is the darkness of ignorance.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa mi shes pa ni gti mug gi mun pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa mi shes pa ni gti mug gi mun pa'o //
translated: Ignorance of suffering and cessation is the darkness of delusion.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa'o //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa'o //
translated: Or, ignorance of the cause and effect of the side of affliction is the darkness of ignorance.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu mi shes pa ni gti mug gi mun pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu mi shes pa ni gti mug gi mun pa'o //
translated: The darkness of delusion is the ignorance of the cause and effect of the side of purification.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu ni kun 'byung ba'o //🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs @169a * //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu ni kun 'byung ba'o // kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs @169a * //
translated: Therein, the cause of the side of defilement is origination.

original: kyi 'bras bu ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: kyi 'bras bu ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The effect of the side of defilement is suffering.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi rgyu ni lam mo //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi rgyu ni lam mo //
translated: The cause of the side of purification is the path.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi 'bras bu ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi 'bras bu ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: The effect of the side of purification is cessation.

original: shes rab ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa thams cad kyi sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa thams cad kyi sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the application of all those who stand on the stage of the bodhisattva who practices contemplation.

original: mi gtsang ba 'am /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba 'am /
translated: The contemplation of impurity,

original: byams pa 'am /
analyzed: byams pa 'am /
translated: loving kindness,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'am /
translated: dependent origination,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'o //🔽ting nge 'dzin de dag bsgom pa'i rgyu 'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'o // ting nge 'dzin de dag bsgom pa'i rgyu 'am /
translated: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness is the practice of contemplation.

original: gzhi la rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi la rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
translated: The cause or basis of the cultivation of those contemplations is called the stage of the bodhisattva who practices contemplation.

original: shes rab de rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lam yin pas sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab de rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lam yin pas sbyor ba'o //
translated: Since that wisdom is the path of the bodhisattva, it is the practice.

original: de yang ji ltar na lam zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar na lam zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it the path?

original: mnyan pa'i shes rab dang bsam pa'i shes rab lam brten par gang yang bsgom par mi nus so //
analyzed: mnyan pa'i shes rab dang bsam pa'i shes rab lam brten par gang yang bsgom par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot cultivate the wisdom of listening and the wisdom of reflection without relying on the path.

original: shes rab ni theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi 'dren pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi 'dren pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the guide for those who have entered all vehicles.

original: theg pa thams cad ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: theg pa thams cad ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang theg pa chen po'o //
translated: All vehicles refer to the vehicles of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa de dag la gnas pa ni theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams te /
analyzed: theg pa de dag la gnas pa ni theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams te /
translated: Those who abide in those vehicles are those who have entered all vehicles.

original: de dag khams gsum nas bton nas so so'i rnam par grol ba la 'god par byed pas shes rab ni theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: de dag khams gsum nas bton nas so so'i rnam par grol ba la 'god par byed pas shes rab ni theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi 'dren pa'o //
translated: Since it causes them to be drawn out of the three realms and establishes them in their respective liberations, wisdom is the guide for those who have entered all vehicles.

original: shes rab ni ma rig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa las /
analyzed: shes rab ni ma rig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa las /
translated: Wisdom is the light for those who are in the darkness of ignorance.

original: shes rab kyis mi shes pa dang / mun pa dang mi gsal ba rnams sel bar byed pas shes rab ni snang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis mi shes pa dang / mun pa dang mi gsal ba rnams sel bar byed pas shes rab ni snang bar byed pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is the light because it illuminates the unknown, darkness, and obscurity.

original: don gzhan ni gong du bshad par zad do //
analyzed: don gzhan ni gong du bshad par zad do //
translated: The other meanings have already been explained above.

original: shes rab ni mig la ji ltar mos pa rnams la mig thams cad sbyin par byed pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: shes rab ni mig la ji ltar mos pa rnams la mig thams cad sbyin par byed pa zhes bya la /
translated: Wisdom is the giver of all eyes to those who aspire to eyes.

original: mig gsum ste /
analyzed: mig gsum ste /
translated: There are three eyes:

original: shes rab kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig go //🔽mig gang la gang dad pa ni ji ltar mos pa rnams de shes rab kyi gang zag de dag la mig de dang de sbyin par byed pas na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig go // mig gang la gang dad pa ni ji ltar mos pa rnams de shes rab kyi gang zag de dag la mig de dang de sbyin par byed pas na /
translated: the eye of wisdom, the eye of the Buddha, and the eye of Dharma.🔽The giver of all eyes to those who aspire to eyes is the person who gives that and that eye to those who aspire to that and that eye.

original: mig la ji ltar smos pa rnams kyi mig thams cad sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mig la ji ltar smos pa rnams kyi mig thams cad sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: The giver of all eyes to those who aspire to eyes is the person who gives that and that eye to those who aspire to that and that eye.

original: shes rab ni mig dang gzugs kyi lam las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni mig dang gzugs kyi lam las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the giver of all eyes to those who aspire to eyes because it transcends the path of eyes and forms.

original: mig gi lam ni mig gi yul de gzugs so //
analyzed: mig gi lam ni mig gi yul de gzugs so //
translated: The path of eyes is the object of the eyes, which is form.

original: shes rab ni mig gi yul ma yin pas mig dang gzugs kyi lam @169b las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni mig gi yul ma yin pas mig dang gzugs kyi lam @169b las 'das pa'o //
translated: Since wisdom is not an object of the eye, it transcends the path of the eye and form.

original: yang na shes rab de mig la yang mi gnas /
analyzed: yang na shes rab de mig la yang mi gnas /
translated: Or, that wisdom does not abide in the eye,

original: gzugs la yang mi gnas pas mig dang gzugs kyi lam las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la yang mi gnas pas mig dang gzugs kyi lam las 'das pa ste /
translated: and does not abide in form, so it transcends the path of the eye and form.

original: de bas na gnas med pa'o zhes tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na gnas med pa'o zhes tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be without abode.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang sgra la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang sgra la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, one should apply this as appropriate to the ear and sound, and so on.

original: shes rab ni bden pa las nges par 'byung bas na don dam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni bden pa las nges par 'byung bas na don dam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is ultimate because it arises from the truth.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi shes rab ni don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa las byung zhing skyes pas na yul don dam pa yin pas de la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyang don dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi shes rab ni don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa las byung zhing skyes pas na yul don dam pa yin pas de la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyang don dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the wisdom of the noble ones arises from realizing ultimate truth, it is the object of the ultimate. Therefore, the wisdom that takes that as its object is also called ultimate.

original: shes rab ni shin tu dul ba rnams kyis mi 'khrugs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni shin tu dul ba rnams kyis mi 'khrugs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is undisturbed by those who are well-disciplined.

original: mi 'khrugs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur zhing nyon mongs pas bskyod par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur zhing nyon mongs pas bskyod par mi nus pa'o //
translated: He is unshakable, since he is not subject to defilements and cannot be shaken by them.

original: de la gang gis bsdams /
analyzed: de la gang gis bsdams /
translated: By what is he restrained?🔽In what is he restrained?

original: gang bsdams / gang la bsdams /
analyzed: gang bsdams / gang la bsdams /
translated: In what way is he restrained?

original: ji ltar bsdams nas 'phags pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams ni shin tu dul ba rnams so //
analyzed: ji ltar bsdams nas 'phags pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams ni shin tu dul ba rnams so //
translated: The noble ones who abide in the stages are well-disciplined.

original: de la gang gis bsdams zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang gis bsdams zhe na /
translated: By what is he restrained?

original: kun du bsrung ba'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: kun du bsrung ba'i bsam pas so //
translated: By the intention to guard.

original: gang bsdams she na /
analyzed: gang bsdams she na /
translated: In what is he restrained?

original: mig gi dbang po dga' ba dang mi dga' ba'i gzugs la 'phro ba las bsdams pas na yid kyi dbang po chos la 'phro ba'i bar la bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dga' ba dang mi dga' ba'i gzugs la 'phro ba las bsdams pas na yid kyi dbang po chos la 'phro ba'i bar la bsdams pa'o //
translated: In the eye faculty, restrained from straying to pleasant and unpleasant forms, up to the mind faculty, restrained from straying to phenomena.

original: gang la bsdams she na /
analyzed: gang la bsdams she na /
translated: In what is he restrained?

original: chos de dag nyid la bsdams te /
analyzed: chos de dag nyid la bsdams te /
translated: In those very phenomena.

original: yul de dag la mi 'jug par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul de dag la mi 'jug par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not engage in those objects.

original: ji ltar bsdams she na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsdams she na /
translated: In what way is he restrained?

original: gang gi dbang gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos sems las byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin /
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos sems las byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin /
translated: He does not grasp the characteristics of those objects through which unwholesome dharmas arise in the mind.

original: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin par bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin par bsdams pa'o //
translated: It is the restraint that does not grasp signs.

original: de ltar bsdams pa las rnam par grol ba'i sa thob pa ni shin tu dul ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsdams pa las rnam par grol ba'i sa thob pa ni shin tu dul ba ste /
translated: The attainment of the stage of liberation from that restraint is complete self-discipline.

original: shes rab ni dul ba de dag nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bar byed pas shes rab ni shin tu dul ba rnams kyis mi 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni dul ba de dag nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bar byed pas shes rab ni shin tu dul ba rnams kyis mi 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the non-agitation of those who are completely self-disciplined, because it prevents them from coming under the influence of the afflictions.

original: shes rab ni ye shes kyi sgo rnams kyi snang ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni ye shes kyi sgo rnams kyi snang ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the light of the doors of knowledge.

original: ye shes ni gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid shes bya thams cad la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes ni gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid shes bya thams cad la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Knowledge is the non-dual suchness characterized by the observation of all objects of knowledge.

original: sgo ni ye shes de'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: sgo ni ye shes de'i rgyu ste /
translated: The doors are the causes of that knowledge.

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'byed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'byed par byed pa'o //
translated: They are the distinctions of the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: de yang shes rab kyis 'byed pas shes rab ni ye shes kyi sgo rnams kyi snang ba'o //🔽shes rab ni thams cad @170a * //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyis 'byed pas shes rab ni ye shes kyi sgo rnams kyi snang ba'o // shes rab ni thams cad @170a * //
translated: And since wisdom makes those distinctions, wisdom is the light of the doors of knowledge.

original: du rgyu ba ste mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: du rgyu ba ste mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the movement everywhere, the inexhaustibility.

original: shes bya thams cad dang dus thams cad du 'jug pa ni thams cad rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad dang dus thams cad du 'jug pa ni thams cad rgyu ba ste /
translated: It engages all objects of knowledge and all times.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi dmigs par bya ba'i yul dang dus la zad pa med pas de la dmigs par byed pa'i shes rab la yang zad pa med pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi dmigs par bya ba'i yul dang dus la zad pa med pas de la dmigs par byed pa'i shes rab la yang zad pa med pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
translated: Thus, since the object field and time of the object of observation of wisdom are inexhaustible, the wisdom that observes them is also inexhaustible.

original: de la shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa thams cad rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa thams cad rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It engages all objects of knowledge because it comprehends all the aggregates, constituents, and so on.

original: dus thams cad du 'jug pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus thams cad du dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'jug pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus thams cad du dmigs pa'o //
translated: It engages all times because it observes all times the past, future, and present.

original: shes rab ni rten pa la 'jug pa mthong ba ste mi 'gal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni rten pa la 'jug pa mthong ba ste mi 'gal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the vision of engagement in dependence, which is noncontradictory.

original: shes rab kyis chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du mthong ba rten pa la 'jug pa mthong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du mthong ba rten pa la 'jug pa mthong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Wisdom is called the vision of engagement in dependence because it sees all phenomena as characterized by dependent origination.

original: de bas na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i phyir mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i phyir mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is in accord with the characteristics of dependent origination, it is not contradictory.

original: shes rab ni 'dzin pa dang nyon mongs pas bcings pa thams cad gcod pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'i lam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab ni 'dzin pa dang nyon mongs pas bcings pa thams cad gcod pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'i lam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the path of liberation because it cuts off all bonds of grasping and the afflictions.

original: rnam par thar pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Liberation is nirvana.

original: de thob par byed pa'i lam ni rnam par thar pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i lam ni rnam par thar pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path that causes one to attain that is the path of liberation.

original: bcing ba'i sgra 'dzin pas bcings pa dang / nyon mongs pas bcings pa zhes tshig gnyi ga dang sbyar te /
analyzed: bcing ba'i sgra 'dzin pas bcings pa dang / nyon mongs pas bcings pa zhes tshig gnyi ga dang sbyar te /
translated: The word “bond” should be applied to both “bound by grasping” and “bound by the afflictions.”

original: 'dzin pa nyid bcings pa dang nyon mongs pa nyid bcings pa yin pas 'dzin pa dang nyon mongs pa bcings pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa nyid bcings pa dang nyon mongs pa nyid bcings pa yin pas 'dzin pa dang nyon mongs pa bcings pa'o //
translated: Grasping is a bond and the afflictions are a bond, so they are bonds of grasping and the afflictions.

original: de la 'dzin pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / sems can du 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / sems can du 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Among them, grasping is attachment to the grasped and the grasper, grasping at a self, grasping at sentient beings, and so on.

original: / nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The afflictions are desire, hatred, and so on.

original: bcings pa de dag shes rab kyis gcod de /
analyzed: bcings pa de dag shes rab kyis gcod de /
translated: Those bonds are severed by wisdom.

original: bcings pa bcad na mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: bcings pa bcad na mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bas /
translated: When the bonds are severed, one attains nirvana.

original: shes rab ni rnam par thar pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: shes rab ni rnam par thar pa'i lam mo //
translated: Thus, wisdom is the path of liberation.

original: shes rab ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres pa'o zhes bya ba la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres shing de dag dang mi 'grogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres pa'o zhes bya ba la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres shing de dag dang mi 'grogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom is unmixed with all the afflictions. It is not mixed with or associated with all the afflictions such as desire and so on.

original: shes rab ni 'grogs pa dang sgrib pa dang sgrib par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa las lhan cig mi gnas pa ni chos de rnams dang mi 'grogs shing @170b ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'grogs pa dang sgrib pa dang sgrib par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa las lhan cig mi gnas pa ni chos de rnams dang mi 'grogs shing @170b ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is not associated with obscurations, obscurations that will arise, and so on. It is not associated with or mixed with those phenomena.

original: 'grogs pa ni 'grogs pa bcu drug ces gong du bshad par zad do zhes sgrib pa dang sgrib par 'gyur ba yang rnam pa bco brgyad do zhes gong du bshad de /
analyzed: 'grogs pa ni 'grogs pa bcu drug ces gong du bshad par zad do zhes sgrib pa dang sgrib par 'gyur ba yang rnam pa bco brgyad do zhes gong du bshad de /
translated: Association is the sixteen types of association explained above. Obscurations and obscurations that will arise are the eighteen types explained above.

original: dus gsum gyi dbye bas na /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi dbye bas na /
translated: The obscurations are twofold, according to the division of the three times.

original: sgrib pa la sgrib pa dang / sgrib par 'gyur ba zhes rnam pa gnyis su dbye'o /
analyzed: sgrib pa la sgrib pa dang / sgrib par 'gyur ba zhes rnam pa gnyis su dbye'o /
translated: The obscurations are the obscurations of the present, and the obscurations of the future.

original: de la da ltar gyi dus kyi dge ba la bar du gcod pa ni sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de la da ltar gyi dus kyi dge ba la bar du gcod pa ni sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obscurations of the present are the obscurations of the wholesome of the present time.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba la bar du gcod pa ni sgrib par 'gyur ba'o //🔽sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa ji snyed par shes rab dang ye shes kyi las kyang de snyed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba la bar du gcod pa ni sgrib par 'gyur ba'o // sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa ji snyed par shes rab dang ye shes kyi las kyang de snyed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The obscurations of the future are the obscurations of the wholesome of the future time.🔽The activities of wisdom and knowledge are as numerous as the activities of the mind of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems ji snyed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa ji snyed par zhes de snyed kyi sgra tshig re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems ji snyed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa ji snyed par zhes de snyed kyi sgra tshig re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: The activities of wisdom and knowledge are as numerous as the minds of all sentient beings, and as numerous as the activities of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems ni sems can rnams kyi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba skyes shing byung ba ji snyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems ni sems can rnams kyi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba skyes shing byung ba ji snyed pa'o //
translated: The minds of all sentient beings are the minds and mental factors of all sentient beings, past, future and present, that have arisen and are arising.

original: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa ji snyed pa ni sems can 'dod chags la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong /🔽zhe sdang la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa ji snyed pa ni sems can 'dod chags la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong / zhe sdang la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong /
translated: There are twenty one thousand sentient beings who engage in attachment,🔽twenty one thousand who engage in aversion,

original: gti mug la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong /
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong /
translated: twenty one thousand who engage in delusion

original: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong dag go //
analyzed: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong dag go //
translated: and twenty one thousand who engage in a mixture of these three.

original: sems can rnams kyi sems dang spyod pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad shes rab kyis shes par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems dang spyod pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad shes rab kyis shes par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Since the minds and conduct of all sentient beings are to be known by wisdom,

original: shes rab dang ye shes kyi las kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes kyi las kyang de snyed do //
translated: the activities of wisdom and transcendent knowledge are also that many.

original: de ni 'di skad da /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad da /
translated: This is stated as follows:

original: sems can nyid kyang nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' yas pas na de dag gi sems dang spyod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: sems can nyid kyang nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' yas pas na de dag gi sems dang spyod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: Since sentient beings are infinite like space, it goes without saying that their minds and conduct are also infinite.

original: mtha' yas pas de la dmigs par byed pa'i shes rab dang ye shes kyang mtha' yas so zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: mtha' yas pas de la dmigs par byed pa'i shes rab dang ye shes kyang mtha' yas so zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Since they are infinite, the wisdom and transcendent knowledge that focus on them are also infinite.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang bag la nyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang bag la nyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The wisdom of the knowledge of the elimination of all the afflictions and dormant tendencies of all sentient beings, etc.

original: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa bsal nas 'bras bu ye shes thob pa ni shes rab kyi spyod pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa bsal nas 'bras bu ye shes thob pa ni shes rab kyi spyod pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The attainment of the result, i.e. wisdom, by eliminating the afflictions through wisdom is the wisdom of the knowledge of elimination.

original: shes rab kyi rgyu las byung ba'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: shes rab kyi rgyu las byung ba'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: It means the wisdom that arises from the cause of wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The afflictions are attachment and so forth.

original: bag la nyal ba ni nyon mongs pa de dag gi sa bon no //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba ni nyon mongs pa de dag gi sa bon no //
translated: The dormant tendencies are the seeds of those afflictions.

original: sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang bag la nyal ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad shes rab kyis spang dgos pas de dag spangs pa'i ye shes @171a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang bag la nyal ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad shes rab kyis spang dgos pas de dag spangs pa'i ye shes @171a * //
translated: Since all the afflictions and dormant tendencies of sentient beings must be eliminated by wisdom, the wisdom of the elimination of those is also that many.

original: kyang de snyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyang de snyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgo ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ji snyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgo ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ji snyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The number of doors of the afflictions of all sentient beings means the number of causes of the afflictions of sentient beings.

original: shes rab la 'jug pa'i sgo'ang de snyed do zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgo ji snyed yod pa de dag re re bzhin yang shes par byed pa'i shes rab skyed par byed pa'i sgo'ang de snyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab la 'jug pa'i sgo'ang de snyed do zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgo ji snyed yod pa de dag re re bzhin yang shes par byed pa'i shes rab skyed par byed pa'i sgo'ang de snyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The number of doors of entry into wisdom is just that many. The meaning is that the number of doors of entry into the wisdom that generates knowledge of each of the afflictions is just that many.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ming gis smos pa'i 'phags pa de rnams kyi shes rab kyang 'phags pa de dag gi ye shes kyi gzhi la gnas pas 'phags pa de dag gi shes rab ji snyed par 'phags pa de dag gi ye shes
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ming gis smos pa'i 'phags pa de rnams kyi shes rab kyang 'phags pa de dag gi ye shes kyi gzhi la gnas pas 'phags pa de dag gi shes rab ji snyed par 'phags pa de dag gi ye shes
translated: The wisdom of those noble ones mentioned by name, such as the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, is just as much as the basis of their exalted wisdom.

original: dang rten dang de snyed do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang rten dang de snyed do zhes bya'o //
translated: The support is just that much.

original: gong du shes rab mi zad pa rgya cher bstan pa'i don rnams bsdu zhing de'i 'bras bu yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gong du shes rab mi zad pa rgya cher bstan pa'i don rnams bsdu zhing de'i 'bras bu yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the topics extensively taught above about the inexhaustibility of wisdom and to teach its result, it is said:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this is called the bodhisattvas’ imperishability of wisdom.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa la snyegs so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa la snyegs so //
translated: “ This” refers to what was explained above.

original: shes rab mi zad pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams gong du smos pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu 'dis so //
analyzed: shes rab mi zad pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams gong du smos pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu 'dis so //
translated: “ By this imperishability of wisdom” means that the bodhisattvas, by this cause of wisdom mentioned above,

original: de bas na 'bras bu ye shes mi zad pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu ye shes mi zad pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: therefore attain the result, which is the imperishability of gnosis.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs pa /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs pa /
translated: It is free from the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni ye shes mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni ye shes mi zad pa'o //
translated: Nondual gnosis is the imperishability of gnosis.

original: bstan pa'i bdag nyid chen po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa'i bdag nyid chen po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the greatness of the teacher,

original: shes rab mi zad pa bstan pa'i chos kyi le'u 'di bshad pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab mi zad pa bstan pa'i chos kyi le'u 'di bshad pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it says, “When this chapter on the Dharma of teaching the imperishability of wisdom was explained,” and so on.

original: de yang dus dang grangs dang yon tan gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang dus dang grangs dang yon tan gyis bstan to //
translated: This is taught by means of time, number, and quality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sngon yongs su sbyang ba byas pa zhes bya bas dus bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sngon yongs su sbyang ba byas pa zhes bya bas dus bstan to //
translated: The bodhisattva who has previously purified himself indicates the time.

original: mos pas spyad pa'i sar mnyan pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas lus dang sems las su rung ba byas pa ni sngon yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyad pa'i sar mnyan pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas lus dang sems las su rung ba byas pa ni sngon yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'o //
translated: Having made the body and mind serviceable through listening, reflection, etc. on the stage of faithful practice, he is one who has previously purified himself.

original: sum khri nyis stong zhes bya bas grangs bstan to //
analyzed: sum khri nyis stong zhes bya bas grangs bstan to //
translated: Thirty-two thousand indicates the number.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes bya bas yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes bya bas yon tan bstan te /
translated: They attained receptivity to the non-arising of things indicates the excellences.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog las 'das nas de ma thag tu chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog las 'das nas de ma thag tu chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs te /
translated: Having transcended the supreme mundane state, they immediately realized the characteristic of the universal expanse of reality.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon @171b mongs pa rnams spangs nas sa rab tu dga' ba thob pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon @171b mongs pa rnams spangs nas sa rab tu dga' ba thob pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Having abandoned the addictions that are to be abandoned by the path of vision, they attained the stage of the joyous, which is called “receptivity to the non-arising of things.”

original: don du na shes rab mi zad pa'i le'u 'di bstan pa'i tshe mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sum khri nyis stong gis sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob par gyur to zhes ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don du na shes rab mi zad pa'i le'u 'di bstan pa'i tshe mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sum khri nyis stong gis sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob par gyur to zhes ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: shes rab mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: shes rab mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The Inexhaustible Wisdom has been explained.

original: // / tshad med pa bzhi la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: // / tshad med pa bzhi la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who dwells in the four immeasurables is called the bodhisattva who practices compassion.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: And that is fourfold.

original: bzhi gang zhe na bde ba 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa dang ; bde ba la rjes su yi rang ba dang / mnyam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na bde ba 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa dang ; bde ba la rjes su yi rang ba dang / mnyam par gnas pa'o //
translated: What are the four? They are: wishing for happiness, being distressed by suffering, rejoicing in happiness, and dwelling in equanimity.

original: tshad med pa bzhi ni sems can rnams kyi don byed pas na de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'i don snying brtse ba bstan to //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi ni sems can rnams kyi don byed pas na de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'i don snying brtse ba bstan to //
translated: The four immeasurables are the means for accomplishing the aims of sentient beings. Therefore, the meaning of their inclusion is taught by compassion itself.

original: de la bde ba 'dod pa'i dbang du byas nas de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mi zad pas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la bde ba 'dod pa'i dbang du byas nas de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mi zad pas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Akṣayamati said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: de'ang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de'ang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: That is also sixfold:

original: dmigs par bya ba tshad med pas dmigs par byed pa tshad med pa dang / las dang 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin dang khyad par dang / rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba tshad med pas dmigs par byed pa tshad med pa dang / las dang 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin dang khyad par dang / rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
translated: The immeasurable object is taught through the immeasurable agent, action and result, nature, distinction, and division.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa yang mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa yang mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the love of the bodhisattvas is also inexhaustible.🔽From the beginning up to

original: de dag kyang byams pa mi zad par 'phags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yan chad kyis dmigs pa tshad med pas dmigs par byed pa ched med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag kyang byams pa mi zad par 'phags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yan chad kyis dmigs pa tshad med pas dmigs par byed pa ched med pa bstan to //
translated: they will also become noble ones with inexhaustible love, the immeasurable object is taught through the immeasurable agent.

original: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa ;
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa ;
translated: Akṣayamati said:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byams pa ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byams pa ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, from the beginning of “loving kindness” up to

original: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / thob kyis 'jal ba thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan to //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / thob kyis 'jal ba thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan to //
translated: “free from all hypocrisy, flattery, and domineering,” it is taught.

original: rnyed pa dang ba kur sti zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang ba kur sti zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From “gain, honor, and fame” up to

original: ngan song thams cad dang mi khom pa brgyad las 'das pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: ngan song thams cad dang mi khom pa brgyad las 'das pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: “transcending all lower realms and the eight unfavorable conditions,” the result is taught.

original: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' mos pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' mos pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From “delighting in the joy of the Dharma” up to

original: bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba dang nyon mongs pa'i dring ba sbyong ba zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rang bzhin bstan to //🔽btsun pa sha ra dva @172a * //
analyzed: bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba dang nyon mongs pa'i dring ba sbyong ba zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rang bzhin bstan to // btsun pa sha ra dva @172a * //
translated: “purifying the stains, bonds, and afflictions of latent tendencies,” the nature is taught.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, loving kindness is the protection of all sentient beings.

original: ti'i bu byams pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyong ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ti'i bu byams pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyong ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From the beginning up to

original: byams pa ni chu bo las sgrol ba'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: byams pa ni chu bo las sgrol ba'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis khyad par bstan to //
translated: Love is the crossing of the river.

original: 'di ltar btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gsum po 'di dag ni byams pa ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ;
analyzed: 'di ltar btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gsum po 'di dag ni byams pa ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ;
translated: Thus, the Venerable Śāradvatīputra, these three are love.

original: 'di ni btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa mi zad pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa mi zad pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
translated: This, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable love.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa yang mi zad pa yin te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa yang mi zad pa yin te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ love is also imperishable.🔽Why is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mi zad pa'i rgyu 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mi zad pa'i rgyu 'dri ba ste /
translated: This is asking about the cause of imperishability.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa de ci'i phyir mi zad pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa de ci'i phyir mi zad pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the meaning of “Why is that bodhisattva love imperishable?”

original: thug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni rgyu bstan te //
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni rgyu bstan te //
translated: It is taught by “Because it is endless.”

original: 'di tsam zhig ces bya ba ni thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam zhig ces bya ba ni thug pa'o //
translated: This much is a limit.

original: 'di tsam zhig ces gcad du med pas thug pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di tsam zhig ces gcad du med pas thug pa med pa ste /
translated: Since there is no cutting off of this much, there is no limit.

original: de bas na mi zad pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas byams pa mi zad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na mi zad pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas byams pa mi zad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is inexhaustible.🔽The love of the bodhisattvas is inexhaustible because it is not limited, because it is not destroyed by suffering, because it is not attached, and because it is not agitated.

original: de dag gi byams pa nye bar bsgrubs pa yongs su chad pa med do zhes bya ba la /🔽'di tsam zhig tshun chad ni dmigs par byed kyi /🔽de phan chad dmigs par mi byed pa ni byams pa nye bar bsgrub pa yongs su chad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi byams pa nye bar bsgrubs pa yongs su chad pa med do zhes bya ba la / 'di tsam zhig tshun chad ni dmigs par byed kyi / de phan chad dmigs par mi byed pa ni byams pa nye bar bsgrub pa yongs su chad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The love of the bodhisattvas is inexhaustible because it is not limited. 🔽 It is not limited because it is not limited in scope, because it is not limited in application, and because it is not limited in attainment.🔽It is not limited in scope because it has all beings for its scope. 🔽It is not limited in application because it is applied to the benefit and happiness of all beings. 🔽It is not limited in attainment because it is not cut off.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byams pas sems can thams cad la dmigs par byed pas na byams pa nye bar sgrub pa chad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byams pas sems can thams cad la dmigs par byed pas na byams pa nye bar sgrub pa chad pa med pa'o //
translated: The love of the bodhisattvas is inexhaustible because it is not destroyed by suffering. 🔽It is not destroyed by suffering because it is not agitated by the suffering of others. 🔽The love of the bodhisattvas is inexhaustible because it is not attached.

original: 'di ltar sems can gyi khams ji tsam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas byams pa nye bar sgrub pa yongs su chad pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bsgrubs te bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can gyi khams ji tsam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas byams pa nye bar sgrub pa yongs su chad pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bsgrubs te bstan to //
translated: Thus, as much as the realm of sentient beings... and so on, establishes and teaches the reason for the continuity of the accomplishment of love.

original: byams pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The generation of the thought of love means

original: byams pas sems can thams cad la khyab par bya'o zhes sems bskyed pa ni byams pa'i sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: byams pas sems can thams cad la khyab par bya'o zhes sems bskyed pa ni byams pa'i sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: the generation of the thought, I will pervade all sentient beings with love.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas byams pa de sems can thams cad la khyab pa dang mi zad pa'i dpe ston pa'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas byams pa de sems can thams cad la khyab pa dang mi zad pa'i dpe ston pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is like this... and so on, shows the example of the pervasion of all sentient beings with love and its inexhaustibility.

original: rgyu chung ngus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa chung ngu dang / dpe chung ngus ni bstan par mi nus so @172b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu chung ngus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa chung ngu dang / dpe chung ngus ni bstan par mi nus so @172b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not by a small cause means it cannot be taught by a small understanding or a small example.

original: mtshan ma bzhag pa 'di dang zhes bya ba ni phyogs thams cad rgya mtsho'i chus gang bar gyur pa la gong du smos pa'i grangs snyed kyi sems can 'dus nas /
analyzed: mtshan ma bzhag pa 'di dang zhes bya ba ni phyogs thams cad rgya mtsho'i chus gang bar gyur pa la gong du smos pa'i grangs snyed kyi sems can 'dus nas /
translated: The phrase this is the name refers to the situation in which all the directions are filled with the water of the ocean, and sentient beings equal in number to the above-mentioned grains of sand gather.

original: skra'i rtse brgyar gshags pa'i chas chu'i thigs pa gcig blangs pa'o //
analyzed: skra'i rtse brgyar gshags pa'i chas chu'i thigs pa gcig blangs pa'o //
translated: Then, one drop of water is taken up by a hundredth part of the tip of a hair.

original: bgrang ba 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni yang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can rnams 'dus te /🔽gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal ba 'das pa dang / skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i chas chu'i thigs pa gnyis blangs pa nas /
