analyzed: bgrang ba 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni yang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can rnams 'dus te / gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal ba 'das pa dang / skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i chas chu'i thigs pa gnyis blangs pa nas /
translated: The phrase this is the number refers to the situation in which sentient beings equal in number to the grains of sand in the Ganges gather.

original: gsum bzhi yan chad gong du blangs pa bzhin du bsgra ba'o //
analyzed: gsum bzhi yan chad gong du blangs pa bzhin du bsgra ba'o //
translated: Then, two drops of water are taken up by a hundredth part of the tip of a hair, and then three, four, and so forth, as above.

original: de dag kyang byams pa mi zad par 'phags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar skrag pa med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa kun las 'phags pa'i byams pa mi zad par ldan par
analyzed: de dag kyang byams pa mi zad par 'phags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar skrag pa med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa kun las 'phags pa'i byams pa mi zad par ldan par
translated: Thus, those bodhisattvas who are fearless will become endowed with inexhaustible love that is exalted over all ordinary beings and exalted hearers, etc.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by exalted.

original: dmigs pa tshad med pas dmigs par byed pa tshad med pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: dmigs pa tshad med pas dmigs par byed pa tshad med pa bshad zin to /
translated: The limitless objects have been explained as the limitless objective supports.

original: // / las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / las bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the actions,

original: blo gros mi zad par smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: blo gros mi zad par smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: inexhaustible intellect spoke this.

original: byams pa ni bdag bsrung zhing gzhan la phan par gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byams pa ni bdag bsrung zhing gzhan la phan par gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Love is the protection of self and the abiding in benefit for others.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa la gnod par byed pa'i dgra mi 'byung bas na bdag bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa la gnod par byed pa'i dgra mi 'byung bas na bdag bsrung ba'o //
translated: Since enemies who inflict harm do not arise for one who is endowed with love, there is the protection of self.

original: sems can gzhan la phan pa stobs par byed pa'i gzhan la phan par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la phan pa stobs par byed pa'i gzhan la phan par gnas pa'o //
translated: Since one is able to bestow benefit upon other sentient beings, there is the abiding in benefit for others.

original: yang na byams pa dang ldan pa dang / de la zhe sdang med pa'i phyir bdag bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na byams pa dang ldan pa dang / de la zhe sdang med pa'i phyir bdag bsrung ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is the protection of oneself, because one is endowed with lovingkindness and because one has no hatred.

original: gzhan la gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir gzhan la phan par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir gzhan la phan par gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the abiding in the benefit of others, because one does not injure others.

original: mchog tu rtsod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni don dang dgos pa gang gi phyir yang gzhan dang mi rtsod pas so //
analyzed: mchog tu rtsod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni don dang dgos pa gang gi phyir yang gzhan dang mi rtsod pas so //
translated: It is the supreme absence of conflict, because one does not quarrel with others for any reason or purpose.

original: rab tu 'joms zhes bya ba ni de dag spong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab tu 'joms zhes bya ba ni de dag spong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the complete conquest, because one conquers them.

original: gzhan ni gong du bshad par zad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni gong du bshad par zad do //
translated: The rest is as explained above.

original: bral ba zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa la zhe sdang gi bag la nyal dang kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa la zhe sdang gi bag la nyal dang kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the absence of hostility, because one who is endowed with lovingkindness has no latent tendency to hatred or any manifestation of hatred.

original: dad pa bskyed cing zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang de la slar gnod pa mi byed de /
analyzed: dad pa bskyed cing zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang de la slar gnod pa mi byed de /
translated: It is the generation of faith, because even when others injure the bodhisattva who is endowed with lovingkindness, he does not injure them in return.

original: de'i rgyus sems can dga' ba skyed par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rgyus sems can dga' ba skyed par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he generates joy in sentient beings by that cause.

original: sems can @173a * //
analyzed: sems can @173a * //
translated: to all sentient beings.

original: thams cad kyi 'khrul pa la nyes par mi lta zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas mi dge ba la 'jug pa ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi 'khrul pa la nyes par mi lta zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas mi dge ba la 'jug pa ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: Not seeing error as a fault means that, when one is under the influence of the afflictions and engages in non-virtue, that is error.

original: de yang gzhan gyi rkyen las byung bar gyur pa shes nas de la skyon du mi lta zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi rkyen las byung bar gyur pa shes nas de la skyon du mi lta zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And that is produced from the conditions of others. Knowing that, one does not see it as a fault. That is the meaning.

original: yongs su gdung bar byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su gdung bar byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: Agitation means

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'ang de la zhe sdang gi 'khrug pa'i sems dang lus la mi bde ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'ang de la zhe sdang gi 'khrug pa'i sems dang lus la mi bde ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: that, even when one is full of love, there is no disturbance of mind or physical discomfort due to hatred.🔽That is the meaning.

original: de bas na lus dang sems bde ba skyed pa zhes bya ba gsungs so /
analyzed: de bas na lus dang sems bde ba skyed pa zhes bya ba gsungs so /
translated: Therefore, it is said to generate physical and mental bliss.

original: lus bde ba skyed pa ni /
analyzed: lus bde ba skyed pa ni /
translated: Generating physical bliss

original: lus sim par byed pas so //
analyzed: lus sim par byed pas so //
translated: means that the body is refreshed.

original: sems bde ba skyed pa ni /
analyzed: sems bde ba skyed pa ni /
translated: Generating mental bliss

original: sems sim pas so //
analyzed: sems sim pas so //
translated: means that the mind is refreshed.

original: gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba las shin tu 'das zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba las shin tu 'das zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Exceedingly beyond being harmed by others means

original: byams pa dang ldan pa la su yang gnod par mi byed pas so //
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa la su yang gnod par mi byed pas so //
translated: that no one harms one who is full of love.

original: nyes pa thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang bral te zhes bya ba ni byams pa can gyi gang zag de srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i las la mi 'jug pas de la nyes ba byas pa ni rgyu las mi 'byung ba'i tshe 'di la bcings pa dang /
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang bral te zhes bya ba ni byams pa can gyi gang zag de srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i las la mi 'jug pas de la nyes ba byas pa ni rgyu las mi 'byung ba'i tshe 'di la bcings pa dang /
translated: He is free from fear of all misdeeds means that the person who has love does not engage in actions such as killing and stealing, so when he commits a misdeed, he is not bound by it in this life, and

original: gsad pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du ngan song du skye ba'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsad pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du ngan song du skye ba'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he has no fear of being imprisoned or executed, or of being reborn in the lower realms in other lives.

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang mthun zhes bya ba ni byams pa de 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang mi 'gal zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang mthun zhes bya ba ni byams pa de 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang mi 'gal zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is in accord with the noble path means that love does not conflict with the eightfold noble path.

original: gshe ba dang / sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams dad par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gshe ba dang / sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams dad par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It inspires faith in beings who have a hostile or angry mind.

original: zhe sdang gi rgyus tshig rtsub po smra ba ni gshe ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rgyus tshig rtsub po smra ba ni gshe ba'o //
translated: Hostile means speaking harsh words out of hatred.

original: sems can gsad pa la sogs pas phung bar bya ba'i bsam pa rtsub po ni sdang ba'i sems dang ldan te /
analyzed: sems can gsad pa la sogs pas phung bar bya ba'i bsam pa rtsub po ni sdang ba'i sems dang ldan te /
translated: Angry means having a cruel intention to destroy beings by killing them and so on.

original: de lta bu dag kyang byams pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag la dad ba skye bar 'gyur bas ni byams pa ni gshe ba dang sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams dad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag kyang byams pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag la dad ba skye bar 'gyur bas ni byams pa ni gshe ba dang sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams dad par byed pa'o //
translated: Such people also generate faith in a person who is full of love. Thus, love causes faith in sentient beings who have a mind that is full of hatred and anger.

original: g-yul thams cad las sgrol ba ste zhes bya ba ni mtshon cha med par byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pa thams cad las rgyal bar byed de /
analyzed: g-yul thams cad las sgrol ba ste zhes bya ba ni mtshon cha med par byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pa thams cad las rgyal bar byed de /
translated: It is the liberator from all battles, because through the concentration of love, without any weapons, one conquers all demons, non-Buddhists, and so on.

original: de bas na dbyig pa dang / mtshon cha 'chang ba ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na dbyig pa dang / mtshon cha 'chang ba ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one does not hold a stick or a weapon.

original: sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar bya ba la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das par bya ba la @173b mos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar bya ba la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das par bya ba la @173b mos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the delight in liberating all sentient beings, which means the delight in taking all sentient beings to nirvana.

original: tshul 'chos pa dang kha gsag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa dang kha gsag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is the absence of hypocrisy, flattery, and so on.

original: khe dang bkur sti la sogs pa'i bsam ba nyon mongs pa can gyi spyod lam 'chos pa thams cad ni tshul 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: khe dang bkur sti la sogs pa'i bsam ba nyon mongs pa can gyi spyod lam 'chos pa thams cad ni tshul 'chos pa'o //
translated: All the conduct of a person with an afflicted attitude, such as the desire for gain, honor, etc., is hypocrisy.

original: thob pa la chags pa'i phyir tshig snyan par smra ba thams cad ni kha gsag go ;
analyzed: thob pa la chags pa'i phyir tshig snyan par smra ba thams cad ni kha gsag go ;
translated: All the pleasant speech of a person who is attached to gain is flattery.

original: / rnyed pa la chags pa'i sems kyis lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa'i yo byad nan gyis slong ba ni thob kyis 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: / rnyed pa la chags pa'i sems kyis lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa'i yo byad nan gyis slong ba ni thob kyis 'jal ba'o //
translated: All the insistence of a person who is attached to gain in begging for the requisites of a monk, such as a begging bowl, robes, etc., is intimidation.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i 'tsho ba de dag med pas na bral ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i 'tsho ba de dag med pas na bral ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Since one is without those means of livelihood, such as love, etc., it is called separation.

original: las bshad zin to /
analyzed: las bshad zin to /
translated: The action has been explained.

original: // /'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir rnyed pa dang bkur sti zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // /'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir rnyed pa dang bkur sti zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the result, he says, “gain, honor, etc.”

original: rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: Gain is robes, etc.

original: bkur sti ni phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti ni phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Honor is salutation, etc.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni bstod pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni bstod pa ste /
translated: Verse is praise.

original: de lta bu dag dang ldan par 'gyur bas na 'byung bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag dang ldan par 'gyur bas na 'byung bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one becomes endowed with such things, it is called “to bring about.”

original: phyag byas ba ni 'jig rten gyi gtso bo de dag gis byams pa dang ldan pa la phyag byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag byas ba ni 'jig rten gyi gtso bo de dag gis byams pa dang ldan pa la phyag byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The homage is because those who are the chief in the world pay homage to one who is endowed with love.

original: gang gi gzi brjid kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa ni byams pa'i gzi brjid kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi gzi brjid kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa ni byams pa'i gzi brjid kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Adorned with the ornament of his splendor means that he is adorned with the ornament of the splendor of love.

original: mkhas pas rab tu bsngags pa ni byams pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstod par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: mkhas pas rab tu bsngags pa ni byams pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstod par mdzad pas so //
translated: The wise praise him means that the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, Bodhisattvas, and Tathagatas praise the person who is endowed with love.

original: byis pa thams cad bsrung ba ni byams pa des so so'i skye bo rnams zhe sdang gi lam du mi gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa thams cad bsrung ba ni byams pa des so so'i skye bo rnams zhe sdang gi lam du mi gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He protects all the foolish means that by that love he prevents ordinary beings from being led onto the path of hatred.

original: tshangs pa'i lam dang mthun pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang mthun pa'am ;
analyzed: tshangs pa'i lam dang mthun pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang mthun pa'am ;
translated: He is in accord with the path of Brahma means that he is in accord with the path of Nirvana,

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang mthun pa'o //
translated: or that he is in accord with the four immeasurables.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang ma 'dres pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na byams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang ma 'dres pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na byams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not mixed with the desire realm because there is no love in the desire realm.

original: sems can thams cad thar pa'i lam gyi mchog ces bya ba ni sems can rnams mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam gyi nang na lam gyi dam pa byams pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad thar pa'i lam gyi mchog ces bya ba ni sems can rnams mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam gyi nang na lam gyi dam pa byams pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The supreme path of liberation for all sentient beings means that love is the best path among the paths that lead sentient beings to nirvana.

original: theg pa thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa thams cad kyang byams par 'dus te /
analyzed: theg pa thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa thams cad kyang byams par 'dus te /
translated: It is the perfect summary of all vehicles means that all vehicles are included in love.

original: theg pa gsum char gyi rtsa ba byams pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽zang zing med pa'i bsod nams kyis gzung ba zhes bya ba la bsod nams kyi @174a * //
analyzed: theg pa gsum char gyi rtsa ba byams pa yin pa'i phyir ro // zang zing med pa'i bsod nams kyis gzung ba zhes bya ba la bsod nams kyi @174a * //
translated: Because love is the root of all three vehicles.

original: dngos po rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is the accumulation of merit that is not material means that there are three kinds of merit:

original: sbyin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims kyi bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / bsgoms pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims kyi bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / bsgoms pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: the basis of merit that is giving, the basis of merit that is morality, and the basis of merit that is meditation.

original: de la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims gnyis ni zang zing dang bcas pa'i bsod nams kyi dngos po ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims gnyis ni zang zing dang bcas pa'i bsod nams kyi dngos po ste /
translated: The two, generosity and morality, are the meritorious things that are with material,

original: sbyin pas longs spyod kyi rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: sbyin pas longs spyod kyi rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: because generosity is the cause of wealth and

original: tshul khrims kyis mtho ris kyi rgyur 'gyur bas 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis mtho ris kyi rgyur 'gyur bas 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: morality is the cause of high status, and they are the causes of cyclic existence.

original: bsgoms pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni zang zing med pa ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni zang zing med pa ste /
translated: The meritorious thing that is meditation is without material,

original: thar ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of liberation.

original: byams pa yang bsgoms pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos por gtogs pas na zang zing med pa'i bsod nams kyis gzung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa yang bsgoms pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos por gtogs pas na zang zing med pa'i bsod nams kyis gzung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since love also belongs to the meritorious thing that is meditation, it is called “grasped by the meritorious thing that is without material.”

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad stsogs pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa bsgoms pa'i mthu las bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa'i stsogs pas /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad stsogs pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa bsgoms pa'i mthu las bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa'i stsogs pas /
translated: “The accumulation of all merit” means that through the power of cultivating love, one accumulates immeasurable merit.

original: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “It is not surpassed by all the meritorious things that are with material” means that

original: rdzas ni longs spyod kyi nor la bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas ni longs spyod kyi nor la bya'o //
translated: Substance refers to wealth that is enjoyed.

original: nor btang ba'i gzhi las byung ba'i bsod nams ni rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams te /
analyzed: nor btang ba'i gzhi las byung ba'i bsod nams ni rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams te /
translated: Merit that arises from the basis of giving wealth is merit that arises from substance.

original: de yang gtsug lag khang dang / de'i sa gzhi dang / mal stan dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gtsug lag khang dang / de'i sa gzhi dang / mal stan dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is a temple, its ground, bedding, articles for living, alms, and so on.

original: byams pa bsgoms pa'i bsod nams la rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams thams cad kyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus pas na zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa bsgoms pa'i bsod nams la rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams thams cad kyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus pas na zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the merit of cultivating loving kindness cannot be surpassed by any merit that arises from substance, it is called unsurpassable.

original: bsod nams de dag bas byams pa'i bsod nams 'bras bu che zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsod nams de dag bas byams pa'i bsod nams 'bras bu che zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the merit of loving kindness is greater than those merits.

original: brgyan zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa ni ming gis smos pa'i yon tan de dag thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyan zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa ni ming gis smos pa'i yon tan de dag thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Adorned means that one who possesses loving kindness obtains those qualities mentioned by name.

original: dbang po nyams pa dang ma tshang ba thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba la mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po yod kyang gzugs lta ba la mi gsal ba dang / sgra mnyan pa la mi gsal pa ni dbang po nyams pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa dang ma tshang ba thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba la mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po yod kyang gzugs lta ba la mi gsal ba dang / sgra mnyan pa la mi gsal pa ni dbang po nyams pa'o //
translated: All those with impaired or incomplete faculties are abandoned means that even if one has faculties such as eyes and ears, if one is unclear about seeing forms or unclear about hearing sounds, one's faculties are impaired.

original: rna ba rdum po dang / mig zhar ba dang / lag pa rdum por 'gyur ba ni dbang po ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: rna ba rdum po dang / mig zhar ba dang / lag pa rdum por 'gyur ba ni dbang po ma tshang ba'o //
translated: Being deaf, blind, or having a crippled arm is having incomplete faculties.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Those with loving kindness

original: gar skyes kyang dbang po gsal zhing dbang po tshang bar skye bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: gar skyes kyang dbang po gsal zhing dbang po tshang bar skye bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: are born with clear faculties and complete faculties wherever they are born.

original: dbang po nyams pa dang ma @174b tshang ba thams cad spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa dang ma @174b tshang ba thams cad spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that all those with impaired or incomplete faculties are abandoned.

original: bde 'gro thams cad dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang mthun pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde 'gro thams cad dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang mthun pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said to be in accord with the path to all happy rebirths and nirvana.

original: ji ltar tshul khrims dang sbyin pa la sogs pas lha dang mir skye ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba bzhin du byams pa la gnas pas kyang rtag tu lha dang mir skye ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims dang sbyin pa la sogs pas lha dang mir skye ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba bzhin du byams pa la gnas pas kyang rtag tu lha dang mir skye ba dang /
translated: Just as through morality, generosity, and so on, one is born as a god or human, and just as through the eightfold noble path one attains nirvana, so too through abiding in love one is always born as a god or human,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur bas na bde 'gro thams cad dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur bas na bde 'gro thams cad dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and attains nirvana. Therefore, it is said to be the path that accords with all happy rebirths and nirvana.

original: ngan song thams cad dang / mi khom pa brgyad las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa de nams kyang nyams nga ba'i gnas ngag tu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan song thams cad dang / mi khom pa brgyad las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan pa de nams kyang nyams nga ba'i gnas ngag tu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As for transcending all lower rebirths and the eight conditions that lack leisure, because one who possesses love is never born in a place of fear, one is born in a happy rebirth and has leisure.

original: 'bras bu bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'bras bu bshad zin to /
translated: The result has been explained.

original: // / rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach its nature,

original: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' mos pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' mos pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it says, Delighting in the joy of Dharma.

original: stong pa nyid la dad pa ni chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la dad pa ni chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'o //
translated: Faith in emptiness is delighting in the joy of Dharma.

original: de ston par byed pa'i gzhung de la dad pa ni chos kyi kun dga' la mos pa'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i gzhung de la dad pa ni chos kyi kun dga' la mos pa'o //
translated: Faith in the scripture that teaches that is delight in the joy of Dharma.

original: yang na chos spyad par 'dod pa ni chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: yang na chos spyad par 'dod pa ni chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'o //
translated: Or, the desire to practice the Dharma is delight in the joy of Dharma.

original: de sgrub par byed pa ni chos kyi kun dga' la mos ba ste /
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa ni chos kyi kun dga' la mos ba ste /
translated: The accomplishment of that is faith in the joy of Dharma.

original: de bas na 'dod pa dang longs spyod la mi 'dod ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa dang longs spyod la mi 'dod ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they do not desire sense objects and enjoyments.

original: 'dod pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dod pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Sense objects are forms, sounds, and so on.

original: / longs spyod pa ni bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / longs spyod pa ni bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Enjoyments are food, drink, and so on.

original: dbang phyug ni rgyal po'i srid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni rgyal po'i srid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Power is kingship and so on.

original: sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa des phyogs dang dus chad pa med de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa des phyogs dang dus chad pa med de /
translated: Evenness of mind toward all sentient beings means that this love is not limited by direction or time.

original: phyogs bcu dang dus gsum thams cad kyi sems can thams cad la 'dra bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dang dus gsum thams cad kyi sems can thams cad la 'dra bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it focuses equally on all sentient beings in the ten directions and three times.

original: sbyin pa'i sbyor ba tha dad pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la ni sbyin /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i sbyor ba tha dad pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la ni sbyin /
translated: Free from the differentiation of the application of generosity means that this love is not differentiated by the application of generosity.

original: 'di la ni mi sbyin zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni sbyin /
analyzed: 'di la ni mi sbyin zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni sbyin /
translated: Here, there is nothing that is not given,

original: 'di ni mi sbyin zhes bya ba med kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni mi sbyin zhes bya ba med kyi /
translated: and nothing that is given,

original: sems can thams cad la dngos po thams cad sbyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dngos po thams cad sbyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because everything is given to all sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims dang bslab pa thams cad kyi sgo zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan na sems can gyi srog gcod pa dang / longs spyod las ma byin par len pa la sogs pa mi byed de /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang bslab pa thams cad kyi sgo zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang ldan na sems can gyi srog gcod pa dang / longs spyod las ma byin par len pa la sogs pa mi byed de /
translated: The gateway to all morality and training means that when one is endowed with loving kindness, one does not take the life of sentient beings, nor does one take what is not given, such as their possessions.

original: tshul khrims skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang bslab pa thams cad kyi sgo zhes bya'o //🔽tshul khrims 'chal ba @175a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang bslab pa thams cad kyi sgo zhes bya'o // tshul khrims 'chal ba @175a * //
translated: Because it is the cause and condition for the arising of morality, it is called the gateway to all morality and training.

original: thams cad yongs su skyob pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims nyams pa rnams mi dge ba'i gnas nas bskyod de dge ba'i gnas su 'god par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad yongs su skyob pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims nyams pa rnams mi dge ba'i gnas nas bskyod de dge ba'i gnas su 'god par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Fully protecting all those with faulty morality means that those with impaired morality are moved from unwholesome states and established in wholesome states.

original: bzod pa'i stobs ston pa zhes bya ba ni sems can mthu chung ngu rnams kyis gnod par byas kyang slar gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bzod pa'i stobs ston pa zhes bya ba ni sems can mthu chung ngu rnams kyis gnod par byas kyang slar gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The chapter called “The Strength of Patience” is so called because even when harmed by weak sentient beings, one does not harm them in return.

original: de bas na nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dang dregs pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dang dregs pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is free of all pride, arrogance, and conceit.

original: de la nga rgyal ni nga rgyal rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: de la nga rgyal ni nga rgyal rnam pa bdun no //
translated: Therein, pride is the seven types of pride.

original: rgyags pa ni longs spyod snyems pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa ni longs spyod snyems pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is the conceit of wealth.

original: dregs pa ni byad lag dang shes pa snyems pa ste /
analyzed: dregs pa ni byad lag dang shes pa snyems pa ste /
translated: Conceit is the conceit of beauty and knowledge.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa la nyes pa de lta bu med pas na bral ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa la nyes pa de lta bu med pas na bral ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Since one who possesses love is free of such faults, it is called “free.”

original: rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de rnams kyi rgyu byams pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de rnams kyi rgyu byams pa yin pas so //
translated: The root is love, because it is the cause of those meditative absorptions.

original: mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams shing yang dag par sbyor ba bya ba thams cad las sgrol ba zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi bya ba 'di lta bu yang byams pas mthar 'byin par byed de zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams shing yang dag par sbyor ba bya ba thams cad las sgrol ba zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi bya ba 'di lta bu yang byams pas mthar 'byin par byed de zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The practice of unperturbed effort is the practice of all correct applications that liberate from all activities.

original: le lo'i dbang du mi 'gyur zhing grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa dang / bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas mi bzlog pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: le lo'i dbang du mi 'gyur zhing grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa dang / bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas mi bzlog pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The practice of unperturbed effort is the practice of effort that is not overcome by laziness, that is not turned back by cold, heat, and so on, and that is not turned back by demons, tirthikas, and so on.

original: pha rol du phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar sbyor ba ni /🔽yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol du phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar sbyor ba ni / yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The practice of all correct applications is the practice of the six perfections and the practice of benefiting all sentient beings.🔽The practice of all correct applications is the practice of the six perfections and the practice of benefiting all sentient beings.🔽The practice of all correct applications is the practice of the six perfections and the practice of benefiting all sentient beings.🔽The practice of all correct applications is the practice of the six perfections and the practice of benefiting all sentient beings.🔽The practice of all correct applications is the practice of the six perfections and the practice of benefiting all sentient beings.

original: bya ba de dag thams cad mthar 'byin par byed pa ni yang dag par sgrol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba de dag thams cad mthar 'byin par byed pa ni yang dag par sgrol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The practice of all correct applications is the practice of the six perfections and the practice of benefiting all sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad las nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la sems rtse gcig tu bzhag pas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang spong bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad las nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la sems rtse gcig tu bzhag pas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang spong bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase the certain deliverance from all afflictions means that by setting the mind in one-pointed concentration on samādhi, one also abandons all afflictions.

original: gsang sngags dang thos pa 'dzin pas nges par sems pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu bskyed pa zhes bya ba la /🔽chos kyi don zab mo'am /
analyzed: gsang sngags dang thos pa 'dzin pas nges par sems pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu bskyed pa zhes bya ba la / chos kyi don zab mo'am /
translated: The phrase the generation of the cause of the wisdom of certainty through the retention of mantras and learning means the following.

original: bsam gtan gyi man ngag thob pa phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa ni gsang sngags dang thos pa 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi man ngag thob pa phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa ni gsang sngags dang thos pa 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The retention of the profound meaning of the Dharma or the unmistaken retention of the instructions on meditative concentration is called the retention of mantras and learning.

original: de ltar bzung nas sems la bsam gtan du bya zhing nges par rtog nus pa'i shes rab kyang byams pa las 'byung bas shes rab kyi rgyu bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzung nas sems la bsam gtan du bya zhing nges par rtog nus pa'i shes rab kyang byams pa las 'byung bas shes rab kyi rgyu bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having retained them in that way, one is able to contemplate them in the mind and to generate the wisdom of certainty. Since that wisdom arises from loving kindness, it is called the generation of the cause of wisdom.

original: rang gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs la nges pa zhes bya ba la rang gi phyogs ni rnam par byang ba'i chos so //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs la nges pa zhes bya ba la rang gi phyogs ni rnam par byang ba'i chos so //
translated: The phrase certainty with regard to one's own position and the position of others means that one's own position is the Dharma of purification.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs ni @175b bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs ni @175b bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The other side is the side of Mara and the defilements.

original: nges pa ni de gnyis la mkhas shing de gnyis bye brag phyed pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni de gnyis la mkhas shing de gnyis bye brag phyed pa'o //
translated: Certainty is skill in those two and discrimination of those two.

original: de ltar bye brag phyed nas bdud kyi phyogs dang nyon mongs pa ni spong bar byed /
analyzed: de ltar bye brag phyed nas bdud kyi phyogs dang nyon mongs pa ni spong bar byed /
translated: Having thus discriminated, he abandons the side of Mara and the defilements.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs rnams ni 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs rnams ni 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: He increases the side of purification.

original: bdud kyi phyogs dang nyon mongs pa rnams bsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdud kyi phyogs dang nyon mongs pa rnams bsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he is said to “remove the side of Mara and the defilements.”

original: bsnyen bkur dang 'jug pa'i rgyu mthun pa la sems zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur dang 'jug pa'i rgyu mthun pa la sems zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is the natural outcome of service and engagement.

original: bsnyen bkur ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
translated: Service is the service to the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, etc.

original: 'jug pas ni sa dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams spyod pa la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pas ni sa dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams spyod pa la zhugs pa ste /
translated: Engagement is the engagement in the practice of the stages and the elements of enlightenment.

original: byams pa ni rgyud lta bu dag dang 'dra ba las byung ba'i 'bras bu la sems pas ni rgyu mthun pa la sems pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa ni rgyud lta bu dag dang 'dra ba las byung ba'i 'bras bu la sems pas ni rgyu mthun pa la sems pa'o //
translated: Love is the cause of the fruit that arises from a pure continuum, and so it is the cause of the fruit that is similar to the cause.

original: spyod lam srung bar byed ces bya ba ni byams pas spyod lam thams cad du nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bar bsrung zhing spyod lam mi mdzes pa rnams med par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyod lam srung bar byed ces bya ba ni byams pas spyod lam thams cad du nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bar bsrung zhing spyod lam mi mdzes pa rnams med par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “It protects the posture” means that through love, the afflictions do not arise in any posture, and so it eliminates the unseemly postures.

original: rgod pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa yul la mi 'jug cing zhi bar gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgod pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa yul la mi 'jug cing zhi bar gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “It transcends all agitation” means that the sense faculties and consciousness do not engage with objects and abide in peace.

original: nga rgyal gyi las sel ba zhes bya ba ni byams pas nga rgyal gyi rgyu las byung ba'i las mgo 'phang bstod pa dang / lag pa brkyang ba la sogs pa khengs ba'i mtshan ma rnams med par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi las sel ba zhes bya ba ni byams pas nga rgyal gyi rgyu las byung ba'i las mgo 'phang bstod pa dang / lag pa brkyang ba la sogs pa khengs ba'i mtshan ma rnams med par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “It eliminates the activity of pride” means that through love, the signs of arrogance, such as raising the head, extending the arms, and so on, which arise from the cause of pride, are eliminated.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pas byugs shing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pas byugs shing zhes bya ba la /
translated: Anointed with a sense of shame and decency means

original: bdag la ltos nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi byed pa ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la ltos nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi byed pa ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
translated: not committing sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas in relation to oneself is a sense of shame.

original: gzhan la ltos nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi byed pa ni khrel yod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi byed pa ni khrel yod pa ste /
translated: Not committing sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas in relation to others is a sense of decency.

original: chos de dag gnyis dang ldan pa ni byugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag gnyis dang ldan pa ni byugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Being endowed with those two dharmas is called anointed.

original: dri zhim po ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang ldan pas kha na ma tho ba dang ldan pa mi rigs pa'i chos de la med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dri zhim po ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang ldan pas kha na ma tho ba dang ldan pa mi rigs pa'i chos de la med pa'i phyir te /
translated: A pleasant smell means that which is endowed with a sense of shame and decency does not have that sinful, nonvirtuous dharma that is improper.

original: de bas na dri nga ba sbyong ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na dri nga ba sbyong ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is applied as purifying bad smells.

original: las bshad zin to /
analyzed: las bshad zin to /
translated: The action has been explained.

original: // / khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the distinctions, it is said:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byams pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byams pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, love is the protector of all sentient beings...

original: thams cad skyob pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad skyob pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The protector of all is the teaching.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ji ltar byams pa sems can thams cad skyob par byed pa'i bshad @176a * //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ji ltar byams pa sems can thams cad skyob par byed pa'i bshad @176a * //
translated: The rest is as was explained in the case of Maitreya’s protection of all beings.

original: pa'o ; / bdag gi bde ba gtong zhing zhes bya ba ni byams pa chen po dang ldan pa rnams rtag par bdag bde ba dang ldan par mi 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa'o ; / bdag gi bde ba gtong zhing zhes bya ba ni byams pa chen po dang ldan pa rnams rtag par bdag bde ba dang ldan par mi 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ Giving up one’s own happiness” means that those who have great love do not desire their own happiness.

original: sems can rnams la bde ba sbyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan na yang pa de ba la 'jog par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la bde ba sbyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan na yang pa de ba la 'jog par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: “ Giving happiness to beings” means that they establish beings in happiness in this life and in other lives.

original: de bas na byams pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na byams pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is great love.

original: sems can rnams tshe 'dir bde ba la 'jog pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i zang zing gi bde ba thams cad dang ldan par byas pas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams tshe 'dir bde ba la 'jog pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i zang zing gi bde ba thams cad dang ldan par byas pas so //
translated: Establishing beings in happiness in this life means that they are endowed with all kinds of irreproachable worldly happiness.

original: sems can rnams tshe rabs gzhan du bde ba la 'jog pa ni sems can rnams tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i bde 'gro byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams tshe rabs gzhan du bde ba la 'jog pa ni sems can rnams tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i bde 'gro byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Establishing beings in happiness in other lives means that they cause beings to attain happy rebirth as gods and humans.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi byams pa ni bdag skyob pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi byams pa ni bdag skyob pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The love of the sravakas is for the protection of the self.

original: de dag gi byams pa ni bdag 'khor ba las thar bar byed pa tsam las gzhan mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi byams pa ni bdag 'khor ba las thar bar byed pa tsam las gzhan mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The love of the sravakas does not do anything else but merely liberate the self from cyclic existence.🔽The great love of the bodhisattvas is for the protection of all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa chen po ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pas ni sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang ngan song gi sdug bsngal las 'byin par byed pa'i
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa chen po ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pas ni sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang ngan song gi sdug bsngal las 'byin par byed pa'i
translated: The love of the bodhisattvas liberates all sentient beings from the suffering of cyclic existence and the suffering of the miserable realms.🔽Venerable

original: phyir ro // btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byams pa ni chu bo las sgrol ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyir ro // btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byams pa ni chu bo las sgrol ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Śāriputra, love is the ferry to the other shore.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa ni zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa ni zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The love of the bodhisattvas is the ferry to the other shore of the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa ni sems can thams cad chu bo bzhi las bsgral nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su 'jog par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa ni sems can thams cad chu bo bzhi las bsgral nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su 'jog par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: The love of the bodhisattvas is the one that delivers all sentient beings from the four rivers and establishes them in the state of nirvana.

original: khyad par bshad zin to /
analyzed: khyad par bshad zin to /
translated: The distinctions have already been explained.

original: // / rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the divisions,

original: 'di ltar btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Thus, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,” and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa phye na rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa phye na rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the bodhisattvas’ love is divided, it becomes threefold.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa gang gis dmigs pa'i yul gang la dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir de la sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa gang gis dmigs pa'i yul gang la dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir de la sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa ni /
translated: In order to teach the object of observation and the object of observation of the bodhisattvas’ love, it is said, “The love of the bodhisattvas that is focused on sentient beings

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is that of the bodhisattvas who have generated the first thought of awakening.”

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dang po so so'i skye bo'i dus na bla na med pa'i byang @176b chub tu sems bskyed pa yan chad mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dang po so so'i skye bo'i dus na bla na med pa'i byang @176b chub tu sems bskyed pa yan chad mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The bodhisattva who has first generated the thought is one who, in the period of ordinary people, has generated the thought for unsurpassed enlightenment, and who is on the stage of action in faith.

original: de'i tshe na sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'god par bya'o zhes sems can gyi dngos po yod par lta ba'i phyir sems can la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'god par bya'o zhes sems can gyi dngos po yod par lta ba'i phyir sems can la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, it is called “having sentient beings as its object” because one views the entity of sentient beings, thinking, “I will establish all sentient beings in unsurpassed enlightenment.”

original: chos la dmigs pa'i byams pa ni spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa'i byams pa ni spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: Love having the Dharma as its object is for the bodhisattvas who have entered into action.

original: sa dang po yan chad sa bdun pa man chad ni spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po yan chad sa bdun pa man chad ni spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have entered into action are those on the first stage and above, up to the seventh stage.

original: de'i tshes dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad sbyong zhing spyod pas spyod pa la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshes dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad sbyong zhing spyod pas spyod pa la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they practice all the dharmas of the perfections, the elements leading to enlightenment, etc., on those levels, they are called “those who have entered the practice.”

original: de dag gi byams pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag la dmigs pa'i phyir chos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi byams pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag la dmigs pa'i phyir chos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Their love is for the dharmas of the elements leading to enlightenment, and so is called “love with an objective reference.”

original: dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The love without an objective reference is that of the Bodhisattvas who have attained the acquiescence in the non-production of things.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ni sa brgyad pa yan chad la bya ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ni sa brgyad pa yan chad la bya ste /
translated: The acquiescence in the non-production of things is to be understood as beginning with the eighth stage.

original: de dag gi mtshan ma med pa la lhun gyis grub par 'jug pas de dag gi byams pa ni gong du smos pa'i sems can dang chos gnyi ga yang don dam par ma byung ma skyes par rtogs pas de dag la mi dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan ma med pa la lhun gyis grub par 'jug pas de dag gi byams pa ni gong du smos pa'i sems can dang chos gnyi ga yang don dam par ma byung ma skyes par rtogs pas de dag la mi dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med
translated: Since they have entered spontaneously into the signless, their love is called “without an objective reference,” because they do not objectify either sentient beings or dharmas, as previously mentioned, since they have realized that ultimately they are not produced and do not arise.

original: pa'o // gal te de ltar gnyi gar mi dmigs na ji ltar byams par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: pa'o // gal te de ltar gnyi gar mi dmigs na ji ltar byams par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one does not apprehend either of them in that way, how can there be love?

original: don dam par de ltar mi dmigs kyang kun rdzob tu sems can lam dmigs par 'dra bar snang bas byams pa zhes btags pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: don dam par de ltar mi dmigs kyang kun rdzob tu sems can lam dmigs par 'dra bar snang bas byams pa zhes btags pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: Although one does not apprehend them ultimately in that way, there is no fault in designating love conventionally, since sentient beings appear to be similar in being apprehended on the path.

original: byams pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: byams pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The inexhaustibility of love has been explained.

original: // / sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: // / sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the bodhisattva who is tormented by suffering,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Blessed One said, “Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,” and so on.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: That should be understood in four ways.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur ba dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur ba dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las so //
translated: The supreme of all the Buddha’s teachings, the etymological definition, the cause, the nature, and the activity.

original: de la btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Here, beginning with “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,”

original: sems can thams cad la snying thag pa nas sdug par 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba yan chad kyis chos thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur ba bstan to //🔽btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu snying rje chen @177a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snying thag pa nas sdug par 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba yan chad kyis chos thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur ba bstan to // btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu snying rje chen @177a * //
translated: The passage beginning with He is one who, from the very depths of his heart, holds all sentient beings dear and ending with He is one who is intent on the welfare of all sentient beings teaches the supremacy of the Dharma.

original: po zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: po zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The passage beginning with Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called 'great compassion' and ending with He is one who is intent on the welfare of all sentient beings teaches the etymology.

original: gzhan gyi skabs mi rnyed bas na snying rje chen po zhes bya ba yan chad kyis nges pa'i tshig bstan to //🔽g-yo med pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi skabs mi rnyed bas na snying rje chen po zhes bya ba yan chad kyis nges pa'i tshig bstan to // g-yo med pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The passage beginning with Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called 'great compassion' and ending with He is one who is intent on the welfare of all sentient beings teaches the etymology.🔽The passage beginning with He is one who is free from deceit and ending with He is one who is intent on the welfare of all sentient beings teaches the cause and nature.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams la blta'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu dang rang bzhin bstan to /🔽btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams la blta'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu dang rang bzhin bstan to / btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The passage beginning with He is one who is free from deceit and ending with He is one who is intent on the welfare of all sentient beings teaches the cause and nature.🔽The passage beginning with Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called 'great compassion' and ending with He is one who is intent on the welfare of all sentient beings teaches the activity.

original: so sor nye bar gnas pa las byung bas na de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya ba yan chad kyis las bstan to //
analyzed: so sor nye bar gnas pa las byung bas na de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya ba yan chad kyis las bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning with Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called 'great compassion' and ending with He is one who is intent on the welfare of all sentient beings teaches the activity.

original: byams pa dang snying rje gnyis la tha dad par bya ba ci yod ce na ;
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje gnyis la tha dad par bya ba ci yod ce na ;
translated: What is the difference between the two, love and compassion?

original: byams pa ni sems can bde ba la bkod pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa ni sems can bde ba la bkod pa'o //
translated: Love is the desire that beings come to have happiness.

original: snying rje ni sems can gyi sdug bsngal sel ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje ni sems can gyi sdug bsngal sel ba ste /
translated: Compassion is the desire that beings be freed from suffering.

original: de bas na mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, a scripture says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang ldan pa ni gzhan sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang ldan pa ni gzhan sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The bodhisattva who has compassion suffers when others suffer.”🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni mi zad pa yin pa'i rgyu 'dri ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni mi zad pa yin pa'i rgyu 'dri ba'i tshig ste /
translated: This is a question about the cause of inexhaustibility.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje ci'i phyir mi zad pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje ci'i phyir mi zad pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the reason that the bodhisattva’s compassion is inexhaustible?

original: lan du sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lan du sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The answer is, “Because it is the antecedent.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos byed do cog thams cad byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi don sgrub pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos byed do cog thams cad byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi don sgrub pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that all the practices of the bodhisattvas are for the sake of accomplishing the aims of others.

original: mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams 'khor ba'i dgon pa na 'khyams pa rnams la thugs brtse ste /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams 'khor ba'i dgon pa na 'khyams pa rnams la thugs brtse ste /
translated: He has compassion for the infinite sentient beings who wander in the wilderness of cyclic existence.

original: de dag bsgral ba'i phyir sangs rgyas su bsgrubs pas de dag gi rgyu snying rje chen po yin pa'i phyir sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag bsgral ba'i phyir sangs rgyas su bsgrubs pas de dag gi rgyu snying rje chen po yin pa'i phyir sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Since he practices for the sake of their liberation, his cause is great compassion. Therefore, it is called the “preliminary.”

original: de bas na 'bras bu mi zad pas rgyu yang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu mi zad pas rgyu yang mi zad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since the result is inexhaustible, the cause is also inexhaustible.

original: gnyis su na byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: gnyis su na byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan no //
translated: In another way, it is the quality of the bodhisattva.

original: tshogs kyi nang na snying rje gtso bo yin pas thog mar 'gro ba'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang na snying rje gtso bo yin pas thog mar 'gro ba'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Since compassion is the chief of the collections, it is called the “leader.”

original: srog gi dbang po la sogs pa'i dpes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po la sogs pa'i dpes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the example of the faculty of life, and so on.

original: chos thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa bshad zin to /
translated: The supreme of all dharmas has been explained.

original: // / nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the verbal root,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu snying rje chen po zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu snying rje chen po zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, great compassion is called . . .” and so on.

original: bdag nyid kyis bya bas na de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bya bas na de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called great compassion because it is one's own activity.

original: snying rje de'i tshig gi don ni bya ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar 'gro bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bdag nyid kyi bya ba yin @177b pas nges pa'i tshig tu na de'i phyir snying rje zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje de'i tshig gi don ni bya ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar 'gro bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bdag nyid kyi bya ba yin @177b pas nges pa'i tshig tu na de'i phyir snying rje zhes bya'o //
translated: The verbal root of compassion is kr, which means to act. Since all roots of virtue are one's own activity, it is called compassion because of its verbal root.

original: rang gi bya bas na zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don kyang rang nyid kyi bya bas na de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //🔽gzhan gyi skabs mi rnyed pas na zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang las su bya ba thams cad gzhan gyis bya zhing gzhan la bcol te byed du gzhug pa med pas gzhan gyi skabs mi rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi bya bas na zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don kyang rang nyid kyi bya bas na de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o // gzhan gyi skabs mi rnyed pas na zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang las su bya ba thams cad gzhan gyis bya zhing gzhan la bcol te byed du gzhug pa med pas gzhan gyi skabs mi rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called great compassion because it is one's own activity.🔽It is called great compassion because it does not allow an opportunity for others.

original: de bas na snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: de bas na snying rje chen po'o //
translated: Since all virtue and activity is one's own activity, it is called great compassion because it does not allow an opportunity for others.

original: nges pa'i tshig bshad zin to /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of the verbal root is complete.

original: // / rgyu dang rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / rgyu dang rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To indicate its cause and nature, it is said:

original: g-yo ba med pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It arises from the absence of deceit, and so on.

original: tshig snga ma snga ma ni rgyu'o ;
analyzed: tshig snga ma snga ma ni rgyu'o ;
translated: The earlier terms are the causes,

original: / phyi ma phyi ma ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: / phyi ma phyi ma ni rang bzhin no //
translated: and the later ones are the natures.

original: de la sems can rnams la brid cing slu bar sems pa'am /
analyzed: de la sems can rnams la brid cing slu bar sems pa'am /
translated: Therein, deceit is the intention to deceive and mislead sentient beings.

original: bya ba thams cad la snying thag pa nas byed pa ma yin gyi ngan don tsam gsog snying po med par byed pa ni g-yo ste /
analyzed: bya ba thams cad la snying thag pa nas byed pa ma yin gyi ngan don tsam gsog snying po med par byed pa ni g-yo ste /
translated: It is the lack of wholehearted engagement in all activities, the accumulation of worthless things, and the lack of a meaningful essence.

original: de lta bu med pa'i rgyu las snying rje chen po byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bsam pa thag pa nas bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu med pa'i rgyu las snying rje chen po byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bsam pa thag pa nas bya ba ste /
translated: Since great compassion arises from the absence of such deceit, great compassion is the wholehearted engagement in activities.

original: snying rje dang ldan pa la sems can brid cing slu ba med la /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa la sems can brid cing slu ba med la /
translated: Those who have compassion do not deceive and mislead sentient beings.

original: bya ba thams cad snying por gyur pa sha stag byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad snying por gyur pa sha stag byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They engage in all activities with a meaningful essence.

original: rgyu med pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: It arises from the absence of causes, and so on.

original: rgyu ni tshig tu smras kyang don du mi sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu ni tshig tu smras kyang don du mi sgrub pa ste /
translated: A cause is the verbal expression of something that is not actually being done.

original: de lta bu med pa'i sems las byung bas na /
analyzed: de lta bu med pa'i sems las byung bas na /
translated: Since it arises from the absence of such a mind,

original: snying rje chen po ni sbyor ba bya ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni sbyor ba bya ba ste /
translated: Great compassion is the performance of application.

original: thams cad sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It has the meaning of “the performer of all.”

original: phyir mi ldog pa las byung gsan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa las byung gsan zhes bya ba la /
translated: It arises from the stage of nonretrogression.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la slar nur ba med pa'i sems kyi rgyu las byung bas na ;
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la slar nur ba med pa'i sems kyi rgyu las byung bas na ;
translated: It arises from the cause of the mind that does not retreat from the accomplishment of unexcelled enlightenment and from the performance of the aims of sentient beings.

original: snying rje chen po ni lhag pa'i bsam pas bya ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni lhag pa'i bsam pas bya ba ste /
translated: Great compassion is the performance of superior intention.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the performance of those who have superior intention. This is the meaning.

original: ma bcos pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rang bzhin gzhan du gnas la gzhan du bstan pa ni bcos pa ste ;
analyzed: ma bcos pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rang bzhin gzhan du gnas la gzhan du bstan pa ni bcos pa ste ;
translated: It arises from the uncontrived. The body, speech, and mind are of the nature of contrivance, since they are presented as other than what they are.

original: de lta bu med par rang bzhin ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du ston pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyis rig pa ste bdag gis rang bzhin ji lta ba nyid las gzhan du ston par mi byed ces bya ba'i don to
analyzed: de lta bu med par rang bzhin ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du ston pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyis rig pa ste bdag gis rang bzhin ji lta ba nyid las gzhan du ston par mi byed ces bya ba'i don to
translated: Since it arises from the cause of teaching just as it abides by nature, it is the nature of great compassion, i.e., the knowledge that the self does not teach anything other than just the nature as it is.

original: // lam drang po las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad @178a * //
analyzed: // lam drang po las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad @178a * //
translated: Since it arises from the path of directness, it is the nature of great compassion, i.e., the purity that is the cause of the noble eightfold path, which leads to nirvana, having abandoned all the bad paths of the views of permanence and annihilation, existence and nonexistence.🔽It is the purity that is the nature of great compassion, i.e., the knowledge that the self does not teach anything other than just the nature as it is.

original: par lta ba dang / yod pa dang med par lta ba'i lam ngan pa'i de ma thams cad spangs pa mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar byed pa /
analyzed: par lta ba dang / yod pa dang med par lta ba'i lam ngan pa'i de ma thams cad spangs pa mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar byed pa /
translated: Since it arises from the cause of the noble eightfold path, it is the nature of great compassion, i.e., the purity that is the cause of the noble eightfold path, which leads to nirvana, having abandoned all the bad paths of the views of permanence and annihilation, existence and nonexistence.🔽It is the purity that is the nature of great compassion, i.e., the knowledge that the self does not teach anything other than just the nature as it is.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: Since it arises from the path of directness, it is the nature of great compassion, i.e., the purity that is the cause of the noble eightfold path, which leads to nirvana, having abandoned all the bad paths of the views of permanence and annihilation, existence and nonexistence.🔽It is the purity that is the nature of great compassion, i.e., the knowledge that the self does not teach anything other than just the nature as it is.

original: lam ngan pa'i skyon dang ma 'dres zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lam ngan pa'i skyon dang ma 'dres zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it arises from the path of directness, it is the nature of great compassion, i.e., the purity that is the cause of the noble eightfold path, which leads to nirvana, having abandoned all the bad paths of the views of permanence and annihilation, existence and nonexistence.🔽It is the purity that is the nature of great compassion, i.e., the knowledge that the self does not teach anything other than just the nature as it is.🔽Since it arises from the path of directness, it is the nature of great compassion, i.e., the purity that is the cause of the noble eightfold path, which leads to nirvana, having abandoned all the bad paths of the views of permanence and annihilation, existence and nonexistence.

original: gsal ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsal ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the purity that is the nature of great compassion, i.e., the knowledge that the self does

original: smras pa'i don rlung bskur te gsal bar mi ston pa ni gya gyur zhes bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa'i don rlung bskur te gsal bar mi ston pa ni gya gyur zhes bya ste /
translated: The meaning of crooked is that it does not clearly reveal the meaning of what is said.

original: de lta bu med pa'i mtshan nyid gsal ba'i rgyu las 'byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems gya gyu med pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu med pa'i mtshan nyid gsal ba'i rgyu las 'byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems gya gyu med pa'o //
translated: Since it arises from the cause of clarity, which is the opposite of that, great compassion is said to be non-crooked.

original: sems can thams cad la 'dud pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni snying rje can de 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sems can dang / sems can btsun pa dang / mi btsun pa thams cad la rtag tu phyag 'tshal bar byed pas snying rje chen po ni nga rgyal med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la 'dud pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni snying rje can de 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sems can dang / sems can btsun pa dang / mi btsun pa thams cad la rtag tu phyag 'tshal bar byed pas snying rje chen po ni nga rgyal med pa'o //
translated: The meaning of arising from bowing to all sentient beings is that the compassionate one always bows to all sentient beings, both noble and not noble, and to all sentient beings, both venerable and not venerable. Thus, great compassion is said to be without pride.

original: sems can tshad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams ni tshad med de /
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams ni tshad med de /
translated: The meaning of because sentient beings are immeasurable is that the realm of sentient beings is immeasurable.

original: 'di tsam zhes gcad par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di tsam zhes gcad par mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be delimited as this much.

original: de ltar sems can tshad med pa la snying rje chen pos dmigs nas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pas na /
analyzed: de ltar sems can tshad med pa la snying rje chen pos dmigs nas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pas na /
translated: Thus, great compassion observes immeasurable sentient beings and attains the unsurpassed fruit of enlightenment. Therefore, great compassion is said to be immeasurable.

original: snying rje chen po ni tshad med pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni tshad med pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Great compassion arises from the immeasurables.🔽It arises from the attainment of the body of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'thob pa las byung bas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa 'di la ma chags par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum thob par bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'thob pa las byung bas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa 'di la ma chags par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum thob par bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni
translated: It arises from the cause of the objective, “I will attain the three bodies of the Tathagata without attachment to this body of mine, which is produced by karma and the passions.”

original: bdag gi lus la mi lta ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la mi lta ba ste /
translated: Great compassion is the disregard for one’s body.

original: don chen po'i phyir bdag gi lus la gces par mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: don chen po'i phyir bdag gi lus la gces par mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the non-cherishing of one’s body for the sake of the great goal.🔽It arises from the avoidance of all evil.🔽It arises from the cause of the objective, “I will not commit any evil, even for the sake of my life, such as taking life, taking what was not given, and so on.”

original: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don du srog gi phyir yang srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni snying rje chen po ni srog la yid mi rton pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don du srog gi phyir yang srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni snying rje chen po ni srog la yid mi rton pa ste /
translated: Great compassion is the non-reliance on life.

original: srog gi phyir sdig pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: srog gi phyir sdig pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is the non-performance of evil even for the sake of life.

original: byang chub kyi sems las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad mi dge ba'i gnas nas spyod de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad mi dge ba'i gnas nas spyod de /
translated: Since it arises from the thought of awakening, means that having removed all sentient beings from nonvirtuous states,🔽having established them in virtuous states, and having liberated them in unsurpassed awakening, the thought of awakening is the cause of great compassion.

original: dge ba'i gnas su bkod nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral lo zhes sems bskyed pa'i byang chub kyis sems kyi rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni pha @178b rol srung ba ste /
