analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su bkod nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral lo zhes sems bskyed pa'i byang chub kyis sems kyi rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni pha @178b rol srung ba ste /
translated: Great compassion is the protector of others,

original: sems can thams cad mi dge ba'i gnas su mi gtong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mi dge ba'i gnas su mi gtong bar byed pa'o //
translated: since it prevents all sentient beings from falling into nonvirtuous states.

original: rang gi sems yongs su dag pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi sems yongs su dag pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since it arises from the purity of one's own mind, means that

original: gzhan gyi srog la mi gnod pa dang / longs spyod la sogs pa la mi gnod pa'i sems ni sems yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi srog la mi gnod pa dang / longs spyod la sogs pa la mi gnod pa'i sems ni sems yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: the purity of mind is the mind that does not harm the life of another, nor harm the enjoyments of another, and so on.

original: de ltar yongs su dag pa'i sems kyi rgyu las byung bas na /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su dag pa'i sems kyi rgyu las byung bas na /
translated: Since it arises from the cause of such a pure mind,

original: snying rje chen po ni sems can srung ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni sems can srung ba ste /
translated: great compassion is the protector of sentient beings,

original: sems can gyi srog dang / longs spyod gang la yang gnod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi srog dang / longs spyod gang la yang gnod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: since it does not harm the life of any sentient being, nor their enjoyments.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: It arises from the removal of the suffering of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal ni mdor na gsum ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal ni mdor na gsum ste /
translated: In brief, the suffering of all sentient beings is threefold:

original: longs spyod kyis phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bde 'gror skyes nas yang na ba dang tsha ba'i sdug bsngal dang / ngan song du skyes pa'i sdug bsngal dang / thar pa 'dod pas kyang de'i lam ston pa med pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: longs spyod kyis phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bde 'gror skyes nas yang na ba dang tsha ba'i sdug bsngal dang / ngan song du skyes pa'i sdug bsngal dang / thar pa 'dod pas kyang de'i lam ston pa med pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: the suffering of being deprived of possessions, the suffering of being born in a happy realm and then becoming ill or hot, the suffering of being born in a miserable realm, and the suffering of those who desire liberation but lack a teacher of the path.🔽Great compassion arises from the cause of objectifying the thought:

original: sdug bsngal de gsum bsal bar bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni dbul po la sogs pa la lta ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de gsum bsal bar bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni dbul po la sogs pa la lta ba ste /
translated: I will remove those three sufferings.

original: longs spyod kyis phongs pa'i sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o snyam pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
analyzed: longs spyod kyis phongs pa'i sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o snyam pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
translated: It arises from the cause of objectifying the thought: I will remove the suffering of being deprived of possessions.

original: dbul po la lta ba'o //
analyzed: dbul po la lta ba'o //
translated: It views the poor.

original: bde 'gror skyes nas yang na ba dang tsha ba'i sdug bsngal dang ; ngan song du skyes pa'i sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o snyam pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas sdug bsngal ba la lta ba'o //
analyzed: bde 'gror skyes nas yang na ba dang tsha ba'i sdug bsngal dang ; ngan song du skyes pa'i sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o snyam pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas sdug bsngal ba la lta ba'o //
translated: The view of suffering arises from the cause of the objective, thinking, Having been born in a happy realm, I will remove the suffering of sickness and heat, and having been born in an evil realm, I will remove the suffering.

original: thar pa 'dod kyang de'i lam ston pa med pa'i sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o snyam pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na mgon med pa la lta ba'o //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod kyang de'i lam ston pa med pa'i sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o snyam pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na mgon med pa la lta ba'o //
translated: The view of the helpless arises from the cause of the objective, thinking, Although I desire liberation, I will remove the suffering of not having a teacher of the path.🔽 The great vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The firm vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The great vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The firm vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.

original: blo mi 'gyur ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khas blangs shing dam bcas pa las 'gyur ba med ba'i sems las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni dam bcas pa brtan pa ste /🔽dam bcas pa las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o //🔽bdag dang sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: blo mi 'gyur ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khas blangs shing dam bcas pa las 'gyur ba med ba'i sems las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni dam bcas pa brtan pa ste / dam bcas pa las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o // bdag dang sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The great vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The firm vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The great vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The firm vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The great vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The firm vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The great vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The firm vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The great vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.🔽 The firm vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.

original: bdag ni dge ba byed pa'i gang zag gam /🔽tshul khrims blangs pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: bdag ni dge ba byed pa'i gang zag gam /🔽tshul khrims blangs pa'i gang zag go //
translated: The great vow arises from the cause of the mind, thinking, I will not turn back from the vow.

original: sangs rgyas ni ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha is the teacher, the Tathagata.

original: lha ni tshul khrims len pa'i tshe na dbang dang / srung mar gyur ba'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: lha ni tshul khrims len pa'i tshe na dbang dang / srung mar gyur ba'i lha rnams so //
translated: The gods are those who become the lords and guardians when one takes up morality.

original: tshul khrims nyams par byas sam sdig pa byas pa ni de gsum char @179a * //🔽bslus pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams par byas sam sdig pa byas pa ni de gsum char @179a * // bslus pa yin te /
translated: If one violates morality or commits evil deeds, one deceives all three.

original: snying rje ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa bdag dang sangs rgyas dang / lha gsum mi bslu ba'i rgyu las byung bas na bden pa la lta ste bden par byed pa'o //🔽legs par byas pa'i las las byung ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyis srog mi gcod /🔽ma byin par mi len /
analyzed: snying rje ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa bdag dang sangs rgyas dang / lha gsum mi bslu ba'i rgyu las byung bas na bden pa la lta ste bden par byed pa'o // legs par byas pa'i las las byung ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyis srog mi gcod / ma byin par mi len /
translated: Compassion is the truth, i.e., the truth-maker, because it arises from the cause of not deceiving the three, oneself, the Buddha, and the gods, which is the purity of morality.

original: 'dod pas log par mi g-yem pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu'i las las byung bas na /🔽snying rje chen po ni spyod pa dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pas log par mi g-yem pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu'i las las byung bas na / snying rje chen po ni spyod pa dag pa ste /
translated: It arises from good karma, i.e., it arises from the ten kinds of good karma, such as not taking life, not taking what is not given, and not committing sexual misconduct.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa la skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa la skyon med pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is pure conduct, i.e., it is the faultlessness of bodily, vocal, and mental conduct.

original: pha rol bde pa rab tu sbyin pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gi bde ba dang longs spyod thams cad kyang sems can gzhan la gtong ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bdag gi bde
analyzed: pha rol bde pa rab tu sbyin pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gi bde ba dang longs spyod thams cad kyang sems can gzhan la gtong ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bdag gi bde
translated: The phrase arising from the bestowal of happiness upon others means that great compassion is the relinquishing of one's own happiness and possessions, because it arises from the perfection of generosity, which consists of giving all of one's own happiness and possessions to other sentient beings.

original: ba gtong ba ste /
analyzed: ba gtong ba ste /
translated: Great compassion is the relinquishing of one's own happiness, because it is the relinquishing of one's own happiness and possessions.

original: bdag bde ba la gnas par mi byed pa'o //🔽sred pa med pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan la mi bde bar gyur pa gzhan gyi lus dang longs spyod la chags pa med pa'i tshul khrims kyi rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni gzhan gyi bde ba bskyed pa
analyzed: bdag bde ba la gnas par mi byed pa'o // sred pa med pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan la mi bde bar gyur pa gzhan gyi lus dang longs spyod la chags pa med pa'i tshul khrims kyi rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni gzhan gyi bde ba bskyed pa
translated: It is the non-enjoyment of one's own happiness, because it is the non-enjoyment of one's own happiness and possessions. 🔽The phrase arising from the absence of craving means that great compassion is the bestowal of happiness upon others, because it arises from the perfection of morality, which consists of the absence of craving for the bodies and possessions of others that are not yours.

original: ste / gzhan gyi lus dang longs spyod 'phrog pa la sogs pa'i mi bde ba skyed par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: ste / gzhan gyi lus dang longs spyod 'phrog pa la sogs pa'i mi bde ba skyed par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the bestowal of happiness upon others, because it is the absence of the bestowal of unhappiness upon others, such as the taking of others' lives, the taking of others' possessions, and so on.

original: brtson 'grus brtan pa rtsom pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral ba'i brtson 'grus ldog pa med pa brtsams pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtan pa rtsom pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral ba'i brtson 'grus ldog pa med pa brtsams pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
translated: It arises from the cause of undertaking firm effort, because it is the cause of the irreversible effort to liberate all sentient beings in unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: snying rje chen po ni sems can thams cad kyi khur khyer ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni sems can thams cad kyi khur khyer ba ste /
translated: Great compassion is the burden-bearer of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las bsgral ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi khur len pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las bsgral ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi khur len pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of taking up the burden of the suffering of cyclic existence in order to liberate all sentient beings from suffering.

original: sems can mthu chung ba'i nyes pa dang du len pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni gdol ba dang / rigs ngan pa la sogs pa sems can kho re chung ba rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa'i nyes pa thams cad bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
analyzed: sems can mthu chung ba'i nyes pa dang du len pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni gdol ba dang / rigs ngan pa la sogs pa sems can kho re chung ba rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa'i nyes pa thams cad bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
translated: It arises from the cause of accepting the faults of weak sentient beings, because it is the cause of the perfection of patience in accepting all the faults of harm done by weak sentient beings such as untouchables, low caste people and so on.

original: snying rje chen po ni bla ma'i bzod pa yang dag par blangs pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni bla ma'i bzod pa yang dag par blangs pa ste /
translated: Great compassion is the correct acceptance of the guru's patience.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi bzod pa yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi bzod pa yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The patience of the noble beings, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, is what is meant by the expression “taking up of patience.”🔽It arises from the service rendered to the sick,

original: sems can na ba rnams la rim gro byed pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni @179b sems can 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i khams mi mnyam par gyur nas /
analyzed: sems can na ba rnams la rim gro byed pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni @179b sems can 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i khams mi mnyam par gyur nas /
translated: that is to say, it arises from the cause which is the service rendered to beings who, because of an imbalance of the four great elements,

original: nad du gyur ba rnams la sman dang yo byad kyis rim gro byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
analyzed: nad du gyur ba rnams la sman dang yo byad kyis rim gro byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
translated: have become ill, by means of medicine and other provisions.

original: snying rje chen po ni chags pa dang smad pa sel ba ste nad pa la sogs pa la grogs ma byas pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i skyon gyis ma gos shing gzhan gyis dpyas gdags pas smad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni chags pa dang smad pa sel ba ste nad pa la sogs pa la grogs ma byas pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i skyon gyis ma gos shing gzhan gyis dpyas gdags pas smad pa med pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the removal of attachment and contempt. It is not defiled by the fault of not helping the sick, etc., and it is not despised by others.

original: sems can dman pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po des theg pa chen po la sems can rnams smin par byed pa yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sems can dman pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po des theg pa chen po la sems can rnams smin par byed pa yang ma zad kyi /
translated: It arises from the maturation of inferior sentient beings, meaning that not only does that great compassion bring sentient beings to maturity in the Great Vehicle,

original: theg pa chung du la mos pa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
analyzed: theg pa chung du la mos pa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
translated: it also brings sentient beings who aspire to the Lesser Vehicle to maturity.

original: snying rje chen po ni chos kyi dbang phyug thob pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni chos kyi dbang phyug thob pa ste /
translated: It is the attainment of lordship over the Dharma,

original: theg pa gsum char la yang ci rigs par dbang sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum char la yang ci rigs par dbang sgyur ba'o //
translated: meaning that it is the mastery of all three vehicles.

original: pha rol gyi yon tan brjod pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha rol gyi yon tan brjod pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: It arises from the expression of others' good qualities, meaning that

original: bdag gi yon tan la ni ngo mtshar du mi 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: bdag gi yon tan la ni ngo mtshar du mi 'dzin gyi /
translated: one does not marvel at one's own good qualities,

original: sems can gzhan gyi yon tan la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pas rgyun du gzhan gyi yon tan la bsngags par byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi yon tan la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pas rgyun du gzhan gyi yon tan la bsngags par byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
translated: but marvels at the good qualities of other sentient beings.

original: snying rje chen po ni rang gi yon tan mi spyoms pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni rang gi yon tan mi spyoms pa ste /
translated: Great compassion is not advertising one's good qualities.

original: bdag gi yon tan gzhan la mi sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi yon tan gzhan la mi sgrogs pa'o //
translated: It is not proclaiming one's good qualities to others.

original: zag pa med pa'i bde ba 'dod pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir dka' bar spyad pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyang bzod pa'i rgyu las byung
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bde ba 'dod pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir dka' bar spyad pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyang bzod pa'i rgyu las byung
translated: It arises from the desire for undefiled bliss means that it arises from the cause of enduring the various sufferings of austerities in order to attain the supramundane bliss characterized by the abandonment of all afflictions.

original: bas na snying rje chen po ni dka' bar spyod pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad la ji mi snyam pa'o //
analyzed: bas na snying rje chen po ni dka' bar spyod pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad la ji mi snyam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, great compassion is the indifference to all the sufferings of austerities.

original: las legs par byas te mi 'gyod pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni las dge ba byas pa ste bu dang / chung ma dang / nor la sogs pa la chags pa'i rgyu las sdig pa byas pa'i 'gyod pa med pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sdug cing phongs pa'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba ste /
analyzed: las legs par byas te mi 'gyod pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni las dge ba byas pa ste bu dang / chung ma dang / nor la sogs pa la chags pa'i rgyu las sdig pa byas pa'i 'gyod pa med pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sdug cing phongs pa'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba ste /
translated: Great compassion is the giving of dear and valuable things.

original: phongs pa ni nor dang 'bru rnams so //
analyzed: phongs pa ni nor dang 'bru rnams so //
translated: Valuable things are wealth and grain.

original: sdug pa'i dngos po ni bu dang chung ma la sogs pa'o //🔽tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can tshul khrims nyams pa rnams tshe 'dir yang dge ba'i chos la mi gtong zhing tshe rabs @180a * //
analyzed: sdug pa'i dngos po ni bu dang chung ma la sogs pa'o // tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can tshul khrims nyams pa rnams tshe 'dir yang dge ba'i chos la mi gtong zhing tshe rabs @180a * //
translated: Dear things are children, wife, etc.🔽It arises from the cause of protecting beings with impaired morality from being lost to virtue in this life and from being reborn in miserable realms in other lives.

original: gzhan du yang ngan song du mi skye bar srung bar byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni tshul khrims legs par bsrung bas phyung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan du yang ngan song du mi skye bar srung bar byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni tshul khrims legs par bsrung bas phyung ba ste /
translated: Great compassion is the protection of morality.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims ma nyams par rgyus bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims ma nyams par rgyus bskyed pa'o //
translated: The morality of working for the welfare of living beings is the cause of its growth.

original: rdo rje'i lus 'thob pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje'i lus 'thob pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it arises from the attainment of the vajra-body, it is the great compassion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku phyi'i gnod pa rlung dang tsha ba la sogs pa dang mtshon cha la sogs pas kyang mi tshugs pa dang / nang gi gnod pa 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa dang / na ba dang tsha ba la sogs pas mi tshugs par byed pa'i sku de 'thob par bya ba'i phyir bdag gi lus nye bar len pa'i phung po rnag can 'di la gnod pa byas pa thams cad bzod pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku phyi'i gnod pa rlung dang tsha ba la sogs pa dang mtshon cha la sogs pas kyang mi tshugs pa dang / nang gi gnod pa 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa dang / na ba dang tsha ba la sogs pas mi tshugs par byed pa'i sku de 'thob par bya ba'i phyir bdag gi lus nye bar len pa'i phung po rnag can 'di la gnod pa byas pa thams cad bzod pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni
translated: In order to attain that body which is not harmed by external injuries such as wind, heat, etc., or by internal injuries such as passion, hatred, etc., or by sickness, pain, etc., one should practice patience with regard to all injuries to one's own body, this impure body of appropriated aggregates.

original: lus la gnod pa byas pa dang du len pa ste /
analyzed: lus la gnod pa byas pa dang du len pa ste /
translated: Great compassion is the acceptance of injuries to the body.

original: phyi dang nang gi gnod pa thams cad nyams su len pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi gnod pa thams cad nyams su len pa'o //
translated: It is the acceptance of all external and internal injuries.

original: lus dang srog la mi lta ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus dang srog la yang phangs par mi 'dzin par bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can bsdus nas yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po
analyzed: lus dang srog la mi lta ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus dang srog la yang phangs par mi 'dzin par bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can bsdus nas yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po
translated: It arises from the fact that he does not care about his own body and life, and that he matures beings by attracting them with the four social practices.

original: ni sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ni sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the means of maturing all beings.

original: de la lus ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: de la lus ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: Therein, the body is the five appropriative aggregates.

original: srog ni tshe ste srog gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: srog ni tshe ste srog gi dbang po'o //
translated: Life is the life faculty.

original: yan lag dang nying lag yongs su gtong ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag yongs su gtong ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: It arises from the fact that he gives away his major and minor body parts.

original: yan lag ni mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag ni mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa'o //
translated: The major parts are the head, legs, arms, etc.

original: nying lag ni kha dang mig dang mthe bo dang mdzub mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nying lag ni kha dang mig dang mthe bo dang mdzub mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The minor parts are the mouth, eyes, thumbs, index fingers, etc.

original: yan lag dang nying lag la phangs par mi 'dzin par sems can gzhan la gtong ba'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni mi lta ba ste /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag la phangs par mi 'dzin par sems can gzhan la gtong ba'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni mi lta ba ste /
translated: Great compassion is the means of maturing all beings, because it arises from the fact that he gives his major and minor body parts to other beings without caring about them.

original: yan lag dang nying lag la gces par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag la gces par mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is not cherishing the major and minor limbs.

original: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba mi 'dod pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni bdag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba ci bsags pa thams cad kyang sems can gyi don du yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba mi 'dod pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni bdag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba ci bsags pa thams cad kyang sems can gyi don du yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: It arises from the non-desire for one's own roots of virtue, because it is the cause of not accumulating roots of virtue for one's own sake.

original: bdag gi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs par mi byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can pha rol po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs par mi byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can pha rol po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the generation of roots of virtue in other sentient beings, because it is the cause of not accumulating roots of virtue for one's own sake.

original: phyir yang 'dod pa'i khams su dmigs pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi @180b khams kyi bsam gtan gyi bde ba yang bor nas sems can gyi don du 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bsam gtan🔽gyi ro mi myong ba ste /
analyzed: phyir yang 'dod pa'i khams su dmigs pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi @180b khams kyi bsam gtan gyi bde ba yang bor nas sems can gyi don du 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bsam gtan gyi ro mi myong ba ste /
translated: It arises from the object of desire, because it is the cause of being born in the desire realm again for the sake of sentient beings, after giving up the bliss of concentration in the form realm.🔽Great compassion is not savoring the taste of concentration.

original: bsam gtam gyi ro la ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtam gyi ro la ma chags pa'o //
translated: It is not being attached to the taste of concentration.

original: chags pa med pa'i ye shes snang ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i ye shes snang ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it arises from the illumination of non-attached intuition.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i ye shes gnyis su med pa des shes bya thams cad la shes pas khyab par byed pas na chags pa med pa'i ye shes snang ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i ye shes gnyis su med pa des shes bya thams cad la shes pas khyab par byed pas na chags pa med pa'i ye shes snang ba'o //
translated: The illumination of non-attached intuition is the intuition that is the elimination of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, and it is non-dual. Since it pervades all objects of knowledge by knowing them, it is the illumination of non-attached intuition.

original: ye shes de'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni kun nas snang ba ste /
analyzed: ye shes de'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni kun nas snang ba ste /
translated: Because it arises from the cause of that intuition, great compassion is the universal illumination,

original: shes bya kun la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya kun la dmigs pa'o //
translated: because it focuses on all objects of knowledge.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang tshogs kun la mi smod pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang tshogs kun la mi smod pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it arises from the non-repudiation of all roots of virtue and accumulations.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The roots of virtue are the mundane virtues that are contaminated.

original: tshogs ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams la bya ste /
translated: The accumulations are the accumulations of generosity and so forth, which are the means of purifying the three sectors.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They become the accumulations of merit and intuition.

original: tshogs de rnams la mi smod pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
analyzed: tshogs de rnams la mi smod pa'i rgyu las byung bas na /
translated: Because it arises from the cause of the non-repudiation of those accumulations,

original: snying rje chen po ni shes rab la mi ltos pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni shes rab la mi ltos pa ste /
translated: Great compassion is not dependent on wisdom.

original: shes rab la mi rten pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab la mi rten pa'o //
translated: It does not rely on wisdom.🔽It is universal because it arises from the vow to fulfill the aims of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rdzogs par bya ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dpag bsam gyi shing dang yid bzhin gyi nor bus sems can rnams kyi bsam pa rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang sems can thams cad
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rdzogs par bya ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dpag bsam gyi shing dang yid bzhin gyi nor bus sems can rnams kyi bsam pa rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang sems can thams cad
translated: Just as the wish-fulfilling tree and the wish-fulfilling gem fulfill the aims of sentient beings, so too I will fulfill the aims of all sentient beings.

original: kyi bsam pa rdzogs par bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni kun du bkye ba ste /
analyzed: kyi bsam pa rdzogs par bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni kun du bkye ba ste /
translated: Great compassion is universal, because it arises from the vow to fulfill the aims of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la khyab par dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la khyab par dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is universal, because it is focused on all sentient beings.🔽It is universal because it arises from not abandoning one’s former vow.

original: sngon gyi smon lam mi gtong ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshe sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa las bsgral nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du dgod par bya'o zhes smon
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam mi gtong ba las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshe sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa las bsgral nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du dgod par bya'o zhes smon
translated: At the very beginning, when one first generates the thought of enlightenment, one vows to liberate all sentient beings from the wilderness of cyclic existence and to lead them to the city of nirvana.

original: lam btab pa'i smon lam mngon par byang chub kyang mi 'dor bar byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: lam btab pa'i smon lam mngon par byang chub kyang mi 'dor bar byed pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar byed pa ste /
translated: Great compassion is the liberator of all sentient beings, because it arises from the cause of not abandoning the vow of the path of application and the vow of manifest enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the one who establishes all sentient beings in nirvana.

original: 'dus byas la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba las byung @181a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba las byung @181a * //
translated: Great compassion is not attached to the unconditioned, because it arises from the cause of the objective of bringing sentient beings to maturity in the conditioned.

original: bas na zhes bya ba la 'dus byas ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus la sogs pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: bas na zhes bya ba la 'dus byas ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus la sogs pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la bya ste /
translated: The conditioned refers to the dharmas that are the cause of non-abiding nirvana, such as generosity, morality, patience, and effort.

original: gnas de dag tu sems can yongs su smin par bya bar dmigs par bya ba'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni 'dus ma byas la mi reg pa ste zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni mi len pa'o //
analyzed: gnas de dag tu sems can yongs su smin par bya bar dmigs par bya ba'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni 'dus ma byas la mi reg pa ste zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni mi len pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is not attached to the unconditioned, i.e., it does not take up the one-sided peace of nirvana, because it arises from the cause of the objective of bringing sentient beings to maturity in those conditioned states.

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims la sems can rnams rab tu 'god pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims la sems can rnams rab tu 'god pa las byung bas na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since it arises from establishing sentient beings in the morality of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims ni sdig pa thams cad byed pa las log pa'i rang bzhin sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims ni sdig pa thams cad byed pa las log pa'i rang bzhin sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa /
translated: the morality of the buddhas has the nature of turning away from all evil and benefiting all sentient beings.

original: dngos po gang la yang mi chags mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang la yang mi chags mi gnas pa ste /
translated: It is not attached to or dwells on any entity.

original: tshul khrims de la sems can rnams 'god cing /
analyzed: tshul khrims de la sems can rnams 'god cing /
translated: It establishes sentient beings in that morality.

original: tshul khrims de sems can rnams kyis thob par bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams la lta ba ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims de sems can rnams kyis thob par bya'o zhes dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams la lta ba ste /
translated: Since it arises from the cause of the observation that “that morality should be attained by sentient beings,” great compassion views immoral sentient beings.

original: sems can 'chal ba'i tshul khrims can rnams srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can 'chal ba'i tshul khrims can rnams srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: It protects sentient beings with immoral conduct.

original: rgyu dang rang bzhin bshad zin to /
analyzed: rgyu dang rang bzhin bshad zin to /
translated: The cause and nature have been explained.

original: // / las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / las bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To present the function, the verse states:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'byung ba gang ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'byung ba gang ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, whatever is the bodhisattvas’ going forth, and so on, is stated.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Whatever is the bodhisattvas’ afflictions

original: khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba'i tshogs gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba'i tshogs gang yang rung ste /
translated: or the collection of going forth from the three realms,

original: de dag thams cad snying rje chen po las skye'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad snying rje chen po las skye'o //
translated: all of that arises from great compassion.

original: de ltar snying rjes skyed par byed pas na /
analyzed: de ltar snying rjes skyed par byed pas na /
translated: Thus, because it generates through compassion,

original: 'di ltar bya ba byed pa'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba byed pa'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: in this way, it is called “great compassion” because it is the performance of an action.

original: gang byed ce na /
analyzed: gang byed ce na /
translated: What does it do?

original: 'di ltar sbyin par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated: “Thus, it gives” and so on.

original: gzhan ni go sla bas ma bshad do //🔽gdon mi za bar byed ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla bas ma bshad do // gdon mi za bar byed ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'am /
translated: The others are easy to understand, so they are not explained.🔽“It must be done” means without error or

original: chud mi za bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chud mi za bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “it must be done without loss,” is the meaning.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ji snyed yod ces so sor nye bar gnas zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi las su bya ba dang / phan pa dang bde bar bya ba ci yod ces rtag tu rtog par byed pa gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ji snyed yod ces so sor nye bar gnas zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi las su bya ba dang / phan pa dang bde bar bya ba ci yod ces rtag tu rtog par byed pa gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As many activities as there are of all sentient beings, abiding individually means that the activities of all sentient beings, and whatever is to be done for their benefit and happiness, are always considered, the meaning of abiding.

original: snying rje mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: snying rje mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The inexhaustibility of compassion has been explained.

original: // / @181b bde ba la rjes su yi rang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / @181b bde ba la rjes su yi rang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach rejoicing,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba chen po yang mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba chen po yang mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the text says, Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the great joy of the bodhisattvas is also inexhaustible.

original: dga' ba mi zad pa yang dmigs pa'i yul chos dang / sems can mi zad pas de la dmigs par byed pa'i dga' ba yang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba mi zad pa yang dmigs pa'i yul chos dang / sems can mi zad pas de la dmigs par byed pa'i dga' ba yang mi zad pa ste /
translated: The inexhaustibility of joy is due to the inexhaustibility of the objective realms of phenomena and sentient beings, so the joy that focuses on them is also inexhaustible,

original: byams pa dang snying rje mi zad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje mi zad pa bzhin no //
translated: like the inexhaustibility of love and compassion.

original: chen po ni de dag gi dga' ba nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa las kyang khyad zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po ni de dag gi dga' ba nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa las kyang khyad zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great joy is because that joy is superior to the joy of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: dga' ba chen po gang yin pa dang / ji ltar mi zad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dga' ba chen po gang yin pa dang / ji ltar mi zad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate what that great joy is and how it is inexhaustible,🔽it says,

original: de la dga' ba chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dga' ba chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What is that great joy?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dran pa dang rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dran pa dang rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is the recollection and post-recollection of the qualities of the Buddha, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni lung gi chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang / rtogs pa'i chos 'phags pa'i lam mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni lung gi chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang / rtogs pa'i chos 'phags pa'i lam mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The qualities of the Buddha are the Dharma of scripture, which is the twelve branches of the scriptures, and the Dharma of realization, which is the noble path of nirvana.

original: de dag gi yon tan sems pa'i dus na ma brjed pa ni ran pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi yon tan sems pa'i dus na ma brjed pa ni ran pa'o //
translated: When one is reflecting on their qualities, the recollection is the non-forgetting of them.

original: bsgom pa'i dus na ma brjed pa ni rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i dus na ma brjed pa ni rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: When one is cultivating them, the post-recollection is the non-forgetting of them.

original: chos de yang dus gsum gyi dbye bas dga' ba rnams pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos de yang dus gsum gyi dbye bas dga' ba rnams pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that Dharma becomes three types of joy through the division into the three times.

original: 'das pa'i chos la dmigs nas dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos la dmigs nas dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i chos la dmigs nas dga' bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i chos la dmigs nas dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos la dmigs nas dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i chos la dmigs nas dga' bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: It is joy in regard to the Dharma of the past, joy in regard to the Dharma of the present, and joy in regard to the Dharma of the future.

original: de la 'das pa'i dus su lung dang rtogs pa'i chos rtogs pa rnams dran nas sems la spro ba skye ba ni dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i dus su lung dang rtogs pa'i chos rtogs pa rnams dran nas sems la spro ba skye ba ni dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, joy is the delight of the mind that comes from recollecting the Dharma of scripture and realization that was understood in the past.

original: da ltar gyi dus su lung dang rtogs pa'i chos rnams bdag gis rtogs par nus so snyam du sems la spro ba skye ba ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus su lung dang rtogs pa'i chos rnams bdag gis rtogs par nus so snyam du sems la spro ba skye ba ni mos pa'o //
translated: Interest is the delight of the mind that comes from thinking, “I am able to understand the Dharma of scripture and realization in the present.”

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su lung dang rtogs pa'i chos dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams thob par 'gyur ro snyam du sems la dga' zhing spro ba skye ba ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su lung dang rtogs pa'i chos dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams thob par 'gyur ro snyam du sems la dga' zhing spro ba skye ba ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Supreme joy is the delight and joy of the mind that comes from thinking, “In the future, I will attain the Dharma of scripture and realization, as well as the powers, the forms of fearlessness, and so on.”

original: sems ma gong zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu'i chos kyi yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir theg pa chung dur sems mi skye ba'am /
analyzed: sems ma gong zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu'i chos kyi yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir theg pa chung dur sems mi skye ba'am /
translated: The phrase one's mind does not turn away means that one does not turn one's mind to the Hinayana in order to attain the virtues of the Dharma of the Hearers.

original: bdag gis mi nus so snyam du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir ma gong ba'o /
analyzed: bdag gis mi nus so snyam du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir ma gong ba'o /
translated: Or, it means that one's mind does not turn away in discouragement, thinking I am incapable of that.

original: mi brdzi ba ni dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi dga' bas zil gyis mi non pa'o //🔽sred pa med pa ni sred pa @182a * //
analyzed: mi brdzi ba ni dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi dga' bas zil gyis mi non pa'o // sred pa med pa ni sred pa @182a * //
translated: One is unconquerable because one is not overcome by the lack of joy that is adverse to joy.🔽One is free of craving because one always abides in joy.

original: las mya ngan dang / mi dga' ba skye'i chags shing sred pa med pa dang mi dga' ba skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir rtag tu dga' ba nyid la gnas so //
analyzed: las mya ngan dang / mi dga' ba skye'i chags shing sred pa med pa dang mi dga' ba skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir rtag tu dga' ba nyid la gnas so //
translated: Since sorrow and lack of joy arise from craving, and one who is free of attachment and craving has no cause for sorrow and lack of joy, one is free of craving.

original: 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad gtong ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan la dga' ba'i dga' ba thams cad 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad gtong ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan la dga' ba'i dga' ba thams cad 'dor ba'o //
translated: One abandons all the joys of desire means that one abandons all the joys that are the pleasures of the objects of desire.

original: chos kyi dga' ba thams cad kyi rten dang zhes bya ba ni dga' ba mi zad pa nyid sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos thams cad spyad par dga' zhing spro ba'i gzhi dang rten yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ba thams cad kyi rten dang zhes bya ba ni dga' ba mi zad pa nyid sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos thams cad spyad par dga' zhing spro ba'i gzhi dang rten yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The basis of all delight in the Dharma means that it is the basis of inexhaustible delight, the basis of delight in practicing all the Dharmas of the stages and transcendent perfections.

original: sems mchog tu dga' ba dang zhes bya ba ni dga' ba chen po la gnas pa'i rgyus sems las su rung ba skye bas na sems mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems mchog tu dga' ba dang zhes bya ba ni dga' ba chen po la gnas pa'i rgyus sems las su rung ba skye bas na sems mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Supreme mental joy means that, on account of one's abiding in great delight, one's mind becomes fit and supple, so that one has supreme mental joy.

original: de nyid kyi rgyus lus las su rung ba skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyus lus las su rung ba skye ba'i phyir /
translated: And on account of that, one's body becomes fit and supple,

original: lus rab tu sim pa'o //
analyzed: lus rab tu sim pa'o //
translated: so that one has physical well-being.

original: sangs rgyas la dga' zhing yi rangs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la dga' zhing yi rangs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Delighting in and rejoicing in the buddhas🔽means🔽that one delights in the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas la mos pa ni sangs rgyas la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mos pa ni sangs rgyas la dga' ba'o //
translated: that is, one has faith in them.

original: dga' ba de nyid chu'i dba' bdo ba bzhin du shas cher gyur cing sems spro ba gong nas gong du 'phel bar gyur pa ni yi rangs pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba de nyid chu'i dba' bdo ba bzhin du shas cher gyur cing sems spro ba gong nas gong du 'phel bar gyur pa ni yi rangs pa'o //
translated: That delight itself, like the swelling of a wave, becomes greater and greater, and one's mind becomes more and more uplifted, so that one rejoices.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dga' zhing mos pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum thob par dga' zhing mos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dga' zhing mos pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum thob par dga' zhing mos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase delighting in and being devoted to the body of the Tathagata means delighting in and being devoted to attaining the three bodies of the Tathagata.

original: de bas na mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan tshol ba la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan tshol ba la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it means skilled in seeking the adornments of the major and minor marks.

original: de dag thob par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag thob par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means skilled in the means of attaining those.

original: dge ba'i chos mnyan pas mi skyo ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos mnyan pas mi skyo ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Not being discouraged by listening to virtuous dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis nyid thog mar yang dge bar du yang dge tha mar yang dge ba yin pas dge ba'i chos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis nyid thog mar yang dge bar du yang dge tha mar yang dge ba yin pas dge ba'i chos te /
translated: The twelve branches of the Tathagata's scriptures are virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end, and therefore are virtuous dharmas.

original: de mnyan pa la chog pa med cing mi skyo ba nyid dga' ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de mnyan pa la chog pa med cing mi skyo ba nyid dga' ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not being satisfied with listening to them and not being discouraged is what is meant by delight.

original: de kho na'i chos la rten pa'i nan tan dang zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings de kho na rtogs par bya ba'i phyir lam la sogs pa sgrub pa'i nan tan byed pa la sems spro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na'i chos la rten pa'i nan tan dang zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings de kho na rtogs par bya ba'i phyir lam la sogs pa sgrub pa'i nan tan byed pa la sems spro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Diligence in the Dharma of thatness means that one is enthusiastic about the path and so forth in order to realize the expanse of reality, thatness.🔽Joy is the joy that arises from faith in the Three Jewels and their qualities.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind that comes from unmistakenly understanding their qualities.

original: dkon mchog gsum dang de'i yon tan la dad pa'i sgo nas dga' ba skye ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum dang de'i yon tan la dad pa'i sgo nas dga' ba skye ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Supreme joy is the joy or satisfaction that comes from focusing on the expanse of reality.🔽Exuberance is the elation of mind that comes from the joy born of the special realization of the nature of phenomena and the understanding of that nature.🔽Exuberance is the elation of mind that comes from the joy born of the special realization of the nature of phenomena and the understanding of that nature.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind that comes from unmistakenly understanding their qualities.🔽Supreme joy is the joy or satisfaction that comes from focusing on the expanse of reality.🔽Exuberance is the elation of mind that comes from the joy born of the special realization of the nature of phenomena and the understanding of that nature.

original: de'i yon tan phyin ci ma log par khong du chud nas sems dang bar gyur pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yon tan phyin ci ma log par khong du chud nas sems dang bar gyur pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind that comes from unmistakenly understanding their qualities.🔽Supreme joy is the joy or satisfaction that comes from focusing on the expanse of reality.

original: chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i sgo nas dga' ba'am tshim par gyur @182b pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i sgo nas dga' ba'am tshim par gyur @182b pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Exuberance is the elation of mind that comes from the joy born of the special realization of the nature of phenomena and the understanding of that nature.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind that comes from unmistakenly understanding their qualities.🔽Supreme joy is the joy or satisfaction that comes from focusing on the expanse of reality.

original: bdag gi chos nyid rtogs shing chos nyid khong du chud pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i dga' bas sems gzengs mtho ba'am /
analyzed: bdag gi chos nyid rtogs shing chos nyid khong du chud pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i dga' bas sems gzengs mtho ba'am /
translated: Exuberance is the elation of mind that comes from the joy born of the special realization of the nature of phenomena and the understanding of that nature.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind that comes from unmistakenly understanding their qualities.

original: spro ba skyes pa ni rab tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: spro ba skyes pa ni rab tu dga' ba ste /
translated: Supreme joy is the joy or satisfaction that comes from focusing on the expanse of reality.🔽Exuberance is the elation of mind that comes from the joy born of the special realization of the nature of phenomena and the understanding of that nature.

original: rnam pa de bzhi lta bus chos la dga' ba ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de bzhi lta bus chos la dga' ba ni mos pa'o //
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind that comes from unmistakenly understanding their qualities.🔽Supreme joy is

original: khong khro ba med pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la zhe sdang med pa'i sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khong khro ba med pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la zhe sdang med pa'i sems zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase “a mind that is free of anger” means a mind that is free of hatred toward sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dga' bar dmigs pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dga' bar dmigs pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means a mind that is constantly and always focused on the joy of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol ba la shin tu 'dun pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa tshol zhing thob par bya ba la 'dun pa yang dga' ba yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol ba la shin tu 'dun pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa tshol zhing thob par bya ba la 'dun pa yang dga' ba yin la /
translated: The phrase “a delight in seeking the qualities of a buddha” and the rest indicate that delight is the aspiration to obtain the qualities of a buddha, such as the powers and the forms of fearlessness, by seeking them.

original: de ltar yon tan gyi chos sgrub pa'i chos la 'dun pa de mi 'dor ba yang dga' ba yin par ston to //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan gyi chos sgrub pa'i chos la 'dun pa de mi 'dor ba yang dga' ba yin par ston to //
translated: The phrase “and not abandoning that aspiration” shows that delight is the aspiration to attain the qualities that are spiritual virtues.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po la mos shing rnam par grol ba dang / nyi tshe ba'i theg pa las bsal te sems bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po la mos shing rnam par grol ba dang / nyi tshe ba'i theg pa las bsal te sems bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba /
translated: The phrase “a delight in the superior attitude that is directed toward the vast qualities of a buddha and that is accompanied by the superior attitude that is directed toward the complete liberation of all sentient beings” indicates that delight is the generation of the superior attitude that is directed toward the complete liberation of all sentient beings, which is accompanied by the superior attitude that is directed toward the vast qualities of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas theg pa chung du la sems mi skye bar theg pa chen po la sems skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas theg pa chung du la sems mi skye bar theg pa chen po la sems skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “the mind of the universal vehicle arises, not the mind of the lesser vehicle” is that, through faith in the qualities of the Buddha, the stages, and the perfections, the mind of the universal vehicle arises, not the mind of the lesser vehicle.

original: ser sna med pas ma zhum par sems bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba la /🔽ser sna'i dbang gis dngos po gtong bar mi nus pa'am /
analyzed: ser sna med pas ma zhum par sems bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba la / ser sna'i dbang gis dngos po gtong bar mi nus pa'am /
translated: “The mind of generosity arises, not the mind of stinginess” means that the mind of generosity arises through the absence of stinginess.🔽The mind of stinginess arises when, through the power of stinginess, one is unable to give up possessions,

original: cung zad gtong gi thams cad mi gtong ba ni zhum par sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: cung zad gtong gi thams cad mi gtong ba ni zhum par sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: or when one gives a little but not everything.

original: dga' ba dang ldan pa la ser sna med pas dngos po thams cad gtong ba'i phyir ma zhum par sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan pa la ser sna med pas dngos po thams cad gtong ba'i phyir ma zhum par sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The mind of generosity arises through the absence of stinginess, because one gives everything away, being filled with joy.

original: slong ba la sbyin pa byin nas zhes bya ba la de ltar ma zhum pa'i sems kyis slong ba po'i gang zag rnams la phyi dang nang gi dngos po'i sbyin pa byin nas bdag dang slong ba po dang / sbyin pa gsum char yang gtong ba'i rang bzhin du lta ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: slong ba la sbyin pa byin nas zhes bya ba la de ltar ma zhum pa'i sems kyis slong ba po'i gang zag rnams la phyi dang nang gi dngos po'i sbyin pa byin nas bdag dang slong ba po dang / sbyin pa gsum char yang gtong ba'i rang bzhin du lta ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyangs pa ste /
translated: one should view oneself, the beggars, and the gifts as being of the nature of giving.

original: de bas na sbyin pa la mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa la mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “supreme joy in giving.”

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la dad pa ni gang zag tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la sems dang ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la dad pa ni gang zag tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la sems dang ba'o //
translated: Faith in those who have morality is a clear mind toward those who have morality.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la rjes su 'dzin cing byams pa zhes bya ba la tshul khrims zhig pa'i gang zag rnams ni tshul khrims 'chal @183a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la rjes su 'dzin cing byams pa zhes bya ba la tshul khrims zhig pa'i gang zag rnams ni tshul khrims 'chal @183a * //
translated: Loving kindness toward those who violate morality is the non-abandonment of those who violate morality.

original: ba rnams so //
analyzed: ba rnams so //
translated: Those who have violated morality are those who violate morality.

original: de dag mi dge ba'i chos la phyis mi gtong ba ni rjes su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag mi dge ba'i chos la phyis mi gtong ba ni rjes su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The non-abandonment of those who violate morality is loving kindness.

original: dge ba'i gnas su bkod cing phan btags pa ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su bkod cing phan btags pa ni byams pa'o //
translated: The benefit and assistance that is the establishment in virtue is loving kindness.

original: rang gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to through the purity of one's own morality, etc.,

original: bdag gi tshul khrims legs par bsrungs bas tshul khrims kyi skyon med pa'i phyir de'i rgyus ngan song gsum du mi skye bas na ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa thams cad las shin tu 'da' bas dbugs 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi tshul khrims legs par bsrungs bas tshul khrims kyi skyon med pa'i phyir de'i rgyus ngan song gsum du mi skye bas na ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa thams cad las shin tu 'da' bas dbugs 'byin pa'o //
translated: since one's own morality is well guarded, there is no fault in morality. Because of that, one does not take rebirth in the three lower realms, and so one is relieved from all fear of the lower realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims la yongs su bsngo ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims la yongs su bsngo ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to dedication to the morality of the Tathagatas,

original: bdag gi tshul khrims yongs su dag par byed pas de yang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims thob par bya ba'i phyir sngo bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi tshul khrims yongs su dag par byed pas de yang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims thob par bya ba'i phyir sngo bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: since one purifies one's own morality, one dedicates it to the attainment of the morality of the Buddha. This is the meaning.

original: sdig pa'i chos kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bas na brtan pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bas na brtan pa'o //
translated: Since one does not come under the power of evil dharmas, one is firm.

original: dor rus dang rigs smos pa'i tshig smra ba ni nang du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dor rus dang rigs smos pa'i tshig smra ba ni nang du brjod pa'o //
translated: The words bones and family are internal expressions.

original: lkog nas smra ba ni ngan du smra ba ste /
analyzed: lkog nas smra ba ni ngan du smra ba ste /
translated: Speaking behind the back is speaking badly.

original: de dag smras kyang sems mi 'khrugs pa ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag smras kyang sems mi 'khrugs pa ni bzod pa'o //
translated: Even when they are spoken, the mind is not disturbed. This is patience.

original: lan du tshig ngan pa mi smra ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: lan du tshig ngan pa mi smra ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: Not speaking badly in return is gentleness.

original: bsam pa dag pa ni khe dang bkur sti la chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa ni khe dang bkur sti la chags pa med pa'o //
translated: Pure intention is not being attached to gain and honor.

original: sems la brlangs pa med pa ni sems can la brdeg pa dang gsad par bya ba'i bsam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sems la brlangs pa med pa ni sems can la brdeg pa dang gsad par bya ba'i bsam pa med pa'o //
translated: Lack of malice is the absence of the intention to beat and kill sentient beings.

original: gya gyu med pa ni sems can la gnod pa bya ba'i thabs mi tshol zhing phyi rol dga' bar 'dra bar ston kyang nang du mi dga' bar gnas pa'i sems med pa'o //
analyzed: gya gyu med pa ni sems can la gnod pa bya ba'i thabs mi tshol zhing phyi rol dga' bar 'dra bar ston kyang nang du mi dga' bar gnas pa'i sems med pa'o //
translated: Lack of deceit is not seeking the means to harm sentient beings, and the absence of the mind that, while outwardly displaying the appearance of delight, inwardly remains discontented.

original: thams cad la phan yon du blta ba ni sems can thams cad la phan par lta ba'am /
analyzed: thams cad la phan yon du blta ba ni sems can thams cad la phan par lta ba'am /
translated: Seeing all as beneficial is seeing all sentient beings as beneficial.

analyzed: yang na mthong ba dang thes pa la sogs pa'i chos kun kyang dge ba'i bsam pas phan yon du mthong gis /

original: 'khrug pa'i gnas su mi lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i gnas su mi lta ba ste /
translated: one does not see them as the basis of disturbance.

original: lhung bzed du chud zin pa rnams kyang thun mong du yongs su longs spyod par byed cing zas mi sri ba dang / tshul khrims mthun par zhugs pa dang / lta ba mthun par zhugs pa ste /🔽de yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: lhung bzed du chud zin pa rnams kyang thun mong du yongs su longs spyod par byed cing zas mi sri ba dang / tshul khrims mthun par zhugs pa dang / lta ba mthun par zhugs pa ste / de yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba /
translated: They are harmonious in their ethical discipline and harmonious in their views.

original: sdug par byed pa /
analyzed: sdug par byed pa /
translated: They are agreeable.🔽They are dear.🔽They are revered.🔽They are free of conflict.

analyzed: bla mar byed pa rtsod pa med par byed pa'i chos drug po de dag gi rjes su 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: They are engaged in these six qualities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ston pa ltar phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la ni lam ston pa mig sbyin par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ston pa ltar phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la ni lam ston pa mig sbyin par byed pa yin pas /
translated: They hold the bodhisattvas dear as if they were the Teacher himself means that the Blessed Buddha, the Teacher, is held dear because he is the one who teaches the path and bestows the eye of Dharma.

analyzed: phangs pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang gces par 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The bodhisattvas are also held dear in the same way.

original: chos rnams bdag bzhin du phangs par su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos rnams bdag bzhin du phangs par su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They hold the Dharma dear as if it were their own self means that

original: bdag la bdag phangs pa bzhin gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la yang phangs par 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag la bdag phangs pa bzhin gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la yang phangs par 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as one cherishes oneself, one should cherish the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la srog bzhin du phangs par 'dzin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la srog bzhin du phangs par 'dzin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should cherish the Tathagatas as one cherishes one's life.

original: ji ltar srog ni lus gnas pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin pas gces pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar srog ni lus gnas pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin pas gces pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as life is the principal cause of the body's existence and is thus cherished,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang gces su 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang gces su 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: so one should cherish the Tathagatas.🔽One should cherish the gurus as one cherishes one's parents.

original: / bla ma rnams la pha ma bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag pas na rgan zhing yon tan dang ldan pa'i gang zag ni bla ma ste /🔽ji ltar pha ma ni 'dzam bu'i gling ston pa bskyed pa /

translated: Gurus are those who are older than oneself and who possess good qualities.🔽Just as one cherishes one's parents, who are the ones who give birth to and raise up the child who is shown the world,

original: gso bar byed pa yin pas gces pa yin pa de bzhin du de dag la yang gces su 'dzin pa'o//
analyzed: gso bar byed pa yin pas gces pa yin pa de bzhin du de dag la yang gces su 'dzin pa'o//
translated: so one should cherish the gurus.

original: sems can rnams la bu bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bu gcig pa gces shing phongs pas mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bde ba la 'jog pa bzhin du sems can rnams kyang mi bde bar mi 'gyur zhing bde ba la 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bu bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bu gcig pa gces shing phongs pas mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bde ba la 'jog pa bzhin du sems can rnams kyang mi bde bar mi 'gyur zhing bde ba la 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: The line they cherish sentient beings as if they were their only son means that just as a single child is cherished and not allowed to suffer or be unhappy, but is made happy, in the same way, sentient beings are not allowed to suffer, but are made happy.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon rnams la sangs rgyas bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sangs rgyas kyis 'jig rten du bden pa bzhi la sogs pa bshad nas /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon rnams la sangs rgyas bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sangs rgyas kyis 'jig rten du bden pa bzhi la sogs pa bshad nas /
translated: The line they cherish their preceptors and masters as if they were the Buddha means that just as the Buddha, having taught the four noble truths and so on in the world,

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnas thams cad las bton pa bzhin mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis kyang chos bstan pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal thams cad @184a * //🔽las 'don par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnas thams cad las bton pa bzhin mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis kyang chos bstan pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal thams cad @184a * //🔽las 'don par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: has delivered all beings from the domain of suffering, in the same way, preceptors and masters deliver all beings from suffering by teaching the Dharma.

original: nan tan rnams la yan lag gi dam pa mgo bo bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yan lag gi dam pa mgo yin pa bzhin nan tan gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa la'ang gces su 'dzin pa'o🔽// pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rkang lag bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rkang lag med na gang du yang mi phyin pas bgrod par bya ba'i gnas su 'dod ba rnams la rkang lag gces pa bzhin mya ngan las 'das par
analyzed: nan tan rnams la yan lag gi dam pa mgo bo bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yan lag gi dam pa mgo yin pa bzhin nan tan gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa la'ang gces su 'dzin pa'o // pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rkang lag bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rkang lag med na gang du yang mi phyin pas bgrod par bya ba'i gnas su 'dod ba rnams la rkang lag gces pa bzhin mya ngan las 'das par
translated: The line and hold as dear as your head your most important practices means that just as the head is the most important of all one's limbs, one should also hold as dear the things one practices with diligence, such as the noble path.

original: 'gro 'dod pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug med na mi phyin pas rkang lag dang 'dra bas gces su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro 'dod pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug med na mi phyin pas rkang lag dang 'dra bas gces su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The line and hold as dear as your hands and feet the transcendent perfections means that just as one would not go anywhere without hands and feet and so values one's hands and feet in one's desire to go to the places one wants to go, one should also value the six transcendent perfections, which are like hands and feet in that one cannot go to nirvana without them.

original: chos smra ba rnams la yang rin po che thams cad bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gser dang dngul la sogs pa rin po che sna tshogs pa phangs pa bzhin du chos smra ba rnams kyang chos rin po che ston pa'i phyir🔽phangs par 'dzin pa'o //🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yid bzhin gyi nor bus re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pas gces pa bzhin du stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas
analyzed: chos smra ba rnams la yang rin po che thams cad bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gser dang dngul la sogs pa rin po che sna tshogs pa phangs pa bzhin du chos smra ba rnams kyang chos rin po che ston pa'i phyir phangs par 'dzin pa'o // sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yid bzhin gyi nor bus re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pas gces pa bzhin du stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas
translated: just as they hold various jewels such as gold and silver dear.🔽They hold all the qualities of the Buddha as dear as a wish fulfilling gem,

original: kyi chos thams cad kyis kyang bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi chos thams cad kyis kyang bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the qualities of the Buddha such as the powers and the forms of fearlessness fulfill all wishes, just as a wish fulfilling gem fulfills all wishes.

original: rjes su bstan pa rnams la dga' ba'i rtsed mo bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i longs spyod can dag la dga' ba'i rtsed mo rol mo rnam pa sna tshogs gces pa bzhin du rnal 'byor pa nyon mongs pa 'dul ba
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa rnams la dga' ba'i rtsed mo bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i longs spyod can dag la dga' ba'i rtsed mo rol mo rnam pa sna tshogs gces pa bzhin du rnal 'byor pa nyon mongs pa 'dul ba
translated: They hold the instructions dear like a child,🔽they hold the antidotes to defilements dear like a game,🔽they hold contentment dear like health.🔽They hold the instructions dear like a child.🔽Just as those who enjoy sense objects hold dear the various games and amusements that give them pleasure, so yogis who are engaged in subduing defilements hold dear the instructions on the antidotes to defilements.🔽They use the antidotes to defilements such as meditation on the impurity of the body to get rid of defilements as they wish, without being overpowered by them.

original: la zhugs pa dag la yang nyon mongs pa gang gis rang dbang med par gyur pa de'i gnyen po mi gtsang ba la sogs pas ci dgar nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po rjes su bstan pa de dag la gces su 'dzin pa'o
analyzed: la zhugs pa dag la yang nyon mongs pa gang gis rang dbang med par gyur pa de'i gnyen po mi gtsang ba la sogs pas ci dgar nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po rjes su bstan pa de dag la gces su 'dzin pa'o
translated: They hold the antidotes to defilements dear like a game.🔽They hold contentment dear like health.

original: // chog shes pa rnams la nad med pa bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nad med pa gces pa ltar lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pas chog shes pa la yang gces su 'dzin te /
analyzed: // chog shes pa rnams la nad med pa bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nad med pa gces pa ltar lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pas chog shes pa la yang gces su 'dzin te /
translated: Just as those who are healthy hold their health dear, so they hold contentment with their alms, robes and so forth dear.

original: chog mi shes pa'i dbang gis ni tshol ba dang srung ba la sogs pa'i tshe lus dang sems la mi bde nga @184b thams cad skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chog mi shes pa'i dbang gis ni tshol ba dang srung ba la sogs pa'i tshe lus dang sems la mi bde nga @184b thams cad skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of discontent, all the miseries of body and mind arise in the course of seeking and guarding what has been sought.

original: chos btsal ba rnams la sman bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sman gyis nad sel ba bzhin chos btsal bas kyang nyon mongs pa'i nad sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos btsal ba rnams la sman bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sman gyis nad sel ba bzhin chos btsal bas kyang nyon mongs pa'i nad sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase they hold the search for Dharma as dear as medicine means that just as medicine cures illness, so the search for Dharma cures the illness of the mental addictions.

original: skul zhing dran pa rnams la sman pa bzhin du phongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sman pa nad med par gyur ba'i thabs dang / sman ston pa bzhin du skul zhing dran par byed pas kyang nyon mongs pa'i nad sel bas ston pas phangs pa'o //
analyzed: skul zhing dran pa rnams la sman pa bzhin du phongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sman pa nad med par gyur ba'i thabs dang / sman ston pa bzhin du skul zhing dran par byed pas kyang nyon mongs pa'i nad sel bas ston pas phangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase they hold the admonitions and reminders as dear as physicians means that just as physicians are the means of curing illness and prescribing medicine, so admonishers and reminders are dear because they cure the illness of the mental addictions.

original: dga' ba chen po rgya cher bshad pa'i don bsdu zhing de'i rang bzhin mdor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dga' ba chen po rgya cher bshad pa'i don bsdu zhing de'i rang bzhin mdor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the extensive explanation of great joy and to present its nature in brief, it is said:

original: gang dbang po thams cad la dbang po ma god pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dbang po thams cad la dbang po ma god pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The phrase whose faculties are intact and so on is stated.

original: dbang po thams cad dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams so //
translated: The faculties are the five faculties of faith and so on, and the faculties of the eyes and so on.

original: dbang po ma god pa ni dbang po de rnams ma nyams shing ma gong pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po ma god pa ni dbang po de rnams ma nyams shing ma gong pa ste /
translated: Intact means that those faculties are not impaired or deficient.

original: de ni dga' ba chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dga' ba chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called great joy.

original: rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi phyir zhi ba'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni dbang po ma zhi zhing chags par 'gyur pa'i rgyu'i chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma byung ma skyes par rtogs pas de la ma g-yengs pa'i phyir zhi ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi phyir zhi ba'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni dbang po ma zhi zhing chags par 'gyur pa'i rgyu'i chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma byung ma skyes par rtogs pas de la ma g-yengs pa'i phyir zhi ba'i rnam pa ste /
