translated: The phrase the aspect of peace because of the wisdom of realization means that because one realizes that the phenomena that are the causes of the faculties being disturbed and becoming attached do not arise or occur by nature, one is not distracted by them. Therefore, it is the aspect of peace.

original: zhi ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhi ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is the nature of peace.

original: mi rgod pa'i phyir rab tu zhi ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar rgod par bya ba'i yul med pas na rab tu zhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mi rgod pa'i phyir rab tu zhi ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar rgod par bya ba'i yul med pas na rab tu zhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The phrase the aspect of complete peace because of non-agitation means that because there are no objects of agitation as explained above, there is the aspect of complete peace.

original: khengs pa ma yin pa'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la /🔽nyon mongs pa rnams ma spangs pa ni khengs pa ste /
analyzed: khengs pa ma yin pa'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la / nyon mongs pa rnams ma spangs pa ni khengs pa ste /
translated: It is the aspect of complete serenity because it is not arrogant.🔽Arrogance is the non-abandonment of the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa ma yin pa ni khengs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa ma yin pa ni khengs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of arrogance is the non-abandonment of the defilements.

original: de bas na shin tu sbyangs pa'i rnam pa ste /🔽nyon mongs pa dag pa'i rnam pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na shin tu sbyangs pa'i rnam pa ste / nyon mongs pa dag pa'i rnam pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is the aspect of complete serenity.🔽The aspect of the purification of the defilements,

original: nyon mongs pa dul ba'i rnam pa zhes ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dul ba'i rnam pa zhes ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: or the aspect of the subduing of the defilements, is what is meant.

original: rnam par mi g-yengs pa'i phyir dbang po dga' ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni sems g-yengs pa las dbang po 'khrug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yengs pa'i phyir dbang po dga' ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni sems g-yengs pa las dbang po 'khrug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is the aspect of the delight of the faculties because it is non-distraction. The faculties are disturbed by a distracted mind,

original: sems yul la sogs pa la ma g-yeng ste /
analyzed: sems yul la sogs pa la ma g-yeng ste /
translated: but when the mind is not distracted by objects, etc.,

original: ting nge 'dzin du gyur pa las zhi zhing dga' bar 'gyur bas na dbang po dga' ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du gyur pa las zhi zhing dga' bar 'gyur bas na dbang po dga' ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: it becomes concentrated, and so there is the delight of the faculties.

original: mi nyams pa'i phyir brtul zhugs kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' brtul zhugs gang blangs pa de ma zhig ma nyams @185a * //
analyzed: mi nyams pa'i phyir brtul zhugs kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' brtul zhugs gang blangs pa de ma zhig ma nyams @185a * //
translated: Whatever spiritual discipline a bodhisattva undertakes, he or she does not violate it or allow it to degenerate.

original: rang bzhin gzhan du ma gyur pas na brtul zhugs kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du ma gyur pas na brtul zhugs kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Nor does he or she allow it to be changed into something else.🔽The aspect of certainty is for the purpose of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir nges pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang ldan pa de thams cad kyis yid du 'ong zhing 'dod pas 'gyur bas na des pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir nges pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang ldan pa de thams cad kyis yid du 'ong zhing 'dod pas 'gyur bas na des pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Since all of those who possess delight in it find it to be desirable and pleasing, it is the aspect of certainty.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is what is meant by the aspect of what is desirable.🔽The aspect of listening is for the purpose of being agreeable.

original: bka' blo bde ba'i phyir thos pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad bsgo ba bzhin nyan du btub pa ni bka' blo bde ba ste /
analyzed: bka' blo bde ba'i phyir thos pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad bsgo ba bzhin nyan du btub pa ni bka' blo bde ba ste /
translated: One who is agreeable is someone who is able to listen to instructions as they are given.

original: de bas na thos pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na thos pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the aspect of listening.

original: thos pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad bsgo ba bzhin du nyan du btub pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thos pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad bsgo ba bzhin du nyan du btub pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The aspect of listening is the quality of being able to listen to instructions as they are given.🔽The aspect of being a field of qualities is for the purpose of increasing the qualities.

original: sems las su rung ba'i phyir nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems las su rung ba'i phyir nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The aspect of pacification is due to the pliability of mind.

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa spangs pa ni sems las su rung ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa spangs pa ni sems las su rung ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of pliability of mind is due to the abandonment of depression and excitement.

original: de bas na nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the aspect of pacification.

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa med pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa med pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the nature of the absence of depression and excitement.🔽The aspect of delight is due to the proper performance of actions.

original: las legs par byas pa'i phyir dga' ba'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni las dge ba byas pa'i phyir rnam pa ste /
analyzed: las legs par byas pa'i phyir dga' ba'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni las dge ba byas pa'i phyir rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect is due to the performance of virtuous actions.

original: sems mi dga' ba med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sems mi dga' ba med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The meaning is: the aspect of the absence of mental dissatisfaction.🔽The aspect of non-remorse is due to the absence of reproach.

original: kha na mtho ba med pa'i phyir mi 'gyod pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa ma byas pa'i phyir mi 'gyod pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: kha na mtho ba med pa'i phyir mi 'gyod pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa ma byas pa'i phyir mi 'gyod pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of non-remorse is due to the non-performance of evil.

original: sdig pa'i rgyus ma 'ongs pa na 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes gdung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i rgyus ma 'ongs pa na 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes gdung ba med pa'o //
translated: The meaning is: the absence of distress thinking, “In the future, I will be like this due to the cause of evil.”

original: ma g-yos pa'i phyir shin tu gnas pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pas ma g-yos pa'i phyir shin tu gnas pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: ma g-yos pa'i phyir shin tu gnas pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pas ma g-yos pa'i phyir shin tu gnas pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of being very stable is because it is unshakable by counteragents, etc.

original: brten pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brten pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “being stable” is the same as “being unshakable.”🔽The aspect of being unshakable is because it does not dwell.

original: mi gnas pa'i phyir ma g-yos pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dang dngos po la mi gnas pas ma g-yos pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i phyir ma g-yos pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dang dngos po la mi gnas pas ma g-yos pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of being unshakable is because it does not dwell on signs and things.

original: mtshan ma rnams kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “being unshakable” is the same as “not coming under the influence of signs.”🔽The aspect of being difficult to approach is because it is difficult to subdue.

original: thul bar dka' bas bsnyen par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis thul bar dka' ba bsnyen dka' ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: thul bar dka' bas bsnyen par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis thul bar dka' ba bsnyen dka' ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of being difficult to approach is because it is difficult for demons and adversaries to subdue.

original: de dag gis zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gis zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “being difficult to approach” is the same as “not being overwhelmed by them.”

original: chud mi za ba'i phyir don gyi rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni don rtogs shing thob pa'i dngos po nyams par mi 'gyur bas na don gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: chud mi za ba'i phyir don gyi rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni don rtogs shing thob pa'i dngos po nyams par mi 'gyur bas na don gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of the object is due to the non-wastage of the object. The form of the object is due to the non-wastage of the object that is realized and attained.

original: ma nor bde bzhin nyid kyi phyir bden pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni @185b 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin dang mthun pa'i phyir bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ma nor bde bzhin nyid kyi phyir bden pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni @185b 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin dang mthun pa'i phyir bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of truth is due to the non-erroneous and suchness. The form of truth is due to the conformity with the four noble truths.

original: de byed pa'i phyir de kho na'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de byed pa'i phyir de kho na'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The form of reality is due to the performance of that.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de kho na nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de kho na nyid la bya ste /
translated: The word “that” refers to reality.

original: de kho na nyid sgrub pa'am rtogs par byed pa'i phyir de kho na'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid sgrub pa'am rtogs par byed pa'i phyir de kho na'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of reality is due to the performance of that, i.e. due to the realization of reality.

original: stobs kyi phyir spro ba'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stobs kyi phyir spro ba'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The form of enthusiasm is due to the strength.

original: spro ba nyid mthu dang ldan te mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis nyams par mi 'gyur ba la stobs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spro ba nyid mthu dang ldan te mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis nyams par mi 'gyur ba la stobs zhes bya ste /
translated: Enthusiasm itself is strength, i.e. the non-wastage due to the adverse elements.

original: de ltar stobs kyi phyir spro ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar stobs kyi phyir spro ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Thus, the form of enthusiasm is due to strength.

original: spro ba'i mthu dang ldan pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs kyi rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i stobs la sogs pa la /
analyzed: spro ba'i mthu dang ldan pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to // mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs kyi rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i stobs la sogs pa la /
translated: The meaning of the term “aspect of delight” is that it is endowed with the power of delight.🔽The “aspect of strength” is because it is not overwhelmed.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pas mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs kyi rnam pa'o //🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas /🔽stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par bya ba tshol bas mi skyo ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pas mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs kyi rnam pa'o // sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par bya ba tshol bas mi skyo ba'i phyir /
translated: The “aspect of strength” is because the strength of faith, etc. is not overwhelmed by lack of faith, etc.🔽The “aspect of perfecting all the qualities of a Buddha” is because one is not discouraged by seeking to perfect all the qualities of a Buddha, such as the strengths, fearlessnesses, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The “aspect of perfecting the qualities of a Buddha” is because one is not discouraged by seeking to perfect all the qualities of a Buddha, such as the strengths, fearlessnesses, etc.

original: dga' ba mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: dga' ba mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The inexhaustibility of delight has been explained.

original: // / mnyam pa nyid la gnas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / mnyam pa nyid la gnas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the state of equality,

original: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the line “Moreover, Venerable Subhūti, the inexhaustibility of equanimity” is stated, and so forth.

original: btang snyoms mi zad pa yang dga' ba mi zad pa la sogs pa bshad pa'i tshul dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms mi zad pa yang dga' ba mi zad pa la sogs pa bshad pa'i tshul dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The inexhaustibility of equanimity should be understood in the same way as the inexhaustibility of delight, etc. have been explained.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis kyi tshul du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis kyi tshul du shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood in two ways:

original: bstan pa'i tshul dang bshad pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshul dang bshad pa'i tshul lo //
translated: the method of teaching and the method of explanation.

original: de la bstan pa'i tshul ni /🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la bstan pa'i tshul ni / de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The method of teaching is

original: dus dang dus ma yin pa la btang snyoms zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan to //
analyzed: dus dang dus ma yin pa la btang snyoms zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan to //
translated: from “the three kinds of equanimity of the bodhisattvas” up to “equanimity with regard to time and season.”

original: de man lhag ma thams cad kyis bshad pa'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: de man lhag ma thams cad kyis bshad pa'i tshul bstan to //
translated: The method of explanation is taught by the rest of the text.

original: nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa ni chags par 'gyur ba dang / khro bar 'gyur ba'i yul gnyi ga la mtshungs par lta ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa ni chags par 'gyur ba dang / khro bar 'gyur ba'i yul gnyi ga la mtshungs par lta ba'o //
translated: Equanimity with regard to defilement is to regard both the object of attachment and the object of anger as the same.

original: bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba'i btang snyoms ni bdag gi sems kyi rgyud 'khrug cing gdung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud 'khrug par mi 'gyur bar btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba'i btang snyoms ni bdag gi sems kyi rgyud 'khrug cing gdung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud 'khrug par mi 'gyur bar btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: Equanimity with regard to protecting oneself and others is to be equanimous so that one’s own mental continuum is not disturbed or tormented, and so that the mental continuum of others is not disturbed.

original: @186a * // dus dang dus ma yin pa la btang snyoms pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dus dang snod du sbyar la /
analyzed: @186a * // dus dang dus ma yin pa la btang snyoms pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dus dang snod du sbyar la /
translated: Equanimity with regard to time and season means that the bodhisattva is in accord with the time and the vessel.

original: dus kha cig tu snod la la la chos mi bshad cing mi sgrub pa btang snyoms su 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: dus kha cig tu snod la la la chos mi bshad cing mi sgrub pa btang snyoms su 'dor ba'o //
translated: He is indifferent to the fact that he does not teach the Dharma to some vessels at some times, and does not practice it.

original: nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the characteristic of equanimity with regard to the afflictions, he says:

original: de la nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is equanimity with regard to the afflictions?

original: bsti stang du byas pas ma thos par sems pa dang / bsti stang du ma byas pas dmas par sems pa ni nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: bsti stang du byas pas ma thos par sems pa dang / bsti stang du ma byas pas dmas par sems pa ni nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The thought that one is not heard when one is honored, and the thought that one is despised when one is not honored, is an affliction.

original: bsti stang du byas kyang ma thos par mi sems la bsti stang du ma byas kyang dmas par mi sems pa ni nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa ste /
analyzed: bsti stang du byas kyang ma thos par mi sems la bsti stang du ma byas kyang dmas par mi sems pa ni nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa ste /
translated: The absence of the thought that one is not heard when one is honored, and the absence of the thought that one is despised when one is not honored, is equanimity with regard to the afflictions.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the rest.

original: rnyed pa rlom sems med ces bya ba ni chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa rnyed kyang rnyed do zhes rlom sems med pa'o ;
analyzed: rnyed pa rlom sems med ces bya ba ni chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa rnyed kyang rnyed do zhes rlom sems med pa'o ;
translated: “Not conceited about gain” means not conceited about robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, medicine for curing the sick, and other necessities.

original: / snyan pa ni bdag gi yon tan no //
analyzed: / snyan pa ni bdag gi yon tan no //
translated: “Fame” means praise of one’s good qualities.

original: mi snyan pa ni skyon brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mi snyan pa ni skyon brjod pa'o //
translated: “Disgrace” means blame for one’s faults.

original: bsngags pa la chos nyid rab tu gnas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsngags pa la chos nyid rab tu gnas zhes bya ba la /
translated: “In praise, he is well-established in reality” means

original: bsngags pa ni yon tan dngos su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bsngags pa ni yon tan dngos su brjod pa'o //
translated: that praise is the direct expression of good qualities.

original: chos nyid rab tu gnas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi 'gyur bar 'dug ces bya'o//
analyzed: chos nyid rab tu gnas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi 'gyur bar 'dug ces bya'o//
translated: “Well-established in reality” means that he is not changed by nature.

original: sdug bsngal dag la so sor rtog pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnams shes rab kyis dngos po med par rtogs pas de la ji mi snyam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dag la so sor rtog pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnams shes rab kyis dngos po med par rtogs pas de la ji mi snyam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “The power of discernment with regard to suffering” means that he is indifferent to suffering because he has realized with wisdom that the things that cause suffering are unreal.

original: bde ba dag la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal bar rtog pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni bde ba nyid du 'gyur zhing mi gnas te /
analyzed: bde ba dag la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal bar rtog pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni bde ba nyid du 'gyur zhing mi gnas te /
translated: “The power of discernment of impermanence and suffering with regard to pleasure” means that pleasure does not last.

original: mthar sdug bsngal du 'gyur bar rtogs pa'i mthus bde ba la chags shing dregs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mthar sdug bsngal du 'gyur bar rtogs pa'i mthus bde ba la chags shing dregs pa med pa'o //
translated: Finally, through the power of realizing that they will end in suffering, one is free of attachment to and pride in pleasures.

original: rjes su chags pa 'dor zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa 'dor zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase “giving up attachment and aversion” and so on.

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i sems ni nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i sems ni nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Attachment and aversion are afflictions.

original: de gnyis ni mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba las 'byung na /
analyzed: de gnyis ni mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba las 'byung na /
translated: Since these two arise from friends and enemies,

original: de gnyi ga la 'dra bar sems mnyam pa ni nyon mongs pa la sems btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga la 'dra bar sems mnyam pa ni nyon mongs pa la sems btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: the mind that is the same toward both is the equanimity of mind toward the afflictions.

original: blo mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang tshul khrims 'chal ba gnyis la bstod pa dang smad pa'i bsam pa @186b med pa dang / byams pa dang khong khro ba'i bsam pa med pa'o //🔽gnyis su mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa gnyis la 'dis ni phan btags /
analyzed: blo mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang tshul khrims 'chal ba gnyis la bstod pa dang smad pa'i bsam pa @186b med pa dang / byams pa dang khong khro ba'i bsam pa med pa'o // gnyis su mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa gnyis la 'dis ni phan btags /
translated: “Equality of mind” means that one has no thoughts of praising the morally disciplined or disparaging the immoral, and no thoughts of loving the good or hating the bad.

original: 'dis ni gnod par byas so zhes tha dad par mi sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnod par byas so zhes tha dad par mi sems pa'o //
translated: “Not making distinctions” means that one does not think of these two as different: “This one has helped me, but this one has harmed me.”

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug par mi lta zhes bya ba ni chags par 'gyur ba'i yul dang / chags par mi 'gyur ba'i yul gnyis la sdug pa dang mi sdug par mi lta ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug par mi lta zhes bya ba ni chags par 'gyur ba'i yul dang / chags par mi 'gyur ba'i yul gnyis la sdug pa dang mi sdug par mi lta ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not viewing as attractive or unattractive means not viewing the two, the object that causes attachment and the object that does not cause attachment, as attractive or unattractive.

original: legs pa thos pa dang nyes par thos pa zhes smos pa dang / legs par smras pa dang nyes par smras pa zhes smos pa gnyis la /
analyzed: legs pa thos pa dang nyes par thos pa zhes smos pa dang / legs par smras pa dang nyes par smras pa zhes smos pa gnyis la /
translated: The two, hearing well and hearing badly, and the two, well-spoken and ill-spoken, are as follows.

original: thos pa ni nyid nas brgyud de spyos shing bstod pa thos pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni nyid nas brgyud de spyos shing bstod pa thos pa'o //
translated: Hearing is hearing praise and blame that is transmitted from others.

original: smras pa ni mngon sum du spyos shing bstod pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa ni mngon sum du spyos shing bstod pa'o //
translated: Spoken is praise and blame that is directly heard.

original: mi brjed pa dang bag la nyal bar byed pa gnyis don gcig ste /
analyzed: mi brjed pa dang bag la nyal bar byed pa gnyis don gcig ste /
translated: Not forgetting and lying in wait are synonyms.

original: de gnyi ga la yang ji snyam du 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga la yang ji snyam du 'dor ba'o //
translated: Both of those are how do you think?

original: kha gcig las bag la nyal med ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha gcig las bag la nyal med ces 'byung ste /
translated: In some it is said without lying in wait.

original: de'i don kyang dga' bar 'dzin pa dang / khon du 'dzin pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i don kyang dga' bar 'dzin pa dang / khon du 'dzin pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of that is also a synonym for without holding joy and resentment.

original: ro myang ba'i nyes dmigs rnams la mtshungs par yongs su 'jal zhes bya ba ni ro myang ba'i bde ba dang / de dang bral ba'i tshe nyes dmigs mi dmigs mi bde ba gnyi ga la mtshungs par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ro myang ba'i nyes dmigs rnams la mtshungs par yongs su 'jal zhes bya ba ni ro myang ba'i bde ba dang / de dang bral ba'i tshe nyes dmigs mi dmigs mi bde ba gnyi ga la mtshungs par rtog pa'o //
translated: “He considers the disadvantages of savoring equally” means that he considers the happiness of savoring and the disadvantage of being separated from it equally.

original: sems can thams cad la bsam pa mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la 'dra bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bsam pa mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la 'dra bar sems pa'o //
translated: “He has the same attitude towards all sentient beings” means that he has the same attitude towards all sentient beings.

original: lus dang srog la mi lta zhes bya ba ni lus dang srog la phangs su bzung na de'i rkyen gyis chags pa dang zhe sdang ba'i nyon mongs pa 'byung bas lus dang srog la phangs par mi 'dzin ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus dang srog la mi lta zhes bya ba ni lus dang srog la phangs su bzung na de'i rkyen gyis chags pa dang zhe sdang ba'i nyon mongs pa 'byung bas lus dang srog la phangs par mi 'dzin ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “He does not care about his body or life” means that if he were to hold his body and life as precious, then on that basis, the afflictions of attachment and aversion would arise. Therefore, he does not hold his body and life as precious.

original: rab dang 'bring dang tha ma rnams la 'od zer mnyam zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum gyi sems can la yang rab 'bring du mi lta ba'i 'dra bar lta ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab dang 'bring dang tha ma rnams la 'od zer mnyam zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum gyi sems can la yang rab 'bring du mi lta ba'i 'dra bar lta ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “He has the same attitude towards the best, middling, and worst” means that he has the same attitude towards sentient beings of the three vehicles, without regarding them as better or worse. This is what is meant by “he has the same attitude towards all sentient beings.”

original: bsngags pa dang bsngags pa ma yin pa rnams la sems mnyam zhes bya ba ni bstod pa dang smad pa gnyi ga la yang dga' ba dang mi dga' bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bsngags pa dang bsngags pa ma yin pa rnams la sems mnyam zhes bya ba ni bstod pa dang smad pa gnyi ga la yang dga' ba dang mi dga' bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: “The mind is even with regard to praise and blame” means that one is neither pleased by praise nor displeased by blame.

original: bde ba dang mi bde ba rnams la rang gi sems yongs su dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems g-yo sgyu med de @187a * //
analyzed: bde ba dang mi bde ba rnams la rang gi sems yongs su dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems g-yo sgyu med de @187a * //
translated: “One’s mind is delighted with regard to pleasure and pain” means that one’s mind is without deceit and hypocrisy.

original: de dag la drang por smras pa dang drang por ma smras pa gnyi ga la yang drang po dang bden par smra bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la drang por smras pa dang drang por ma smras pa gnyi ga la yang drang po dang bden par smra bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: “One is truthful and honest with regard to both honesty and dishonesty” means that one speaks truthfully and honestly to them, whether one is honest or dishonest.

original: nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa'i don bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa'i don bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize and teach the meaning of equanimity with regard to the afflictions,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar gang bsti stang du byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gang bsti stang du byed cing bsti stang du byas pas kyang mthos par mi sems /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar gang bsti stang du byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gang bsti stang du byed cing bsti stang du byas pas kyang mthos par mi sems /
translated: the root text says, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, in that way, one who is honored . . .”🔽One does not think that one is superior because one is honored and respected.

original: gnod par byed cing gnod par byas pa la yang dmas par mi sems te /
analyzed: gnod par byed cing gnod par byas pa la yang dmas par mi sems te /
translated: One does not think that one is inferior because one is harmed and mistreated.

original: btang snyoms par 'jog pa ni nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms par 'jog pa ni nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Equanimity in regard to the afflictions is called “equanimity in regard to the afflictions.”

original: bdag dang gzhan srung ba'i btang snyoms bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan srung ba'i btang snyoms bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate equanimity in protecting oneself and others,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag dang gzhan srung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag dang gzhan srung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Here, the bodhisattvas’ protection of themselves and others,” and so on.

original: khong khro bar mi byed cing mi tshol te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa gcad kyang gzhan la zhe sdang yang mi skye /
analyzed: khong khro bar mi byed cing mi tshol te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa gcad kyang gzhan la zhe sdang yang mi skye /
translated: “They do not become angry and do not seek revenge” means that even if others cut off their major or minor body parts, they do not give rise to anger toward others.

original: mi gcad pa'i thabs tshol zhing gsol ba yang mi 'debs te /
analyzed: mi gcad pa'i thabs tshol zhing gsol ba yang mi 'debs te /
translated: They do not seek a way to retaliate and do not ask for permission to do so.

original: de ltar zhe sdang ma skyes shing mi gcod pa'i thabs mi tshol bas bdag gi sems ma 'khrugs pas bdag srung ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhe sdang ma skyes shing mi gcod pa'i thabs mi tshol bas bdag gi sems ma 'khrugs pas bdag srung ba'o //
translated: In this way, since anger has not arisen and they do not seek a way to retaliate, their minds are undisturbed, and so they protect themselves.

original: khong khro ma skyes te gzhan gyi sems ma 'khrugs pa ni gzhan bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: khong khro ma skyes te gzhan gyi sems ma 'khrugs pa ni gzhan bsrung ba'o //
translated: Since anger has not arisen and the minds of others are undisturbed, they protect others.

original: lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lus kyis nyes par byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lus kyis nyes par byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “Bodily transformation” means “the fault of another’s body.”

original: de bzhin du ngag gi rnam par 'gyur ba'ang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag gi rnam par 'gyur ba'ang rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should understand “verbal transformation.”

original: mig gi rnams kyang rma mi phyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: mig gi rnams kyang rma mi phyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: “The eyes are not injured” and so on means

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi dbang du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi dbang du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that one is not under the control of the sense faculties such as the eyes, and of the sense objects such as form.

original: rma mi phyin zhing nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis mi tshugs shing zhe sdang gi dbang du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rma mi phyin zhing nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis mi tshugs shing zhe sdang gi dbang du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Not injured, not impaired” means that one is not overcome by hatred, and is not under the control of hatred.

original: rma phyung ba la rma mi 'byin //
analyzed: rma phyung ba la rma mi 'byin //
translated: “One does not injure the injured”

original: zhes bya ba ni phas gnod par byas kyang slar gnod pa mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phas gnod par byas kyang slar gnod pa mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that even if one is harmed by another, one does not harm that other person in return.

original: phan par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa la mnyam zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs par sems pa dang / gnod par bya bar sems pa gnyis la byams par bya ba dang gnod par bya ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa la mnyam zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs par sems pa dang / gnod par bya bar sems pa gnyis la byams par bya ba dang gnod par bya ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase the same toward those who are helpful and those who are not means that there is no difference in affection toward those who are helpful and those who are not.

original: @187b btang snyoms ni mchog tu rtsod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nyes par byas shing mi snyan par smras pa la ji mi snyam ste /
analyzed: @187b btang snyoms ni mchog tu rtsod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nyes par byas shing mi snyan par smras pa la ji mi snyam ste /
translated: The phrase equanimity is the highest non-disputation means that one is indifferent to the faults and unpleasant speech of others.

original: mi rtsod pas mchog tu rtsod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtsod pas mchog tu rtsod pa med pa'o //
translated: One does not dispute with others, and therefore, equanimity is the highest non-disputation.

original: btang snyoms ni rang gi sems la nges par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la chos thams cad sems las byung bar yang dag par rtogs shing gtan la 'bebs pas phyi rol du mi 'brang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni rang gi sems la nges par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la chos thams cad sems las byung bar yang dag par rtogs shing gtan la 'bebs pas phyi rol du mi 'brang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase equanimity is the discernment of one's own mind means that one does not pursue external things because one has understood and ascertained that all things arise from the mind.

original: yang na rang gi sems la nges par rtog ces bya ba ni bdag gi sems zhe sdang gi dbang du mi gtong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na rang gi sems la nges par rtog ces bya ba ni bdag gi sems zhe sdang gi dbang du mi gtong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Alternatively, the phrase the discernment of one's own mind means that one does not allow one's mind to fall under the control of hatred.

original: btang snyoms ni gzhan gyi sems srung ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems 'khrug par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni gzhan gyi sems srung ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems 'khrug par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Equanimity is the protection of the minds of others. This means that one does not disturb the minds of others.

original: btang snyoms ni bdag la rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang bdag gi las la rtog gi gzhan la khon du mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni bdag la rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang bdag gi las la rtog gi gzhan la khon du mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the reflection on oneself. This means that even when others do harm, one reflects on one’s own karma and does not hold a grudge against others.

original: btang snyoms ni sems can gzhan dag la gnod pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnod pa thams cad bdag gi las las byung bar rtogs pas sems can gyis ma nyes par shes pa'i phyir sems can gyis gnod par byed pas sems can la gnod par mi byed
analyzed: btang snyoms ni sems can gzhan dag la gnod pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnod pa thams cad bdag gi las las byung bar rtogs pas sems can gyis ma nyes par shes pa'i phyir sems can gyis gnod par byed pas sems can la gnod par mi byed
translated: Equanimity is the non-harming of other sentient beings. This means that because one understands that all harm arises from one’s own karma, one understands that sentient beings are not at fault, and so one does not harm sentient beings because of the harm that sentient beings do.

original: pa'o // bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba'i btang snyoms bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'o // bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba'i btang snyoms bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary of equanimity that protects oneself and others,

original: btang snyoms ni byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs yin te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs yin te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said: Equanimity is the state of concentration of the bodhisattva.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni chags pa dang khong khro ba med par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni chags pa dang khong khro ba med par bya'o //
translated: One should be equanimous in meditative equipoise, without attachment or aversion.

original: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs ni btang snyoms yin pas de bas na btang snyoms ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs ni btang snyoms yin pas de bas na btang snyoms ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Since equanimity is the state of meditative equipoise, therefore equanimity is the state of meditative equipoise.

original: yang na mnyam par gzhag pa ni ting nge 'dzin du sems rtse gcig par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: yang na mnyam par gzhag pa ni ting nge 'dzin du sems rtse gcig par gzhag pa ste /
translated: Or, meditative equipoise is the one-pointed placement of the mind in concentration.

original: de'i gnas skabs ni btang snyoms yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs ni btang snyoms yin no //
translated: Its state is equanimity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang la yang chags pa dang zhe sdang med na 'dod sems rtse gcig par nus pas so //
analyzed: gang la yang chags pa dang zhe sdang med na 'dod sems rtse gcig par nus pas so //
translated: Because when there is neither attachment nor aversion to anything, one is able to make the mind one-pointed in desire.

original: dus dang dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus dang dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show equanimity in terms of time and non-time,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dus dang dus ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dus dang dus ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, Here, the bodhisattva's time and non-time... and so on.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad du btang snyoms @188a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad du btang snyoms @188a * //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas are equanimous towards all bodhisattvas.

original: bya bar bka' mi stsol to zhes bya ba ni gong du rnam pa thams cad du btang snyoms pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bya bar bka' mi stsol to zhes bya ba ni gong du rnam pa thams cad du btang snyoms pa bshad pa ste /
translated: “One should not be indifferent” means that one should not be indifferent in all ways, as explained above.

original: skabs kha cig tu de ltar btang snyoms su byar mi rung gi / dus dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skabs kha cig tu de ltar btang snyoms su byar mi rung gi / dus dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “One should be in accord with the occasion” means that it is not suitable to be indifferent in some situations.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i tshig ste /
translated: “Why is that?” is a question.

original: dus thams cad du ci'i phyir btang snyoms su bzhag tu mi rung zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus thams cad du ci'i phyir btang snyoms su bzhag tu mi rung zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means, “Why is it not suitable to be indifferent at all times?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu bdag dang gzhan gyi dge ba'i chos btsal ba la brtson zhing 'bad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dus thams cad du bdag dang gzhan gyi chos btsal ba la 'bad par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu bdag dang gzhan gyi dge ba'i chos btsal ba la brtson zhing 'bad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dus thams cad du bdag dang gzhan gyi chos btsal ba la 'bad par bya ba yin pas /
translated: “Because the bodhisattva is always striving and making an effort to seek the virtuous qualities of self and other” means that the bodhisattva is always striving to seek the qualities of self and other.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang sbyar te kha cig btang snyoms su'ang 'dor /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang sbyar te kha cig btang snyoms su'ang 'dor /
translated: The bodhisattva, in terms of the aims of self and other, sometimes even abandons.

original: kha cig tu btsal zhing 'bad par bya zhing btang snyoms su mi gzhag go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: kha cig tu btsal zhing 'bad par bya zhing btang snyoms su mi gzhag go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In some cases, one should seek and strive, and not be indifferent.

original: snod ma yin pa dang mnyan par mi 'dod pa'i sems can la btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni dus la bab pa'i sems can te /
analyzed: snod ma yin pa dang mnyan par mi 'dod pa'i sems can la btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni dus la bab pa'i sems can te /
translated: Being indifferent to sentient beings who are not suitable vessels and do not wish to listen means that when the time has come for sentient beings,

original: chos zab mo bshad pa'i snod ma yin pa dang / chos nyan par mi 'dod pa la mi 'chad par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: chos zab mo bshad pa'i snod ma yin pa dang / chos nyan par mi 'dod pa la mi 'chad par 'jog pa ste /
translated: if they are not suitable vessels for explaining the profound Dharma and do not wish to listen to the Dharma, one should not explain it and should set it aside.

original: skabs 'dir btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni mi bya bar gzhag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni mi bya bar gzhag pa la bya'o //
translated: In this context, being indifferent means setting aside without doing anything.

original: ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i dus na yang mi dga' ba'i sems mi 'byung ba rnams btang snyoms su gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i dus na yang mi dga' ba'i sems mi 'byung ba rnams btang snyoms su gzhag pa'o //
translated: Even when there is no gain and so on, one should set aside the mind that is displeased.🔽Regarding sentient beings who are of the Śrāvaka Vehicle, and so on, a person whose lineage as a Śrāvaka is fixed, who is abiding in the stages of definite emergence such as heat and summit,

original: sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyan thos su rigs nges pa'i gang zag drod dang spyi bo la sogs pa nges par 'byin pa'i sa la bzhugs pa'am /
analyzed: sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyan thos su rigs nges pa'i gang zag drod dang spyi bo la sogs pa nges par 'byin pa'i sa la bzhugs pa'am /
translated: or who is abiding in the stage of Śrāvaka acceptance,

original: mthong ba'i lam la zhugs pa rnams ni theg pa chen po la sgyur du mi btub pa de bzhin du btang snyoms su gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la zhugs pa rnams ni theg pa chen po la sgyur du mi btub pa de bzhin du btang snyoms su gzhag pa'o //
translated: Those who have entered the path of seeing cannot be turned away from the Great Vehicle, and so one should be indifferent to them.

original: sbyin pa'i dus na tshul khrims btul ba'i btang snyoms ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims gnyis spyad pa'i sgo tha dad pas sbyin pa spyad pa'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dus na tshul khrims btul ba'i btang snyoms ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims gnyis spyad pa'i sgo tha dad pas sbyin pa spyad pa'am /
translated: Indifference to the taming of morality at the time of generosity means that one does not practice generosity or morality at the time of practicing generosity,

original: sbyin pa'i yon tan bsngags pa'i dus su tshul khrims spyod pa'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i yon tan bsngags pa'i dus su tshul khrims spyod pa'am /
translated: or one does not practice morality at the time of praising the virtues of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi yon tan bsngags pa btang snyoms su gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi yon tan bsngags pa btang snyoms su gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: or one is indifferent to the praise of the virtues of morality. This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bar la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bar la yang sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, one should apply this to the six perfections up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gdon mi za bar bya ba'i chos rnams la mi 'jug pa med @188b pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du mi bya ba'i chos rnams la btang snyoms par bstan par zad kyi byang chub chen po'i rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs nges
analyzed: gang gdon mi za bar bya ba'i chos rnams la mi 'jug pa med @188b pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du mi bya ba'i chos rnams la btang snyoms par bstan par zad kyi byang chub chen po'i rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs nges
translated: As for not engaging in the dharmas that are to be practiced without doubt, and so on, it has already been explained above that one should be indifferent to the dharmas that are not to be practiced. However, the accumulations of merit and wisdom, which are the causes of great enlightenment, are definitely to be practiced.

original: par sgrub dgos pa kun la 'jug cing btang snyoms su mi bya bar ston to //
analyzed: par sgrub dgos pa kun la 'jug cing btang snyoms su mi bya bar ston to //
translated: This shows that he engages in all the practices that need to be accomplished and does not remain indifferent.

original: stobs ni le los zil gyis mi non pa'o //
analyzed: stobs ni le los zil gyis mi non pa'o //
translated: Power is not being overwhelmed by laziness.

original: mos pa ni dge bar spyad pa la dad pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni dge bar spyad pa la dad pa'o //
translated: Interest is faith in virtuous practice.

original: mthun pa ni bdud la sogs pas mi tshugs pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa ni bdud la sogs pas mi tshugs pa'o //
translated: Harmony is not being harmed by demons and so forth.

original: brtson pa mi 'dor ba ni brtson 'grus rgyun du spyod pa mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: brtson pa mi 'dor ba ni brtson 'grus rgyun du spyod pa mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Not abandoning striving is not giving up the continuous practice of effort.

original: btang snyoms mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: btang snyoms mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: Equanimity is explained as inexhaustible.

original: // / mngon sum gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / mngon sum gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the bodhisattvas who have attained manifest realization,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa lnga yang mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa lnga yang mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, moreover, the five superknowledges of the bodhisattvas are also inexhaustible,” and so on.

original: mngon par shes pa la gnas pa rnams ni mngon du gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la gnas pa rnams ni mngon du gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who abide in the superknowledges are called bodhisattvas who have attained manifest realization.

original: de mi zad pa yang shes par bya ba'i dngos po sems can dang chos rnams la mtha' med de mi zad pas lha'i mig la sogs pa shes par byed pa rnams kyang mi zad do //
analyzed: de mi zad pa yang shes par bya ba'i dngos po sems can dang chos rnams la mtha' med de mi zad pas lha'i mig la sogs pa shes par byed pa rnams kyang mi zad do //
translated: The inexhaustibility of the knowledge of bases should be understood as follows: since sentient beings and things, which are the bases of knowledge, are infinite and inexhaustible, the knowledge of divine eye, etc. is also inexhaustible.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du blta ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du blta ste /
translated: Here, the method of teaching and the method of explanation should be understood.

original: lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: What are the five?

original: rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan pa'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan pa'i tshul bstan to //
translated: Beginning from here up to the knowledge of the performance of miracles, the method of teaching is shown.

original: de man chad lhag ma thams cad kyis bshad pa'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: de man chad lhag ma thams cad kyis bshad pa'i tshul bstan to //
translated: From here on, the rest shows the method of explanation.

original: mngon sum du gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has become manifest is also of six kinds:

original: gzugs mngon sum pa dang tshig mngon sum pa dang / sems mngon sum pa dang ; bsags pa mngon sum pa dang / mnyam pa nyid mngon sum pa dang / 'byung ba mngon sum par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs mngon sum pa dang tshig mngon sum pa dang / sems mngon sum pa dang ; bsags pa mngon sum pa dang / mnyam pa nyid mngon sum pa dang / 'byung ba mngon sum par gyur pa'o //
translated: the one who has become manifest in form, the one who has become manifest in words, the one who has become manifest in mind, the one who has become manifest in accumulation, the one who has become manifest in equality, and the one who has become manifest in emergence.

original: de la gzugs mngon sum bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gzugs mngon sum bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of showing the one who has become manifest in form,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lha'i mig gang zhen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lha'i mig gang zhen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is the divine eye of the bodhisattvas?

original: gzugs mngon sum bde yang rnam pa bzhi rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs mngon sum bde yang rnam pa bzhi rig par bya ste /
translated: The divine eye should be understood as fourfold:

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa las khyad zhugs pa dang / gzugs thams cad mthong ba dang / mi mthun pa'i dri mas ma gos pa dang / rgyu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa las khyad zhugs pa dang / gzugs thams cad mthong ba dang / mi mthun pa'i dri mas ma gos pa dang / rgyu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: superior to the mundane, seeing all forms, uncontaminated by any opposing stains, and pure in cause.

original: de la gang lha thams cad kyi lha'i mig ces bya ba @189a * //🔽nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la gang lha thams cad kyi lha'i mig ces bya ba @189a * // nas brtsams te /
translated: In this regard, the passage beginning with “the divine eye of all gods”

original: chos 'od gsal te bya ba yan chad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad las khyad zhugs pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos 'od gsal te bya ba yan chad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad las khyad zhugs pa bstan to //
translated: and continuing up to “the light of Dharma” shows the superiority of the bodhisattvas’ divine eye over all mundane and supramundane eyes.

original: lha'i mig des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: lha'i mig des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The passage beginning with “by means of that divine eye” and continuing up to “the world systems in the ten directions” shows the seeing of all forms.

original: de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gzugs thams cad mthong ba bstan to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gzugs thams cad mthong ba bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning with “by means of that divine eye” and continuing up to “they see all forms” shows the uncontaminated nature of the bodhisattvas’ divine eye.🔽The passage beginning with “by means of that divine eye” and continuing up to “the light of Dharma” shows the purity of the bodhisattvas’ divine eye in terms of its cause.

original: de dag gi mig de ni gzugs thams cad mthong bas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni gzugs thams cad mthong bas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: That eye of theirs sees all forms, etc.🔽up to: it is practiced without attachment to the path.

original: lam la ma chags par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis mi mthun pa'i dri mas ma gos par bstan to //
analyzed: lam la ma chags par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis mi mthun pa'i dri mas ma gos par bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is not sullied by the stains of resistance.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Why is it so?🔽up to: it is not subject to loss of the superknowledges.

original: mngon par shes pa ma nyams zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ma nyams zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the purity of the cause.🔽The eye of wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have set out for the knowledge of all modes is superior to the divine eye.🔽The divine eye is obtained by dedication to the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.🔽The eye of wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have set out for the knowledge of all modes is superior to the divine eye.🔽The divine eye is obtained by dedication to the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las nges par byung ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngos pas lha'i mig de lta bu thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las nges par byung ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngos pas lha'i mig de lta bu thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The eye of wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have set out for the knowledge of all modes is superior to the divine eye.🔽The divine eye is obtained by dedication to the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.🔽The eye of wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have set out for the knowledge of all modes is superior to the divine eye.🔽The divine eye is obtained by dedication to the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.🔽The eye of wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have set out for the knowledge of all modes is superior to the divine eye.🔽The divine eye is obtained by dedication to the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.🔽The eye of wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have set out for the knowledge of all modes is superior to the divine eye.🔽The divine eye is obtained by dedication to the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.🔽The eye of wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have set out for the knowledge of all modes is superior to the divine eye.🔽The divine eye is obtained by dedication to the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.🔽The eye of wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have set out for the knowledge of all modes is superior to the divine eye.🔽The divine eye is obtained by dedication to the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.🔽The eye of wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have set out for the knowledge of all modes is superior to the divine eye.

original: rgya chen po las nges par 'byung ba rnams kyis lha'i mig ni ches mchog go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgya chen po las nges par 'byung ba rnams kyis lha'i mig ni ches mchog go zhes bya ba la /
translated: The divine eye is obtained by dedication to the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rgya chen po 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rgya chen po 'am /
translated: The eye of wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have set out for the knowledge of all modes is superior to the divine eye.

original: lam gyi ye shes rgya chen po spyod pa las thos pa'i lha'i mig ni ches mchog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lam gyi ye shes rgya chen po spyod pa las thos pa'i lha'i mig ni ches mchog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The divine eye of the bodhisattva is the best of all divine eyes, because it is the cause of the knowledge of the path of the universal vehicle.🔽The divine eye of the worldlings, gods, nagas, etc., who are not noble, is the best of all divine eyes.

original: chos mchog ces bya ba ni lha dang klu la sogs pa 'jig rten pa 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi lha'i mig pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas 'phags pa rnams kyi lha'i mig mchog go //
analyzed: chos mchog ces bya ba ni lha dang klu la sogs pa 'jig rten pa 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi lha'i mig pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas 'phags pa rnams kyi lha'i mig mchog go //
translated: The divine eye of the noble disciples and hermit buddhas is the best of all divine eyes.

original: 'phags pa de dag gi lha'i mig pas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i mig mchog pas na de nyid las bzla ba'i phyir chos mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa de dag gi lha'i mig pas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i mig mchog pas na de nyid las bzla ba'i phyir chos mchog ces bya'o //
translated: The divine eye of the bodhisattvas is the best of all divine eyes, because it is the cause of the knowledge of the path of the universal vehicle.

original: ci'i phyir ches mchog ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ches mchog ce na /
translated: Why is it the best?

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi mngon par shes pa yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / dbang pos lhag pa dang / khams kyis lhag pa la sogs pa gong ma rnams shes par mi nus la cung zad shes shing chad yod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi mngon par shes pa yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / dbang pos lhag pa dang / khams kyis lhag pa la sogs pa gong ma rnams shes par mi nus la cung zad shes shing chad yod kyi /
translated: The mundane superknowledges of the mundane beings and the supramundane superknowledges of the noble listeners and so on cannot know the higher levels of the past and future, the higher faculties, the higher realms and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de lta ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so for the bodhisattvas.

original: tshad dang mtha' @189b med pa'i phyir ches mchog go //
analyzed: tshad dang mtha' @189b med pa'i phyir ches mchog go //
translated: Because they are immeasurable and limitless, they are the most sublime.

original: de la mchog ni bkra shis pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mchog ni bkra shis pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the most sublime is auspicious.

original: ches dam pa ni gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //🔽ches rab ni thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches dam pa ni gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir ro // ches rab ni thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The most excellent is the most excellent because it proceeds higher and higher.🔽The most supreme is the foremost of all.

original: ches phul ni gzugs thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches phul ni gzugs thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The most sublime is the most sublime because it pervades all forms.

original: ches gsal ba ni dri ma med cing rab tu dang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches gsal ba ni dri ma med cing rab tu dang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The most clear is stainless and very pure.

original: ches bzang ba ni ma smad cing mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches bzang ba ni ma smad cing mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the best because it is not defiled and is in accord with nirvana.

original: ches stobs dang ldan pa ni thogs pa med par gzugs kun mthong ba'i mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches stobs dang ldan pa ni thogs pa med par gzugs kun mthong ba'i mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the most powerful because it has the great power of seeing all forms without obstruction.

original: ches 'od gsal ba ni ye shes dri ma med pa'i mthu mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches 'od gsal ba ni ye shes dri ma med pa'i mthu mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the most radiant because it has the supreme power of stainless wisdom.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa las khyad zhugs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa las khyad zhugs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The superiority of the supramundane over the mundane has already been explained.

original: // / gzugs thams cad mthong ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / gzugs thams cad mthong ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the seeing of all forms,

original: de lha'i mig des zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de lha'i mig des zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, By that divine eye... and so on.

original: lha'i mig des zhes bya ba'i gong du bshad pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i mig thams cad las 'das par gyur pa'i lha'i mig des zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lha'i mig des zhes bya ba'i gong du bshad pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i mig thams cad las 'das par gyur pa'i lha'i mig des zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that by that divine eye, which surpasses all mundane and supramundane divine eyes explained above,

original: gzugs su snang ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs su gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs su snang ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs su gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: appearing as form means belonging to the form realm.

original: rags pa'am zhes bya ba ni chen por gtogs pa thams cad bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: rags pa'am zhes bya ba ni chen por gtogs pa thams cad bsdus pa ste /
translated: The word “gross” includes all that is included in the great,

original: gangs ri dang ri rab la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gangs ri dang ri rab la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as the snow mountains, Mount Meru, and so on.

original: phra mo zhes bya bas chung ngur gtogs pa thams cad bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: phra mo zhes bya bas chung ngur gtogs pa thams cad bsdus pa ste /
translated: The word “subtle” includes all that is included in the small,

original: rdul dang rdul phran la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdul dang rdul phran la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as atoms, molecules, and so on.

original: bzang po 'am zhes bya bas bzang po thams cad bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: bzang po 'am zhes bya bas bzang po thams cad bsdus pa ste /
translated: The word “beautiful” includes all that is beautiful,

original: gang 'phags pa slob pa dang mi slob pa la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gang 'phags pa slob pa dang mi slob pa la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: such as the form of the noble ones, learners, and nonlearners.

original: ngan pa'am zhes bya bas ngan pa thams cad bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: ngan pa'am zhes bya bas ngan pa thams cad bsdus pa ste /
translated: The word “ugly” includes all that is ugly,

original: gang so so'i skye bo'i gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: gang so so'i skye bo'i gzugs rnams so //
translated: such as the form of ordinary beings.

original: rgyang ring po 'am zhes bya bas rgyang ring por gtogs pa thams cad bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: rgyang ring po 'am zhes bya bas rgyang ring por gtogs pa thams cad bsdus pa ste /
translated: The word “distant” includes all that is included in the distant,

original: gang 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong du ma'i pha rol na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong du ma'i pha rol na gnas pa'o //
translated: such as that which exists beyond many hundreds of thousands of world systems.

original: thag nye ba gang ci yang rung zhes bya bas nye ba thams cad bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: thag nye ba gang ci yang rung zhes bya bas nye ba thams cad bsdus pa ste /
translated: The word “near” includes all that is near,

original: gang thag nye ba na 'dug pa'i gzugs thams cad do //
analyzed: gang thag nye ba na 'dug pa'i gzugs thams cad do //
translated: such as all forms that are present nearby.

original: yang na rags pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: yang na rags pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams so //
translated: The gross is the four great elements.

original: phra ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams so//
analyzed: phra ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams so//
translated: The subtle is the form derived from the four great elements.

original: @190a * // yang na rags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: @190a * // yang na rags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i gzugs rnams so //
translated: Or else, the gross is the form of the world.

original: phra ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: phra ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gzugs rnams so //
translated: The subtle is the form of those beyond the world.

original: yang na rags pa ni 'dad pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: yang na rags pa ni 'dad pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Or else, the gross is the form included in the realm of desire.

original: phra ba ni gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: phra ba ni gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The subtle is the form included in the realm of form.

original: bzang po ni bde 'gro rnams kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: bzang po ni bde 'gro rnams kyi gzugs so //
translated: The good is the form of those in the happy destinies.

original: ngan pa ni ngan song ba rnams kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: ngan pa ni ngan song ba rnams kyi gzugs so //
translated: The bad is the form of those in the unhappy destinies.

original: yang na bzang po ni dbyibs dang kha dog tu ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bzang po ni dbyibs dang kha dog tu ldan pa'o //
translated: Or else, the good is the form that is well-proportioned and well-colored.

original: ngan pa ni dbyibs dang kha dog tu mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pa ni dbyibs dang kha dog tu mi ldan pa'o //
translated: The bad is the form that is ill-proportioned and ill-colored.

original: rgyang ring po ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: rgyang ring po ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The distant is the form of the past and future.

original: thag nye ba ni da ltar gyi gzugs so //
analyzed: thag nye ba ni da ltar gyi gzugs so //
translated: The near is the form of the present.

original: yang na rgyang ring po ni gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: yang na rgyang ring po ni gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Or else, the distant is the form included in the life-stream of another.

original: thag nye ba ni bdag gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: thag nye ba ni bdag gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The nearby is the form included in one's own continuum.

original: de dag thams cad ni gong du bshad pa'i gzugs de dag thams cad do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni gong du bshad pa'i gzugs de dag thams cad do //
translated: All of those are all the forms explained above.

original: de dag gi ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi lha'i mig gis so //
analyzed: de dag gi ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi lha'i mig gis so //
translated: Those are the divine eyes of the bodhisattvas.

original: rig cing snang ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba'i rnam grangs kyi tshig go //
analyzed: rig cing snang ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba'i rnam grangs kyi tshig go //
translated: Knowing, appearance, and so on are terms that are synonyms for seeing.

original: yang na 'das pa'i gzugs mthong ba ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'das pa'i gzugs mthong ba ni rig pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, seeing past form is knowing.

original: da ltar gyi gzugs mthong ba ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi gzugs mthong ba ni snang ba'o //
translated: Seeing present form is appearance.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs mthong ba ni shin tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs mthong ba ni shin tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: Seeing future form is realization.

original: spom po rnams mthong ba ni shin tu mthong ba'o //
analyzed: spom po rnams mthong ba ni shin tu mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing gross form is seeing.

original: yang na mos pa'i spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin drod kyi rgyu las byung bas na rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mos pa'i spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin drod kyi rgyu las byung bas na rig pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, knowing is the concentration of the stage of devoted engagement that arises from the cause of heat.

original: spyi bo'i rgyu las byung bas na snang ba'o //
analyzed: spyi bo'i rgyu las byung bas na snang ba'o //
translated: Appearance is that which arises from the cause of the peak.

original: bzod pa'i rgyu las byung bas na rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i rgyu las byung bas na rtogs pa'o //
translated: Realization is that which arises from the cause of acceptance.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi rgyu las byung bas na shin tu rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi rgyu las byung bas na shin tu rig pa'o //
translated: It is very clear because it arises from the cause of the supreme mundane state.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyu las byung bas na shin tu mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyu las byung bas na shin tu mthong ba'o //
translated: It is very visible because it arises from the cause of the path of seeing.🔽He knows the death and rebirth of beings, as it really is.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba dang 'pho ba gnyis kyang phung po 'dor zhing len pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba dang 'pho ba gnyis kyang phung po 'dor zhing len pa la bya ste /
translated: Death and rebirth are the relinquishing and taking up of the aggregates.

original: gzugs kyi phung po len cing 'dor ba mig gi spyod yul yin pas lha'i mig gis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po len cing 'dor ba mig gi spyod yul yin pas lha'i mig gis shes par bya'o //
translated: Since the taking up and relinquishing of the form aggregate is the domain of the eye, it is to be known by the divine eye.🔽He knows the cause of their karma, as it really is.

original: de dag gi las kyi rgyu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can de dag gi lus dang ngag gi sgo nas ci spyod pa de'i rgyu bstun ji spyod spyod pa las byung ba yang rab tu shes so
analyzed: de dag gi las kyi rgyu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can de dag gi lus dang ngag gi sgo nas ci spyod pa de'i rgyu bstun ji spyod spyod pa las byung ba yang rab tu shes so
translated: He knows the cause of the karma of those beings, as it really is, in accordance with the way they act through body and speech.

original: zhes bya ba'i don @190b to ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don @190b to ;
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: las kyi 'bras bu shes pa ni da lta'i lus dang ngag gi sgo nas las ci byas pa'i 'bras bu phyis cir 'gyur ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu shes pa ni da lta'i lus dang ngag gi sgo nas las ci byas pa'i 'bras bu phyis cir 'gyur ba shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the results of action is the knowledge of what the results will be later of whatever actions are done now by body and speech.

original: dbang po'i rig pa shes ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rno rtul gyi rim pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i rig pa shes ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rno rtul gyi rim pa shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of the faculties is the knowledge of the order of the sharp and dull faculties, such as the eye faculty, etc., and the faith faculty, etc.

original: las kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dang dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po 'di dag gzugs kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir lha'i mig gi spyod yul yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dang dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po 'di dag gzugs kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir lha'i mig gi spyod yul yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that these faculties of faith, etc., and the causes and results of action are the domain of the divine eye, because they arise from the cause of form.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing sa gzhi bee d'urya'i kha dog dang dpag bsam gyi shing gi phreng ba dang bdud rtsi'i rdzing la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing sa gzhi bee d'urya'i kha dog dang dpag bsam gyi shing gi phreng ba dang bdud rtsi'i rdzing la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The array of qualities of the buddhaverse is the buddhaverse endowed with a ground of the color of beryl, with garlands of wishgranting trees, with pools of nectar, and so on.

original: rang gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pas rang gi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa rnams yongs su bsngo ste zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi zhing gi yon tan
analyzed: rang gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pas rang gi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa rnams yongs su bsngo ste zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi zhing gi yon tan
translated: And they dedicate their accumulations of merit and wisdom to the purification of the array of qualities of their own buddha field through the purity of their discipline.

original: mthong nas bdag kyang nam sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i tshe zhing gi yon tan de lta bu dang ldan par gyur cig ces bdag gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ci bsags pa rnams tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i mthus bsngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong nas bdag kyang nam sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i tshe zhing gi yon tan de lta bu dang ldan par gyur cig ces bdag gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ci bsags pa rnams tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i mthus bsngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having seen the qualities of the buddha fields of the bhagavat buddhas, they think, “When I become a buddha, may I have such qualities in my buddha field.” They dedicate their accumulations of merit and wisdom to that end through the power of their pure discipline.

original: tshul khrims kyi mthus bsngos pas ji bzhin 'grub bar 'gyur ram snyam pa la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi mthus bsngos pas ji bzhin 'grub bar 'gyur ram snyam pa la /
translated: One might wonder, “Will they be accomplished in accordance with the dedication made through the power of discipline?”

original: tshul khrims kyi yon tan la gnas pa de dag gi bsngo ba yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi yon tan la gnas pa de dag gi bsngo ba yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “The dedication of those who abide in the qualities of discipline will be accomplished.”

original: chos nyid kyi tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams ci bsams pa'am /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams ci bsams pa'am /
translated: Those who have the morality of reality accomplish whatever they intend or🔽wish for. The meaning is that they are completely successful in whatever they

original: smon pa bzhin du 'grub pas ji ltar bsngos pa bzhin du yongs su 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smon pa bzhin du 'grub pas ji ltar bsngos pa bzhin du yongs su 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: dedicate themselves to.

original: cho ga dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: cho ga dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Ritual” refers to

original: bya ba dang mi bya ba rnams ni cho ga'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang mi bya ba rnams ni cho ga'o //
translated: what should and should not be done.🔽“Conduct” refers to acting in accordance with the Dharma, such as wearing

original: chos gos bgo ba dang / lhung bzed bzung ba la sogs pa chos bzhin du byed pa ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos bgo ba dang / lhung bzed bzung ba la sogs pa chos bzhin du byed pa ni spyod pa'o //
translated: the robes and carrying the alms bowl.🔽“Range” refers to not engaging in the five activities, such as selling alcohol

original: chang 'tshong dang smad 'tshong la sogs pa spyod yul lngar mi 'jug pa ni spyod yul lo //
analyzed: chang 'tshong dang smad 'tshong la sogs pa spyod yul lngar mi 'jug pa ni spyod yul lo //
translated: and prostitution.

original: ltung ba dang mi ltung ba ma brjed pa ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba dang mi ltung ba ma brjed pa ni dran pa'o //
