translated: “Recollection” refers to not forgetting what is and is not a downfall.

original: ltung ba dang mi ltung ba shes pa ni shes bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung ba dang mi ltung ba shes pa ni shes bzhin no //
translated: “Awareness” refers to knowing what is and is not a downfall.🔽“Bearing” refers to the deportment, such as walking, standing, sleeping,

original: 'gro ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba dang 'chag pa la sogs pa mdzes pa ni spyod lam mo //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba dang 'chag pa la sogs pa mdzes pa ni spyod lam mo //
translated: sitting, and so forth.

original: gtsug lag khang dang ri dang brag phug la sogs pa ni @191a * //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang ri dang brag phug la sogs pa ni @191a * //
translated: “Monastery” refers to the temple, mountain, cave, and so forth.

original: gnas so // mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa dang / bdud dang mu stegs can gyis mi phyed pa ni mthu'o //
analyzed: gnas so // mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa dang / bdud dang mu stegs can gyis mi phyed pa ni mthu'o //
translated: He abides in the five superknowledges. His power is that he is not divided by demons or heretics.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa ni chos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa ni chos so //
translated: The Dharma is the Bodhisattva canon, the Vinaya, and the Abhidharma.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: His liberation is that he is liberated from the nonabiding nirvana.

original: me long lta bu'i dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor kun du rtog pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni ye shes so //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor kun du rtog pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni ye shes so //
translated: His knowledge is the knowledge of the mirror, equality, individual discernment, and the accomplishment of the work.

original: mkhas pa'i tshig re re dang yang sbyar te /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i tshig re re dang yang sbyar te /
translated: Each of these terms of skill should be applied to each of the following.

original: don dang chos dang ye shes dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rten pa ni rten pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: don dang chos dang ye shes dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rten pa ni rten pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in the object is the support of the knowledge of the object, the Dharma, and the truth of ultimate meaning.

original: don dang tshig mi brjed pa'i gzungs dang ldan pa ni gzungs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: don dang tshig mi brjed pa'i gzungs dang ldan pa ni gzungs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in retention is the retention of the meaning and the words without forgetting them.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du chos bshad kyang spobs pa zad par mi 'gyur ba ni spobs pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du chos bshad kyang spobs pa zad par mi 'gyur ba ni spobs pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in eloquence is the inexhaustible eloquence of the Dharma teaching that lasts until the end of the world.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni shes rab po //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni shes rab po //
translated: Wisdom is the discernment of the general and specific characteristics of all things.

original: chos thams cad stong par khong du chud pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong par khong du chud pa ni ye shes so //
translated: Knowledge is the understanding of the emptiness of all things.

original: dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'chi 'pho ba la sogs pa ston pa ni thabs la mkhas pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'chi 'pho ba la sogs pa ston pa ni thabs la mkhas pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Skill in means is the demonstration of passing away from the Tuṣita heaven, and so on.

original: de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba ni lha'i mig dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des /
analyzed: de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba ni lha'i mig dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des /
translated: He perfects all of them.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan de dag mthong nas bdag nyid kyis kyang de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan de dag mthong nas bdag nyid kyis kyang de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses the divine eye, seeing those qualities of the bodhisattvas in other world-realms, perfects all of them himself.

original: gzugs thams cad mthong ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: gzugs thams cad mthong ba bshad zin to /
translated: The seeing of all forms has been explained.

original: // / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis ma gos par bstan pa'i phyir de dag gi mig de ni gzugs thams cad mthong bas na sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis ma gos par bstan pa'i phyir de dag gi mig de ni gzugs thams cad mthong bas na sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the divine eye is not sullied by adverse elements, it is said that “that eye of theirs is unobstructed because it sees all forms. ”

original: de dag gi mig ces bya ba ni lha'i mig dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mig go //
analyzed: de dag gi mig ces bya ba ni lha'i mig dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mig go //
translated: Their eye is the eye of the bodhisattvas who possess the divine eye.

original: cis kyang ma bsgribs mchod par nye ba dang ring ba la sogs pa'i gzugs thams cad mthong bas na sgrib pa med pa'o //
analyzed: cis kyang ma bsgribs mchod par nye ba dang ring ba la sogs pa'i gzugs thams cad mthong bas na sgrib pa med pa'o //
translated: It is unobstructed because it sees all forms, whether near or far, without any hindrance.

original: gzugs thams cad la mi chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs thams cad mthong ba ni gzugs mdzes pa rnams 'dod chags mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad la mi chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs thams cad mthong ba ni gzugs mdzes pa rnams 'dod chags mi skye ba'o //
translated: It is not attached to any form means that it does not generate desire for beautiful forms.

original: rnam par grol zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang lta ba thams cad kyi bag la nyal dang nyon mongs pa mngon sum du 'byung ba thams cad spangs pas so //
analyzed: rnam par grol zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang lta ba thams cad kyi bag la nyal dang nyon mongs pa mngon sum du 'byung ba thams cad spangs pas so //
translated: It is liberated means that it is free from all latent tendencies of the afflictions, all latent tendencies of views, and all manifest afflictions.

original: rang @191b bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dri ma med cing gzugs gsal bar mthong ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang @191b bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dri ma med cing gzugs gsal bar mthong ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is naturally luminous means that it is naturally stainless and has the characteristic of seeing forms clearly.

original: yul thams cad la mi gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs thams cad la mi rton pa'o //
analyzed: yul thams cad la mi gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs thams cad la mi rton pa'o //
translated: Not dwelling on any object means not relying on any form.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bag la nyal ba thams cad la mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzugs thams cad mthong du zin kyang gzugs mthong ba'i sgo nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skye bar yang mi 'gyur la nyon mongs
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bag la nyal ba thams cad la mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzugs thams cad mthong du zin kyang gzugs mthong ba'i sgo nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skye bar yang mi 'gyur la nyon mongs
translated: Not giving rise to any afflictions or latent tendencies means that even though the eye sees all forms, the afflictions such as attachment and aversion do not arise on the basis of seeing forms, and it does not create the latent tendencies of afflictions.

original: pa'i bag chags la sogs par yang mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i bag chags la sogs par yang mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: the chom med pas na zhes bya ba ni bden pa dang dkon mchog la yid gnyis med pas na zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sgrib par gyur pa'i chos thams cad las kun nas ma langs zhes bya ba'i bar du gcod pa'am /
analyzed: the chom med pas na zhes bya ba ni bden pa dang dkon mchog la yid gnyis med pas na zhes bya ba'i don to // sgrib par gyur pa'i chos thams cad las kun nas ma langs zhes bya ba'i bar du gcod pa'am /
translated: Because of being without doubt, means that because of not having two minds about the truths and the jewels, this is the meaning of because of being without doubt.

original: sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa'i rgyu byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa'i rgyu byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not rising up from all the phenomena that have become obscurations means that it does not act as the cause for the phenomena that become obscurations or obstructions, such as longing for desire and so on.🔽This is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad snang ba la gsal ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mthong bar bya ba la gsal bar mthong ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad snang ba la gsal ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mthong bar bya ba la gsal bar mthong ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase attains clarity in the appearance of all dharmas means that he attains clear vision of all dharmas that are to be seen.

original: ye shes la rton pa ste zhes bya ba ni ye shes la rton pa yin pas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po la mi rton pa ste ;
analyzed: ye shes la rton pa ste zhes bya ba ni ye shes la rton pa yin pas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po la mi rton pa ste ;
translated: The phrase he relies on wisdom means that he does not rely on the great elements of the sense faculties.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it says that he is not an object of consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma chags mi sdang / ma rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gis ma gos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma chags mi sdang / ma rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gis ma gos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase he is not attached, averse, or confused with regard to any affliction means that he is not defiled by desire, hatred, or ignorance.

original: de dag gi mig de ni 'phags pa'i dbang po rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i zhes bya ba las 'phags pa'i dbang po ni dad pa dang dran pa la sogs pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni 'phags pa'i dbang po rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i zhes bya ba las 'phags pa'i dbang po ni dad pa dang dran pa la sogs pa'i dbang po ste /
translated: The phrase that eye of his is conducive to the penetration of the ārya faculties means that the eye of the bodhisattva is conducive to the faculties of faith, mindfulness, and so on.

original: dbang po de dag dang ldan pa'i mig des snang ba mched pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams rtog par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po de dag dang ldan pa'i mig des snang ba mched pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams rtog par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the eye endowed with those faculties discerns the phenomena of the appearance of light, and so on.

original: 'od zer mnyam par gtong bas na zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen pos sems can la mnyam par lta zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'od zer mnyam par gtong bas na zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen pos sems can la mnyam par lta zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It emits light equally means that it looks equally upon sentient beings with great compassion.

original: sems kyis mi dge ba'i chos dang bral bas na zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags pa dang zhe sdang ba dang bral bas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can @192a * //
analyzed: sems kyis mi dge ba'i chos dang bral bas na zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags pa dang zhe sdang ba dang bral bas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can @192a * //
translated: It is free from non-virtuous phenomena of the mind means that it is free from attachment and aversion.

original: ma yin pas na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma yin pas na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not naturally afflicted means that it is not mixed with the stains of afflictions by nature.

original: de dag gi mig de ni bsam pa ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i bsam pa dang ma bral bas na /
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni bsam pa ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i bsam pa dang ma bral bas na /
translated: That eye of theirs is not without intention means that it is not separated from the intention to attain omniscient wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan thams cad mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin las skyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan thams cad mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin las skyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the eyes of the Buddha Bhagavān are born from the nature of omniscience.

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang bral bas na ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang bral bas na ma chags pa'o //
translated: Free from attachment and aversion means that because of being free from attachment, they are non-attached.

original: de dag gi mig de ni don gyi spyod yul bden pas nye bar bsgrubs shing chos rnam par dag pa shes pa'i lam la ma chags par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi don la dmigs pa las byung ba ni ma yin gyis /
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni don gyi spyod yul bden pas nye bar bsgrubs shing chos rnam par dag pa shes pa'i lam la ma chags par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi don la dmigs pa las byung ba ni ma yin gyis /
translated: Their eyes are the domain of objects, accomplished by truth, and engage in the path of knowing the pure Dharma without attachment means that they do not arise from observing objects that are mistaken,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa phyin ci ma log pa la dmigs pa las byung bas na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa shes par bya ba la thags thogs med par spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa phyin ci ma log pa la dmigs pa las byung bas na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa shes par bya ba la thags thogs med par spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but because they arise from observing non-mistaken ultimate truth, they engage in knowing the pure realm of phenomena without obstruction. This is the meaning.

original: mi mthun ba'i phyogs kyis ma gos pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: mi mthun ba'i phyogs kyis ma gos pa bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of being unstained by adverse factors is complete.

original: // / rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the cause, it is said:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Why is it so?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi lha'i mig de ci'i phyir gong du bshad pa lta bu yin zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi lha'i mig de ci'i phyir gong du bshad pa lta bu yin zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why is the divine eye of those bodhisattvas as explained above?

original: skyes bu dam pa de dag ni snying rje chen po la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa las /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa de dag ni snying rje chen po la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa las /
translated: Those holy beings abide in great compassion, etc.

original: snying rje chen po la gnas pa'i rgyu las byung bas na de dag gi lha'i mig kyang gong du bshad pa lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying rje chen po la gnas pa'i rgyu las byung bas na de dag gi lha'i mig kyang gong du bshad pa lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it arises from the cause of abiding in great compassion, their divine eye also has the qualities as explained above.

original: tshig lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the remaining words.

original: chos rnams rig pa ni bshad par bya ba'i chos thams cad rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams rig pa ni bshad par bya ba'i chos thams cad rig pa'o //
translated: Knowing phenomena means knowing all the phenomena to be explained.

original: don shin tu rtogs pa ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: don shin tu rtogs pa ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud pa'o //
translated: Fully understanding the meaning means comprehending the characteristic of emptiness.

original: kha na ma tho pa med pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi byed pas so //
analyzed: kha na ma tho pa med pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi byed pas so //
translated: Being free from wrongdoing means not engaging in sinful unwholesome phenomena.

original: ji ltar mthong ba dang thos pa bzhin du chos smra ba ni ji ltar mthong ba dang thos pa las skyed skur byas te /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba dang thos pa bzhin du chos smra ba ni ji ltar mthong ba dang thos pa las skyed skur byas te /
translated: As he has seen and heard, the Dharma teacher should speak in accordance with what he has seen and heard,

original: sgro mi 'dogs pa dang skur ba mi byed pas so //
analyzed: sgro mi 'dogs pa dang skur ba mi byed pas so //
translated: without exaggeration or denigration.

original: mi dge ba mi bsnyil pa ni mi dge ba'i spyod pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba mi bsnyil pa ni mi dge ba'i spyod pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not diminish the unwholesome, because he has abandoned unwholesome conduct in every way.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi snying po la thob par @192b bya ba la gcig tu mos shing sgrub par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi snying po la thob par @192b bya ba la gcig tu mos shing sgrub par byed pa'i don to //
translated: “He is intent on the site of enlightenment” means that he is intent on attaining the site of enlightenment and is dedicated to its practice.

original: sems gong du yang thogs pa med ces bya ba ni de'i sems kyi dngos po thams cad ma lus par shes par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems gong du yang thogs pa med ces bya ba ni de'i sems kyi dngos po thams cad ma lus par shes par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “His mind is unobstructed with regard to what is higher” means that he knows all the things that are in his mind without exception.

original: brtson 'grus sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus la 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus la 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: “He is dedicated to the practice of effort” means that he is dedicated to the practice of effort.

original: bsam gtan gyi yan lag ston pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa sgom pa'i thabs ston pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi yan lag ston pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa sgom pa'i thabs ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the branches of meditation is the teaching of the means of cultivating the first, second, etc. meditations.

original: shes rab kyi mig sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi mig sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi mig sbyin pa'o //
translated: The gift of the eye of wisdom is the gift of the eye of wisdom which correctly understands things.

original: lam ngan pa la zhugs pa ni mu stegs can rnams so //
analyzed: lam ngan pa la zhugs pa ni mu stegs can rnams so //
translated: Those who have entered bad paths are the heterodox.

original: lam ston pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: lam ston pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the path is the teaching of the noble path with its eight parts.

original: dman pa la mos pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dman pa la mos pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are devoted to the inferior are those who have entered the vehicles of the disciples and the solitary sages.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po rtog par byed ces bya ba ni de dag las bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sogs pa rtog par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po rtog par byed ces bya ba ni de dag las bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sogs pa rtog par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The teaching of the great vehicle is the teaching of the ten perfections, etc.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa la 'jog par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa la 'jog par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “To introduce to the wisdom of omniscience” means to establish in the attainment of the wisdom of omniscience, which is characterized by non-conceptuality.

original: byang chub yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir de'i rgyur gyur pa'i lha'i mig ma nyams pa zin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir de'i rgyur gyur pa'i lha'i mig ma nyams pa zin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “In order to perfect enlightenment” means in order to attain unsurpassed enlightenment for oneself. The meaning is that one becomes the cause of that by retaining the divine eye that is unimpaired.

original: lha'i mig mngon par shes pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: lha'i mig mngon par shes pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The superknowledge of the divine eye has been explained.

original: // / tshig mngon sum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / tshig mngon sum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the direct words,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i rna ba mngon par shes pa mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i rna ba mngon par shes pa mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “What is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable superknowledge of the divine ear?” and so forth.

original: de mi zad pa yang rna ba des dmigs par bya ba'i sgra zad mi shes pas de la dmigs par byed pa'i lha'i rna ba yang zad mi shes pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de mi zad pa yang rna ba des dmigs par bya ba'i sgra zad mi shes pas de la dmigs par byed pa'i lha'i rna ba yang zad mi shes pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
translated: It is inexhaustible because the sound that is the object of that divine ear is inexhaustible, and the divine ear that focuses on it is also inexhaustible.

original: yang na 'og nas de'i rna ba'i khams de chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i tshul gyi lha'i rna ba de'i rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pas chos kyi dbyings de la zad pa med
analyzed: yang na 'og nas de'i rna ba'i khams de chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i tshul gyi lha'i rna ba de'i rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pas chos kyi dbyings de la zad pa med
translated: Alternatively, it is inexhaustible because the nature of that divine ear is the nature of the dharmadhātu, as will be stated later in the verse, “That ear element of his is the utterly pure dharmadhātu.”

original: pa'i phyir lha'i rna ba yang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir lha'i rna ba yang mi zad pa'o //
translated: The dharmadhātu is inexhaustible, and therefore the divine ear is also inexhaustible.

original: de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that this divine ear is of nine types:

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad las khyad @193a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad las khyad @193a * //
translated: the divine ear that is mundane, the divine ear that is supramundane, the divine ear that is connected with the śrāvakas, the divine ear that is connected with the pratyekabuddhas, the divine ear that is connected with the bodhisattvas, the divine ear that is connected with the tathāgatas, the divine ear that is connected with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, the divine ear that is connected with the bodhisattvas and tathāgatas, and the divine ear that is connected with all of them.

original: par du gyur pa dang / sgra thams cad la dmigs pa dang / rgyu gang las byung ba shes pa dang / 'bras bu gang las 'byung ba shes pa dang / rgyud dang 'bras bu mi mthun pa shes pa dang / gnyis ka'i cha la nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: par du gyur pa dang / sgra thams cad la dmigs pa dang / rgyu gang las byung ba shes pa dang / 'bras bu gang las 'byung ba shes pa dang / rgyud dang 'bras bu mi mthun pa shes pa dang / gnyis ka'i cha la nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of the origin of all sounds, the knowledge of the origin of all results, the knowledge of the dissimilarity of the continuum and the result, the absence of afflictions in both parts,

original: dus gsum ma 'dres pa shes pa dang / las dang rgyu'o //🔽lha thams cad kyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dus gsum ma 'dres pa shes pa dang / las dang rgyu'o // lha thams cad kyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: the knowledge of the unmixed three times, and the knowledge of karma and its causes.

original: ches 'od gsal zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa las khyad zhugs pa bstan to //🔽lha'i rna ba des zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ches 'od gsal zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa las khyad zhugs pa bstan to // lha'i rna ba des zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Starting from all the gods up to very clear shows the superiority over the mundane and supramundane.

original: skra de dag thams cad kyang thos so zhes bya ba yan chad kyis sgra thams cad la dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: skra de dag thams cad kyang thos so zhes bya ba yan chad kyis sgra thams cad la dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: Starting from with that divine ear up to hears all those hairs shows the observation of all sounds.

original: sems kyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sems kyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Starting from the observation of the mind up to the observation of the mind shows the observation of the mind.

original: las 'byung ba thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu gang las 'byung ba shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: las 'byung ba thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu gang las 'byung ba shes pa bstan to //
translated: Up to here, the knowledge of the cause from which they arise is shown.

original: ngag gi las dge ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ngag gi las dge ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From the beginning of the wholesome cause of verbal action,🔽up to the complete retention of the cause of the indeterminate, he knows all of them just as they are.

original: lung du mi ston pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa de dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'bras bu gang 'byung ba shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: lung du mi ston pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa de dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'bras bu gang 'byung ba shes pa bstan to //
translated: Up to here, the knowledge of the effect that arises is shown.

original: 'dod chags bag la nyal zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ;
analyzed: 'dod chags bag la nyal zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ;
translated: From the beginning of the latent tendency of desire,🔽up to the knowledge of the unobstructed supernormal knowledge of the divine ear, he knows all of them just as they are.

original: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes thogs pa med pa des yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mi mthun pa shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes thogs pa med pa des yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mi mthun pa shes pa bstan to //
translated: Up to here, the knowledge of the discordance of cause and effect is shown.

original: de dag gi lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes des 'phags pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ;
analyzed: de dag gi lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes des 'phags pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ;
translated: By means of the knowledge of the superknowledge of the divine ear, beginning with “noble” and so on,

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra la snying rje chen po 'thob bo zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gnyi ga'i cha la nyon mongs pa med pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra la snying rje chen po 'thob bo zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gnyi ga'i cha la nyon mongs pa med pa bstan to //
translated: up to “attains great compassion for the sounds of those who are not noble,” it shows the absence of afflictions in both aspects.

original: sgra thams cad la yang sngon gyi mtha' dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas dus su ma 'dres pa shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: sgra thams cad la yang sngon gyi mtha' dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas dus su ma 'dres pa shes pa bstan to //
translated: “In all sounds, the past limit” and so on shows the knowledge of the unmixed in time.

original: de dag lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes des zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de dag lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes des zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: “By means of the knowledge of the superknowledge of the divine ear” and so on,

original: sems can gang dag chos shes par byed pa ma yin pa de dag ni mi thos so zhes bya ba yan chad kyi sa las bstan to //
analyzed: sems can gang dag chos shes par byed pa ma yin pa de dag ni mi thos so zhes bya ba yan chad kyi sa las bstan to //
translated: up to “those sentient beings who are not causes of knowing the Dharma do not hear,” it shows the result.

original: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: “That ear element of theirs, the realm of phenomena” and so on,

original: lha'i snyan du bsngos pa zhes bya ba @193b yan chad kyis rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: lha'i snyan du bsngos pa zhes bya ba @193b yan chad kyis rgyu bstan to //
translated: up to “dedicated to the divine ear,” shows the cause.

original: gong du lha'i mig gi skabs su bshad pa dang don mthun pa'i tshig rnams 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: gong du lha'i mig gi skabs su bshad pa dang don mthun pa'i tshig rnams 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: The words that have the same meaning as those explained above in the context of the divine eye are not explained here.

original: sems kyi dmigs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa gang dag gis sems can de dag gi ngag gi las 'byung ba thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can de dag gi tshig rab tu smra ba de'i rgyu ni sems
analyzed: sems kyi dmigs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa gang dag gis sems can de dag gi ngag gi las 'byung ba thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can de dag gi tshig rab tu smra ba de'i rgyu ni sems
translated: The phrase all the verbal actions that arise in those sentient beings, due to virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral objects of mind, he knows them all just as they are means that the cause of those sentient beings' verbal expressions is the virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral phenomena that are the objects of mind.

original: kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i chos la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i chos la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The objects of mind are the virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral phenomena.

original: de dag gi sems kyi chos gang la dmigs nas ngag gi las tshig tu smra ba ni sgra gang byung ba'i rgyu rnams kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gi sems kyi chos gang la dmigs nas ngag gi las tshig tu smra ba ni sgra gang byung ba'i rgyu rnams kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he knows the causes of whatever sounds arise, the phenomena of the mind that are the objects of which the verbal actions of speech arise.

original: rgyu gang las byung ba shes pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu gang las byung ba shes pa bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of the knowledge of the causes from which they arise is finished.

original: ngag gi las gang dge ba'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni sems can de dag gis tshig tu smra ba de dag thos nas tshig de dag smras pa'i rgyus 'bras bu ci dang cir 'gyur ba phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ngag gi las gang dge ba'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni sems can de dag gis tshig tu smra ba de dag thos nas tshig de dag smras pa'i rgyus 'bras bu ci dang cir 'gyur ba phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i don to //
translated: The statement that “the speech of those sentient beings who hear the speech that is the cause for taking up virtue, etc., is not mistaken with regard to the cause and result of that speech” is the meaning of the statement that “the speech of those sentient beings who hear the speech that is the cause for taking up virtue, etc., is not mistaken with regard to the cause and result of that speech.”

original: 'bras bu gang byung ba yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang byung ba yang bshad zin to //
translated: The result that arises has already been explained.🔽The statement that “the speech of those sentient beings who hear the speech that is the cause for taking up virtue, etc., is not mistaken with regard to the cause and result of that speech” is the meaning of the statement that “the speech of those sentient beings who hear the speech that is the cause for taking up virtue, etc., is not mistaken with regard to the cause and result of that speech.”🔽The result that arises has already been explained.

original: 'dod chags bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang sdang ba dang 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum las gcig ni tshig mngon par smra ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin par ston /
analyzed: 'dod chags bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang sdang ba dang 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum las gcig ni tshig mngon par smra ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin par ston /
translated: The statement that “the speech of those sentient beings who hear the speech that is the cause for taking up virtue, etc., is not mistaken with regard to the cause and result of that speech” is the meaning of the statement that “the speech of those sentient beings who hear the speech that is the cause for taking up virtue, etc., is not mistaken with regard to the cause and result of that speech.”

original: gcig ni grogs yin par ston te /
analyzed: gcig ni grogs yin par ston te /
translated: The result that arises has already been explained.

original: de la 'dod chags bag la nyal la sdang bas 'byin pa ni tshig 'byung ba'i gzhi 'dod chags las blangs la /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags bag la nyal la sdang bas 'byin pa ni tshig 'byung ba'i gzhi 'dod chags las blangs la /
translated: The statement that “the speech of those sentient beings who hear the speech that is the cause for taking up virtue, etc., is not mistaken with regard to the cause and result of that speech” is the meaning of the statement that “the speech of those sentient beings who hear the speech that is the cause for taking up virtue, etc., is not mistaken with regard to the cause and result of that speech.”🔽The result that arises has already been explained.🔽The statement that “the speech of those sentient beings who hear the speech that is the cause for taking up virtue, etc., is not mistaken with regard to the cause and result of that speech” is the meaning of the statement that “the speech of those sentient beings who hear the speech that is the cause for taking up virtue, etc., is not mistaken with regard

original: 'dod chags dngos su ma byung bar bag la nyal te zhe sdang dngos su byung bas tshig tu smras pas shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dngos su ma byung bar bag la nyal te zhe sdang dngos su byung bas tshig tu smras pas shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, since hatred actually occurred, it was understood through verbal expression, while attachment did not actually occur, but was latent.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the rest.

original: ngag gi las gang bsam pa dag la sbyor ba nyams pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽bsam pa ma nor la tshig tu smra ba'i sbyor ba 'khrul zhing nor ba dang / tshig tu smra ba'i sbyor ba ma nor ma 'khrul la /
analyzed: ngag gi las gang bsam pa dag la sbyor ba nyams pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / bsam pa ma nor la tshig tu smra ba'i sbyor ba 'khrul zhing nor ba dang / tshig tu smra ba'i sbyor ba ma nor ma 'khrul la /
translated: As for the verbal action, it is said that “the application is impaired in regard to the thought.”🔽The application of verbal expression is mistaken and erroneous, while the thought is unmistaken.

original: bsam pa 'khrul ba la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa 'khrul ba la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par shes pa la bya'o //
translated: The application of verbal expression is unmistaken and non-erroneous, while the thought is mistaken and so on.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi mthun par shes pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi mthun par shes pa bshad zin to //
translated: The understanding of cause and effect that is contrary to this has been explained.

original: 'phags pa'i sgra ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsungs pa dang / chos 'chad pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i sgra ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsungs pa dang / chos 'chad pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The sound of the noble ones is the sound of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas speaking, and the sound of teaching the Dharma.

original: @194a * // 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra ni so so'i skye bo rnams 'ong ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa tha snyad sna tshogs kyi sgra 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: @194a * // 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra ni so so'i skye bo rnams 'ong ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa tha snyad sna tshogs kyi sgra 'byin pa'o //
translated: The sound of the non-noble is the sound of the various conventions of ordinary people, such as coming and going.

original: 'phags pa'i sgra la byams pa chen po 'thob cing zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi sgra thos nas chos bshad pa'i sgra 'dis sems can thams cad la phan btags so zhes sgra de la bdag nyid byams pa chen po'i sems bskyed pa'o //🔽'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra la snying rje chen po 'thob ces bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi smra ba'i sgra ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na sdug bsngal sna tshogs bskyed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes snying rje
analyzed: 'phags pa'i sgra la byams pa chen po 'thob cing zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi sgra thos nas chos bshad pa'i sgra 'dis sems can thams cad la phan btags so zhes sgra de la bdag nyid byams pa chen po'i sems bskyed pa'o // 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra la snying rje chen po 'thob ces bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi smra ba'i sgra ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung bas na sdug bsngal sna tshogs bskyed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes snying rje
translated: In the sound of the noble, one attains great love means that, having heard the sound of the noble ones, one generates the thought of great love toward that sound, thinking This sound of Dharma explanation benefits all sentient beings.

original: chen po'i sems skye'o //
analyzed: chen po'i sems skye'o //
translated: In the sound of the non-noble, one attains great compassion means that one generates the thought of great compassion, thinking The sound of speech of ordinary people arises from the causes of attachment, aversion, and so on, and is thus the cause for producing various sufferings.

original: gnyi ga'i cha la nyon mongs pa med pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha la nyon mongs pa med pa bshad zin to //
translated: The absence of affliction in both aspects has been explained.

original: sgra thams cad la yang sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'das pa'i sgra dang ma 'ongs pa'i sgra gang yin pa bye brag phyed par shes pa ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i bar bye brag 'byed pa shes pa zhes
analyzed: sgra thams cad la yang sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'das pa'i sgra dang ma 'ongs pa'i sgra gang yin pa bye brag phyed par shes pa ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i bar bye brag 'byed pa shes pa zhes
translated: The knowledge of distinguishing the sound of the past and the sound of the future is called the knowledge of distinguishing the past and the future.

original: bya ste / shes pa des sgra 'di dag ni 'das pa'i tshig yin no zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: bya ste / shes pa des sgra 'di dag ni 'das pa'i tshig yin no zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
translated: By that knowledge, one knows as it really is that these sounds are words of the past.

original: de ltar dus gnyis kyi sgra bye brag phyed par shes na /
analyzed: de ltar dus gnyis kyi sgra bye brag phyed par shes na /
translated: Thus, if one knows how to distinguish the sounds of the two times,

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi tshig kyang shes par mngon pa'i phyir mdo las ma gsungs te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi tshig kyang shes par mngon pa'i phyir mdo las ma gsungs te /
translated: one will also know the words of the present time. Therefore, it is not mentioned in the sutra.

original: dus gsum 'dres pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: dus gsum 'dres pa bshad zin to //
translated: The mixing of the three times has already been explained.

original: dran pa ni thos pa'i chos rnams kyi tshig dang don ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni thos pa'i chos rnams kyi tshig dang don ma brjed pa'o //
translated: Recollection is not forgetting the words and meanings of the Dharma that one has heard.

original: shes bzhin ni chos de rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid bye brag phyed pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni chos de rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid bye brag phyed pa'o //
translated: Alertness is the distinction of the general and specific characteristics of those Dharmas.

original: de gnyis mi brjed pa dang bye brag phyed par byed pas na dran pa dang shes bzhin gnyis la mi brjed pa'i chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis mi brjed pa dang bye brag phyed par byed pas na dran pa dang shes bzhin gnyis la mi brjed pa'i chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since those two are not forgotten and are distinguished, mindfulness and introspection are called the “nature of nonforgetting.”

original: sems can rnams la dran par byed ces bya ba ni thos pa'i chos de dag sems can la ston cing sems can rnams kyang mi brjed pa'i chos nyid la 'jog par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can rnams la dran par byed ces bya ba ni thos pa'i chos de dag sems can la ston cing sems can rnams kyang mi brjed pa'i chos nyid la 'jog par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “They cause sentient beings to be mindful” means that they teach those dharmas that are heard to sentient beings and cause sentient beings to be established in the nature of nonforgetting.

original: snying po dang snying po ma yin pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: snying po dang snying po ma yin pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for “the dharmas that are the essence and the dharmas that are not the essence,”

original: don dam pa bstan pa'i chos rnams ni snying po'i chos so //
analyzed: don dam pa bstan pa'i chos rnams ni snying po'i chos so //
translated: the dharmas that teach the ultimate are the essence dharmas.

original: kun rdzob tu chos bstan pa thams cad ni snying po ma yin pa'i chos te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos bstan pa thams cad ni snying po ma yin pa'i chos te /
translated: All the dharmas that teach conventionally are the dharmas that are not the essence.

original: sems can rnams mi brjed pa'i chos nyid la bkod pas /
analyzed: sems can rnams mi brjed pa'i chos nyid la bkod pas /
translated: Since they cause sentient beings to be established in the nature of nonforgetting,

original: snying po dang snying po ma yin @194b pa'i chos rnams kyang sems can de ngag gis rab tu shes so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: snying po dang snying po ma yin @194b pa'i chos rnams kyang sems can de ngag gis rab tu shes so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: they also know through those sentient beings the dharmas that are the essence and the dharmas that are not the essence.

original: gang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sgra gang dag thos pa de dag kyang dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis dus dus su brjod do zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de sngon gzhan las dge ba'i sgra thos pa dang /
analyzed: gang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sgra gang dag thos pa de dag kyang dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis dus dus su brjod do zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de sngon gzhan las dge ba'i sgra thos pa dang /
translated: Whatever sounds he hears, whether virtuous, nonvirtuous or neutral, he speaks at the appropriate time through mindfulness and vigilance.

original: mi dge ba'i sgra thos pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sgra thos pa rnams kyang smra bar bya ba'i snod dang dus su sbyar te sgra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sgra thos pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sgra thos pa rnams kyang smra bar bya ba'i snod dang dus su sbyar te sgra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the bodhisattva speaks at the appropriate time and place to those who are vessels for hearing virtuous sounds, nonvirtuous sounds and neutral sounds.

original: snod dang sbyar ba ni gal te sems can de dag chos bshad pa'i snod yin na ni smra'i /
analyzed: snod dang sbyar ba ni gal te sems can de dag chos bshad pa'i snod yin na ni smra'i /
translated: To be a vessel means that if those sentient beings are vessels for explaining the Dharma, he speaks.
